description:
My boyfriend and I were craving some Cajun seafood style food while on our trip to SF. Thanks to yelp we were able to find this place. We were a bit skeptical at first because of the reviews but we decided to give this place a try.

We arrived during happy hour so a lot of items were at a cheaper price. Happy hour is DINE-IN only and does not apply during holidays! I decided to order a pound of shrimp ($15.50/ lb) with hurricane cajun sauce and mild spiciness. My boyfriend opted for the crawfish since it was live and it's rare that we come across places that have live crawfish. I can't recall the price on the top of my head since it was marked as "market price" which was subject to change. We also ordered some fries and chicken wings (~$6 during happy hour). 

I loved the way the served their shrimp! Instead of having it in a plastic bag, they served their seafood in a round steel container which kept the seafood hot. The hurricane sauce was also delicious with just the right amount of garlic chunks. If you do want extra garlic, they do charge for it! The shrimp itself was also good, it wasn't mushy from being overcooked at all. The wings and fries were also seasoned very well and to die for. My boyfriend ended up ordering another box of fries to go (that's how much he loved it!). Our dining experience was that good we told our friends about this and all of us ended up going again the next day. Definitely try this place out if you don't want a super long wait for delicious cajun seafood!
author: Diana L.

description:
Had lunch with my girlfriend yesterday and swamp is the spot to go too. Until yesterday, we had noticed that the crab was not cooked properly, undercooked.

We told the server and she just laughed it off and said, everything here is cooked and frozen, we just cook it again. I repeated what she said just to clarify and she said yes.

Never again. Thanks for the truth, but why pay $45 for crab when it's not even fresh.
author: Amy R.

description:
I came here about a year or two ago when they still had the buy one pound of crawfish, get one pound free deal. When I came here with a group of people last time, we all enjoyed the food and the sauce. 

I was in the area again last night with my husband and his friend, so my husband and I were excited to try it again. We were disappointed that the yelp deal was no longer available. It became obvious pretty quickly that this place is now under new management. The service was pretty terrible. They were clearly understaffed with just two people serving, so I tried to give them the benefit of the doubt. But it took them a long time to seat all three of the groups that were waiting for a table even though there were tables available. Once we were seated, we sat for about 15 min and none of the staff even realized that our order had not been taken yet. The table next to us, who came in after us had long had their order taken already. We finally flagged down the younger server and asked for hot water for my friend and to order our food. She left and never came back, she started putting together silverware instead. We flagged her down again and she realized she has forgotten the hot water, but we just asked to take our order. It then became clear that she didn't speak English, if she did, she spoke very little. She had to get the older woman to take our order. The younger server seemed very oblivious the entire time we were there, and the service was all over the place. I noticed another table waiting a long time to try and flag down a server for their check.

I've been a server before, and even though they were understaffed, they didn't try and anticipate or meet the customers' needs at all. They weren't hustling to try and make up for being understaffed. Even when they weren't actively serving tables, they disappeared and did other random things. They never anticipated when someone needed their check, or checked in on the tables, or refilled the waters. 

Our food also came out at separate times, even though we all ordered similarly. Our friend got his food much faster than we did. The food itself was good. I had originally wanted crawfish but they were out. So my husband and I each ordered a pound of shrimp. The shrimp were big and pretty fresh. The sauce was good, my husband really likes it, although it was a little runnier/thinner than I like. Overall the food was good, not sure if it would be enough inducement to go back again with the poor service and how long the meal took.
author: Vannlyda I.

description:
Ordered 1lb of garlic butter shrimp with hot link. Placed order online through yelp and delivery was sooner than expected. 

Food smelled great. 

Shrimp heads were bloody when removed from tail. My friend and I ate half and immediately started to have stomach upset. It caused both of us the worst cramping and (apologies for the expletive) expulsion of bowel contents. 

I will never ever order from then again. I highly recommend against.
author: Sheila R.

description:
I don't eat seafood, so I got a few random plates:

Garlic noodles - pretty good! Very garlicky and lots of noodles.

Cajun wings - chicken wings with Cajun sauce. Not bad. 

Fried chicken tenders - good! The chicken tenders have a light deep fried layer of batter. Comes with tartar sauce for dipping. It's like ordering fish and chips... except it's chicken, and there's no chips.

My girlfriend got 1 pound of shrimp with hurricane sauce. She absolutely devoured it. Safe to say she really liked it here. It's not as good as Boiling Crab but it is the closest thing to it without going all the way to San Jose.

Next time I come back, I want to try the Cajun fries!
author: Wesley S.

description:
I remembered Swamp to be a little better than what it was but my most recent visit will probably be my last. 

I always order the 2 item combo, 1 lb with shrimp, clams, and sausage ($15.50). Their garlic butter sauce is pretty good, with loads of garlic but no spice. Their hurricane Cajun sauce is weak. I got mild spiciness and my boyfriend got medium - they both ended up tasting the same and only a hint of spice. The sauce is also very thin, almost like a soup. Additionally, we always get their garlic noodles, which are decent but not spectacular. 

Before, getting one pound of the shrimp/clams + garlic noodles filled me up and I would leave with no room for dessert. I feel that their portions have gotten significantly smaller. There were probably only 8 shrimps in my bowl and a lot of the clams were just the shell. I figured maybe the clams were at the bottom of the bowl, but I only found one.. so they really were just the shells. My boyfriend and I were both not full nor satisfied when we left. 

Service wasn't great, but probably because they were understaffed. It was difficult to flag down a server because they were either not on the floor or not paying attention. I would skip out on Swamp if you're looking for flavorful Cajun seafood.
author: Cecille W.

description:
I ordered take out for a family dinner and thought it was just okay. They gave us a box to hold everything in, but the sauce ended up leaking from their containers and got everywhere... Not sure why they dont just give you the bags they serve in the restaurant, would have been a lot more efficient and cleaner. 

As for the food, I LOVE the hurricane sauce, garlic butter was good, but was outshined haha. I got to try clams, mussels, crawfish, and shrimp - all super delicious and meaty. None of it was overcooked. I added in some hot sausages and corn and it was a perfect meal!
author: Carrie L.

description: A group of us ended up here for drinks and small bites after Outsidelands on a Friday night. They were quick to accommodate a huge group of 8 for us. For food, we had an array of cajun fries, fried shrimp, fried calamari, and garlic noodles. As for drinks, we had a bottle of their sake ($30), which the server was amazing to offer us in hot and cold. Our server Benjamin was so great that we ended up getting a second bottle of sake. He truly went above and beyond to get us everything we needed and even joined in on our laughs and fun.
author: Cindy Z.

description:
One of the worst dining experiences in recent memory. 

I called in to ask if they were able to fry shrimp coconut style. I didn't see it on the menu but they assured me that they would be able to do that. I asked again to make sure before we headed there and they said they could.

We get there and the place is not busy at all. They take their time seating us, and then make us move tables for no reason at all (it was just my girlfriend and I). I am pretty laid back so I didn't have an issue. 

We ordered, and I made sure to have our waitress say twice that they could do fried coconut shrimp, as my girlfriend is picky with her crustaceans. They said yes.

Our food comes out, I ordered the Shrimp, Mussels, and Crawfish bowl with corn + potatoes. My girlfriend's food comes out and it was their bowl of coconut shrimp (coconut sauce, not fried coconut-style). She was very disappointed but we understood it must have been an issue with communication and the waitress/restaurant misunderstood what we meant by fried coconut-style. Since we had triple checked that it was going to be fried, and my girlfriend would not eat the boiled/sauce style, we simply asked for our waitress to take it back to the kitchen. She wouldn't eat it, not a single bite. 

Our waitress argued with us and said we were wrong and thats what we had ordered. She said it was our fault, and was refusing to take it back without payment. I said there was no way we should pay for something that we didn't eat when the misunderstanding went both ways. She stood there and said we were wrong, in front of other guests. It was embarrassing.

She finally took the food away and told us she would take it off of the bill. At that point I honestly didn't care, I just wanted her to go away. I finished my food, which was good but not anything special. I'm from Georgia so I'm familiar with Cajun food (even though this is C'asian).

The bill comes and the coconut boiled shrimp has been taken off of the bill, but $7 was added to my bill for some arbitrary reason. It was like they had to charge me some way for the food that we did not eat or want. 

Overall it was a very unpleasant and uncomfortable, as well as embarrassing, experience. I've worked as a server for 7+ years and never, ever, have I argued with a customer and told them they're wrong about an order and that they have to pay for something they didn't touch. The place also seemed dirty and poorly managed.

I still left a 15% tip but I will never give this place my money again. Go elsewhere.
author: Paul S.

description:
It's been a long time since we had last dined here but we were in the neighborhood and decided to give their Happy Hour a try.  Not bad for the prices, food is tasty with flavors but service was lacking unfortunately.  It took a good 10 minutes before someone came to greet and seat us, the hostess was running around in the back with only 2 tables of customers in the front.  We had a few questions about the menu and the waitress/hostess was quite short with us.

Overall, not a deal breaker since their garlic noodles makes up for it.  Always consistent and buttery.  Pair that with a crab and you are solid!
author: Janetto L.

description:
Update: I just had to call out that this meal MIGHT have kicked my husband out of ketosis. But we had just come from a weekend trip to Reno where we wondered if some of the buffet food had carbs AND he did admit to literally drinking the hurricane sauce (it's the best) which tasted a bit sweeter than the other sauces. I had 2-3 pieces from this boil and stuck with the coconut curry and garlic butter and I'm still burning that fat.

Overall, Swamp is good for a keto cheat meal...just don't splurge on the hurricane.
author: Michele A.

description: Really good!  The lemon garlic butter is awesome!  Garlic noodles are a must order and also the green beans.  We had crawfish, shrimp and mussels which were all good.
author: Erin D.

description:
It was good. If you're looking for Crawfish: don't go to SF.
 
The crawfish was in season (was here last Friday) so don't get me wrong: it was good.. but for half a pound: I highly doubt it was actually half a pound (for the 2 item combo 1/2 lb x 1/2 lb of your shellfish item choices).

Like in San Jose: they give you heaps. Unlike the Cajun  Shellfish/Crawfish establishments in San Jose: your food comes in a bowl and not in a saturated bag. 

It's probably more worth it here to get the other shellfish options.
Personally, I don't eat a lot of shrimp, so I'd probably do clams all the way or something. My cousins don't eat crawfish at all, but they love the shrimp and the other shellfish options here.

I got the Thai Curry Sauce and it was really good. I wasn't sure what to expect but it definitely didn't disappoint.  

-

At the time of ordering: 

The lady here will try to get you add order more things to increase your bill, but you just move along and say no.

-

Food was good. The hot links (side) were good.. 
I wish I ordered rice with it. 

-

Fried Catfish & Calamari appetizers were also good.
author: Lilian L.

description:
Ok look, this place IS THE BUSINESS. Talking big portions talking delicious? Juicy savory and quality piping hot king crab which is my jam. My 5 stars is simply due to when you're craving crab, go here it's 100z The pricing; Bring a bill and a half for a full bang at this thing with a date for the king crab, apps and drinks . But! So so damn good. 
Cheers
author: Jared W.

description:
I went around 9:45PM and it was not too busy because they were close to closing. The customer service was great because even though they were close to closing, I never felt rushed or anything along those lines. The waitress was very accommodating with water refills, more napkins, and limes. 

The mild hurricane sauce was mouthwatering and compliments the shrimp, crawfish, and mussels very well. I also got cajun fries which were great and the garlic noodles are delicious as well. 

Overall, customer service was great and so was the food! I'll definitely be coming back :)
author: An L.

description:
The boyfriend and I arrived at 2:30p on a Saturday, and it wasn't too busy. We got seated right away. There was a party of 11 seated right across from us. All family members. We knew our food was going to take a minute to get to us due to the large party. I didn't seem to worry since I was enjoying their happy hour beer, $4.25 for a pint of Corona. They have an awesome selection of beers on tap. Our Cajun fries didn't take long to arrive. Small size but good flavor. The server gave us bibs and a big bowl to put shells in. After the party of 11 received all their food, we received ours. I ordered their 1 lb of hurricane Cajun shrimp with medium spiciness. 7/10

The food was 4/5. Service 5/5. Beer section 5/5 

However, I do want to address an issue I had with my experience. While I was eating, I kept hearing the large party complain about every little thing ( the price, the slowness, the attitude of the staff, the selection of hot sauce ). I was truly embarrassed with the situation. When the large party got the bill, they were unhappy with the required tip for large parties. They were complaining among themselves on why they had to pay almost $60 in tip. When one of them discussed it with the server, the server explained very calmly how they charge a 15% gratuity tip for parties of 6 or larger. The lady complained how it was ridiculous they were being charge that much "since the service was slow and the food had no flavor." I don't know what this lady was expecting. Every restaurant I have been to requires a gratuity tip for large parties. It sucks but I understand. The lady kept saying how she was going to leave a horrible review on Yelp. I'm giving five stars to this location because of the way they handle this rude ass lady.
author: Claudia N.

description:
Stopped by SWAMP for dinner on our way to a show at the Fillmore on Saturday, 5/5/18.
It's a dark little restaurant, but the menu had a lot of selections, the Server took our order and brought drinks quickly.
The food was good.  I ordered the fried catfish and hush puppies.  Catfish was alright, the hush puppies were hard and dry.  Where they did really well was the Crawfish and the "Boil".  You get to pick your sauce and degree of heat.  The Crawfish with lemon pepper was really good!  My Fiance ordered the "3- item Combination Boil" with Prawns, Mussels, Clams and Corn on the cob.  He picked the Hurricane Sauce, medium, and it was just the right amount of heat....nice, and not too crazy.  The Prawns were huge and everything was really tasty and fresh.  We will come back again for the Boil and Crawfish.
author: Christine Z.

description:
As of the new year, the ownership has changed and it's so disappointing. 

We used to come here because of the Yelp check-in, Groupon and because it's closer than driving to San Jose and waiting for hours to get a table. 

Since the new ownership, the service has been frantic and neglectful. Even when it's not a full house, they don't seem have to a system. When it is busy, it's worse. 

The food is still decent if you can put with up with the lack of customer service. That's what we thought until the last time we went. 

[SPOILER ALERT - we won't be going back.]

As usual, we came with a Groupon and check-in via Yelp. We were about to pay and then they said we couldn't use both and that it said on the promotions that only one could be used. Okay, fair... if it were true. 

We didn't want to put up a fight or cause a scene but while they were ringing us up, we looked at both promotions and NEITHER one said that you could only use one at a time. When we showed it to the waiter, he had "the boss" come to talk to us. We showed him both fine print and still neither said only one offer could be used at a time...he proceeded to tell us this is how it's always been. He refused to look at the screenshots and just kept telling us this is how it's always been. 

Word of advice - update your promotional fine print.
author: Stephanie W.

description: I've had this place bookmarked for years, and I really had high hopes.. but unfortunately it wasn't that great. The sauces/flavors for the shrimps we ordered were super watered down.. the only thing I really liked was the garlic noodles. The restaurant it's self had a really weird smell which completely threw off my appetite..
author: Erika-Kelly C.

description: Fresh and delicious. We went here because the restaurant we came for was closed. We had crawfish (garlic butter and medium), fried oysters, alligator sausage, and fries. We ended up ordering some bread to soak up the garlic butter, it was that good. Price was a little much, but the food was worth it. Looking forward to coming back.
author: Sarah B.

description: The first time I came here, there wasn't much flavor to the garlic noodles I ordered. There was a lot of noodles but not much garlic/sauce in it. Overall it was pretty dry and bland for me. This time around, I asked if we could add more garlic in which the waitress at first seemed unwilling. She said that the garlic noodles come in a batch that is already made ahead of time. But after seeing our reaction, she then suggested to charge us an extra $1 to add more garlic just for our order. The order definitely had more of a garlic flavor and wasn't dry this time around, but I do not want to constantly be charged $1 just to make my noodles actually taste like garlic noodles. One good thing..the portions are a pretty good size!
author: Joanne C.

description:
I've been coming here for quite some time and this last visit, this past week, was excellent! I came here with a friend around 5:30pm and we were given the happy hour menu. This was something new, as it wasn't a part of the restaurant the other times I visited. The happy hour menu had some awesome deals for some of their most popular items. Things such as the green beans, calamari, and soft shell crab were about half the price. I figured this was totally worth it, especially since the items were all the exact same size as the regular menu items. 

We ordered the green beans, the calamari, the soft shell crab, wings, garlic noodles, and a pound of garlic/butter shrimp with some corn and sausage. To say there was a lot of food is an understatement, but we wanted a little bit of everything. All the items that we ordered were extremely flavorful and freshly made. I really liked that the shrimp was brought out to us in bamboo bowls, instead of bags. I felt like the flavor was much stronger due to this. 

I also really liked that our server was constantly checking up on us and making sure we had everything we needed. Good service made the experience that much better. Overall, very delicious and reasonably priced restaurant.
author: Julia K.

description:
What happened to this place? The past two times I have been here, the managerhas been so rude and snarky. My friend tried using a groupon here for 5 of us and he said the groupon is only for four people - which is absolutely bonkers. The groupon explicitly stated 4 or more and the manager just wanted a reason for us to come back. 

When we came back, we used the groupon with 4 people and he charged us 18 percent service charge because he said we used the groupon. Besides this whole groupon ordeal, their servers and the manager need to know a thing or two about customer service. They also need to fix their kitchen. It took them a whole freaking hour to serve us our shrimp and garlic noodles. How hard is it to boil and toss noodles. I would suggest to avoid this place at all costs.

**I understand that this is a family business and that they work very hard and are trying to upkeep this restaurant. The flavors are good, but just hope they improve for the future.
author: Eric Joseph D.

description:
Food was okay. We went during happy hour time and got some specials. Soft shell crab was mostly all fried batter. It was $6 and honestly dont think it was worth it.

Combo with sausage. It was nice and hot when it came out. Recommend crawfish over shrimp. The shrimp was over cooked and not as tasty as crawfish. Thought it was a big over priced for 1.5 pounds of boil. 

Garlic noodles were spot on though! Generous serving for a good price
author: Melinda C.

description: Really enjoyed their soft shell crab. Best I've eaten over here in restaurant row. Their happy hour provides some cheap eats as well when you want a little bit of everything. Service is a little lacking but does not detract from the overall experience. At everything from appetizers, the main course and dessert. The hurricane seasoning is one of our favorites. I did hear the lemon pepper comes in a close second. Will try that next time. For dessert, you won't regret ordering the deep fried bananas.
author: Patrick W.

description:
They did not honor our gift certificate. 

Please correct and show proof me if I'm wrong and I will happily take this down, but last time I checked, it was CA law that gift certificates don't expire.

We had a gift certificate from a few years ago and on it it doesn't have an expiration date on it but they still decided to not honor it. 

Their reasoning was that they had switched ownership. I just don't see how that would matter- new owner or not it's still the same business unless you change the name and menu and all that right?
author: RACHELLE T.

description:
Read mixed reviews here on both extremes in the 1 stars and 5 stars. So decidedly to try this place for myself. Overall, wasn't bad or hella good, just ok. Beats driving to San Jose for boiling crab and can just use the fix here (although boiling crab is good and better), but if they could provide lemon and pepper on the side here and have shrimp that's not too over cooked and stuck to the shell it would be good here. I'm a somewhat new fan and I had good service.

Tip: make sure if you order shrimp to take at least 1/3 to 1/2 out of the metal bowl before peeling unless your fingers can handle temperature hot shrimp.
author: Pudgy G.

description:
UPDATED REVIEW:
 Still horrible service, they have a check in offer for buy one get one pound free for crawfish. And the owner said they don't take that coupon offer. All of us and our friends had the check in offer and she didn't allow it. We visited then again 3 months later. The offer is still on there. Should call yelp to take it down..

When we got the bill we were charged more than the menu price. And had to show them to correct what they charged us. 

The only reason why I keep coming back is because the flavor and crawfish are great. Just the customer service is horrible.
author: Analise V.

description: Food was served hot, straight out the fryer. The shrimp boil was delicious. Fried catfish was clearly frozen nuggets with no seasoning, fish was mushy. The waitstaff was a bit slow, not one check on the table no water refill.The tables around us remained unclean our entire visit. One was only cleaned when the family waiting opened the door to leave. The place itself was cute.
author: Raegina R.

description: This place is ok. Service is ok. Definitely still can't beat rockin crawfish. Positive is the crawfish is huge and shrimps are big. They need to work on their flavors.
author: Christy V.

description: Service was good. Food was fine and the Happy Hour is not bad. You should give it a try.
author: Rosyan C.

description:
This is a delayed review, as we went to this restaurant over a year ago.

There were 4 of us and we ordered the Lobster Prix Fixe dinner. Everything was cooked wonderfully. The clam chowder, lobster and garlic noodles were our favorites.

However, I am deducting a star because one member of our party was in a wheelchair and the server/manager kept running into the wheelchair. When we complained, he said the wheelchair was sticking out in the aisle. We replied that he seated us at this table and he could have simply gone around and walked down the other aisle to wait on other customers.

Because of his rudeness and unprofessionalism, we will not return.
author: Chilly W.

description:
Gumbo! Garlic Noodles! Seafood Boil!  What more can you ask for?  Great service and friendly!  Our server offered suggestions and answered our question and was very generous with his time and advice. 

Nice eclectic offering of food. They have alligator too...
author: Ro N.

description:
My boyfriend I ate lunch here yesterday for the first time. When we walked in there was no one else in there but one employee. 

So, we sat down and began to order. Started off with the fried shrimp and fried crab. The fried shrimp was good, the crab, not so much. We hardly touched the crab. The last few pieces of shrimp caught our eye... the reason being was because the shrimps hadn't been cleaned correctly before served. They still had most of their veins. The vein in a shrimp is what connects their small and large intestines. Aka it's basically a big black line of poo. 

We then ordered the two combo item with mussels and shrimp. As well as the mild chicken wings. The mussels were okay, not great. The shrimps we didn't touch. The chicken wings were eaten but we weren't a fan of the sauce.  

For dessert we ordered the beignets. They came out hot and powdered in sugar. So we tried them, dry and no flavor. Almost tasted like the dough was stale before it was cooked. 

Can definitely say it was a first and a last time we go here.
author: Emilie S.

description:
Fri night recap.

Wasn't even busy. Food was bland and salty. We ask for extra napkin and rice. Napkins show up towards the end. Rice never even made it. I had walk up to pay my bill or nobody will come to our table. Credit card machine slide card broken. Only accept chip credit card.

Price up
Service down
Food down

Save your money and go else where!
author: JessePanda C.

description: Don't eat here! They are very racist! If you're black or of color they make you pay first. We ordered a good amount of food and before we even got anything the lady came back and handed us a check say the price is 74$ is that ok. Then said we had to pay first. She then lied and said she charged everyone first, the table next to us told us they didn't pay for their food first. We asked to talk to the manager and the lady said no he's not coming out he's busy. Then she continued to ignore us and refused to go back and get the manager. Then they said 2 days ago black people came in and ate but didn't pay so that's why they asked us to pay first.
author: Mistic S.

description: Swamp is BY FAR the best Cajun boil place in the city! Believe me I have tried them ALL. It's my favorite food and guilty pleasure and I come here at least once a week. The wonderful people who run it have become like family to me! They make you feel so welcome and you leave feeling full of food AND love! Do yourself a flavor... I mean favor... and GET OVER TO SWAMP! My go to order is soft shell crab app (maybe Cajun fries too for a large party-- or if I'm feeling like being extra) and a pound of shrimp hurricane medium. My mouth is literally watering as I type this out The garlic noodles are an amazing addition to soak up all that left over sauce that is just TOO GOOD TO WASTE!
author: Georgia N.

description: The hubby, bff, and I enjoyed our lunch here!  I was craving shrimp/crawfish boil and this was the only place nearby open for lunch and with a decent health inspection score (90!).  We got the gumbo, sweet potato fries, garlic noodles, sausage, shrimp and crawfish hurricane sauce + corn (medium--it wasn't spicy so will try higher next time).  We were pretty hungry and felt the food arrived timely, hot, and in normal/expected portions to what we've gotten at other places.  I don't think we'd get the gumbo and sausage again (it was fine, but we're not huge gumbo and sausage fans in general--got them just to try), but we'll definitely be back for the crawfish and shrimp boil.  Yes, this place is not the Boiling Crab but it's good and hits the spot.  And I think the prices are reasonable considering restaurants have higher rent costs in SF so don't expect suburb prices.
author: Kelly K.

description:
Since moving to SF from San Jose, I've been hard pressed to find a Boiling Crab/Kickin Crab replacement. Discovering this place was a happy accident :)

Loved the happy hour deals, we got a dozen oysters which were very fresh, some nicely seasoned + perfectly crispy cajun fries, and an order of the heavenly garlic noodles. We tried the garlic butter and hurricane sauce, both of which were great! I love how this place allows you to do half shrimp and half crawfish (or mussels or clams) unlike other places, so you don't have to choose just one.

Steve the owner was running the whole show on the Saturday afternoon that we came in, working as the only front of house person and probably cooking in the back too. He was super friendly and provided great service! This place has earned our loyalty and we'll definitely be coming back next time we've got a cajun seafood itch to scratch.
author: Michelle N.

description:
Came in with a group of four on a Saturday afternoon, there was only one server who was also the owner and he got us everything we needed when we asked and service was prompt and food was good. 

I really like how we can order 2 items per pound unlike most competitors. That was a huge selling point for me and all their sauces were really good. I especially liked mixing all the sauces together with the garlic noodles YUMS.

P.S. There are many TVs if you want to eat while catching a game too.
author: Fiona W.

description: The hurricane recipe changed. There's a lot less garlic which is a big minus. They also don't use coconut milk in their sauce anymore. The garlic green beans were too sweet. I prefer the old recipes a lot more. I heard there's a change in ownership thus the recipes changed.
author: Michelle T.

description:
Had a pretty high expectation despite mediocre reviews as we recently tried Cajun House, which also has a meh reputation.

Although the service was polite (however not great) we are giving Swamp two stars. 

The biggest problem was that our mussels were three levels overcooked. There were other pitfalls however no need to go there.

Pro tip. Ask for bread.

Update- bread is $2. Who eats mussels with broth without bread? 

Pass.
author: Lauren B.

description: Finally found a good Cajun place in sf! This place is definitely comparable yo boiling crab. The house sauce is actually goood. Crawfish was cooked right and they were fairly big. We ordered the 3 combo special...so got 1 lbs of crawfiah, shrimp and clams. Really don't think they gave us a pound of crawfish though...it seemed so little. The fries were good. Garlic noodles were ok, could be better. But the sauce was definitely good. Would come back for my crawfish fix.
author: Caitlin P.

description:
Cajun/Asian Fusion!!!

More and more of these places are opening up in the SF Richmond District (aka The Avenues).  I don't have to drive to the South Bay for some tasty mud bugs, or travel to New Orleans; although, "Nawlins" crawfish seem to be juicier and bigger thanks to the Gulf.

Lively place to watch a game or two.  Staff are friendly and attentive, constantly refilling your water and sodas.  Happy hour isn't bad if one can make it there before 6pm after work.  The kids and I usually get the seafood combo and numerous bowls of garlic noodles, delicious!  The fried foods are okay, didn't like the crawfish beignets...too cheesy and not what I expected.  Stick with the classic dessert beignets.

Ironically, I was first introduced to Swamp at the Cajun Festival in Lodi.  It's an annual festival of all things Cajun that takes place in June.  I'm glad I don't have to make the trek up to wine country for mud bugs, as I can't stand the heat.  Swamp is my go-to place for now.  They also have a location in San Leandro for East Bay peeps.      

Happy feasting ~ cheers!
author: Christine R.

description: Great place! Love the flavors, options, and portions! The only minor downside is parking in this area can be limited, but that's common in the city. We will definitely be back for our cajun seafood needs.
author: WeiWei H.

description:
Finally found me a delicious craw fish restaurant around my current living situation. Dined in with a few friends for lunch. Had the happy hour deal, I got Thai tea to start off with and then a combination order of crawfish and clams. Everything came out pretty fast.

Best of all, our server Steve (who is also part owner of the restaurant) provided us with great customer service and tended to our every need. 

Will definitely be back!
author: John D.

description: Swamp is my go to place if I'm craving spicy shrimp. I always get their hurricane habanero all shrimp either 1-3 pounds with rice. One pound of shrimp is usually about 14 pieces. I've got their crawfish before and they're usually really small and not meaty at all. I like getting all shrimp and suck their little heads with all the juices mmm. Oh and their hurricane habanero is pretty hot hot
author: Jeannette C.

description: First time coming here. Over all service was Good. the wait were about 15-20min for Food. The food was good and the host were nice. the happy hour was nice too from 2-6pm Parking was difficult to find but its worth it for me to try it out. Ill come back again if i have the chance.
author: JC N.

description: I've been here many times and it always seems to get better. Pro tip- if you want spicy REQUEST extra spicy. Their spicy option is just hot. Step it up Steve!
author: Colton F.

description: Service is bad. Food is so so. Very pricey comparing other places. Boiling Crab is so much better. I don't recommend.
author: Yemao Z.

description: I love the food here! It's Cajun and tasty and different! I have eaten here twice and I really enjoy it. It is also a great place to watch sports! They have a bunch of tvs everywhere. Beers are 5$ a pint and 16$ a pitcher! The happy hour 2-6 is super long food and 2 kinds of beer and I highly recommend the Cajun wings and alligator sausage and fried catfish nuggets!
author: Morgan H.

description:
I've been here a few times for dinner after discovering their Groupon, $13 for $25 of restaurant credit. 

What we ordered: 
* 1 pound of Hurricane Cajun shrimp (mild)
* 1 pound of coconut curry clams (mild)
* Garlic noodles
* Crawfish beignets (menu said "must try")
* Grilled chicken
* Free order of fries for checking in on Yelp! 

Overall thoughts: 
* Never really a wait but never empty
* Food is decent
* Pass on the grilled chicken. Smelled good but dry
* Would come back again
author: Sarah W.

description:
Excellent, PPQ brought Cajun seafood to the Richmond. We had been curious about Swamp, with its eye-catching name in blue lettering and black awning. The interior has some interesting faux window paintings of scenic ocean views. The rest of the restaurant is very simple without all the usual cheesy seaside decorations.
So we came for an early dinner once and sat by the window. Out of the corner of my eye, I saw some spindly legs moving along the wall. I turned to check out what was in my peripheral vision and it was a daddy long-legs. Since the restaurant was still fairly empty, they didn't mind us switching to another table. It's no one's fault. I just remember it vividly. Maybe the spider likes Cajun food too?

The shellfish menu is pretty simple. You just...
1) Choose your shellfish. Pay by the pound.
2) Choose a sauce/flavor.
3) Choose level of spice.
There is a good selection of starters and sides. Other than the usual seafood apps, like oysters & calamari, they also have some interesting ones like alligator sausage, hush puppies, and the crawfish beignet. 

We went with the 2-item Combo ($15/lb.) of Shrimp & Mussels in Hurricane / Mild Sauce,
& added Corn ($0.75) + Hot Link Sausage ($2.95):
The shrimp were tender and sweet, and the mussels were nice and springy. The dark red Hurricane sauce was quite tasty. I think the spicy sausages we added brought the mild close to a medium spice.

King Crab Legs in Garlic Butter ($29/lb):
These king crab legs tasted fresh, tender, and sweet. The leg meat was nice and springy. I appreciate that the crab legs were cut into smaller segments. They fit nicely in the bowls and made for easier eating. It went really well with the creamy garlic butter sauce.

We checked in for the free Cajun fries. They were a thicker cut, not too crunchy, lightly seasoned, pretty good. 

After we ate all the contents in our bowls, we were still left with a lot of sauce, which was perfect for dipping the toasted bread.

I enjoyed the dishes we ordered. I have to say I prefer the garlic butter to their hurricane sauce. I would come back to try out the rest of their menu, including the alligator sausage. I had some alligator in Australia and I quite like it! I'd definitely like to take advantage of their Happy Hour menu (2-6PM) too.
author: Joy W.

description:
I came here because of the groupon deal because their seafood prices by the pound are pretty expensive and I would say overpriced. I did have high expectations of this place because it did have decent ratings and I've been wanting to try it, but I was disappointed :( 

The server came pretty quickly but we weren't ready yet. However, when we were, it was pretty hard to get ahold of the server even though the restaurant was pretty empty. We were also not offered bibs, while I noticed other people had them on. A few other things I've noticed that were different from other Cajun places I've been to was that the food came in bowls instead of bags, we weren't offered limes, and we use plates and forks instead of the table and our hands. 

I checked in on Yelp for the free Cajun fries. Thank god I did not pay for those fries. It was the worse fries I've ever had and the smallest! It was not crunchy nor was it hot. In addition, there was barely any Cajun powder. I couldn't taste any Cajun at all. 

We started off with a pound of shrimp and clams in the hurricane sauce and the medium and habanero spice. The clams weren't worth it at all. The clam meat was very small and there were even some that were empty. The shrimp wasn't bad, but I've definitely had better. The shell was stuck to the shrimp pretty well, so it was hard to peel. 

As for the hurricane sauce, I am not the biggest fan of coconut curry, so it didn't come as a surprise that I wasn't the biggest fan of the sauce. It wasn't bad, but I prefer the house sauces at Cajun House and Boiling Crab. I don't really like the sweetness of it, so I probably should've tried the garlic sauce instead. Not to mention, there wasn't enough garlic in the sauce like I would normally expect.

We were still hungry so we decided to order another pound of shrimp and to try the garlic noodles. My mom told me not to because it's easily made and pretty expensive but since there were so many reviews about it, I thought I should. Man did I regret it. The bowl of garlic noodles came in a smaller bowl than the shrimp! My mom thought it would be oily because it would be made with butter but it barely had any at all. Normally that would be good, but this meant that the noodles had no flavor! I could barely see any garlic and you couldn't taste the garlic much either. The garlic hadn't been cooked to the point where the flavor had all come out yet or there just wasn't enough. I wished I had gotten something else instead....

Lastly, when I was about to use the groupon deal I found out I couldn't use the $50 value one because we didn't have four people, so we ended up paying an extra 30 instead. I guess it was my fault that I misunderstood the terms when it said dinner for 4 but I had just thought that it meant that the food was enough to fill four people...I mean if 2 people are eating $50 worth, doesn't that mean each person is paying more? That should be better for the business right? Well apparently not. If I had known ahead of time, we wouldn't have ordered the second pound of shrimp and the garlic noodles, especially since the groupon wasn't saving us that much to begin with. 

In conclusion, I probably wouldn't come back here again. The groupon is a good deal but $25 can't get you much food and definitely not enough for two people to be full. I don't particularly like the sauce either and definitely not the fries and noodles. Both my mom and I have agreed that we prefer Cajun House in terms of sauce, portion, freshness, service, and noodles! Of course, my favorite will always be Boiling Crab, but that's considerably further.
author: Tina P.

description: This my fiancé's favorite place to go for fantastic Cajun food! The Hurricane Sauce is amazing and, best yet, you can now buy by the bottle! Steve is fabulous as a  and a server.and there very little wait for your order, which is cooked to order. Do yourself a favor and give Swamp try. Trust me, you won't be disappointed.
author: Carrie C.

description:
My mom wanted to treat my family to dinner and this experience was a memorable one, unfortunately. 

The service was mediocre..and that is me being generous. They weren't rude or anything, just really slow and not very competent. 

The food was awful. The gumbo lacked the burst of flavor and excitement you would normally expect from gumbo. The sauces that the seafood came in were bland and the flavors lacked any sort of dimension. The fries were cold. The raw oysters were overpriced. Wait, it gets worse...

Later that night I felt queasy and unwell. When I started puking, I realized that I had gotten food poisoning. I wasn't the only one, my mom had gotten sick too. It's really unfortunate that she spent her money on such a lousy place. Thinking of the food makes me feel nauseous even now. Stay far away from this place, unless you're into puking your brains out and reliving a nightmare.
author: Kelly W.

description:
WARNING: If you recently got back from Louisiana and are hoping to relive your amazing food and customer service experience, keep your expectations in check, this is SF after all. 

Service: What's that? When we first arrived it wasn't very busy, the 3 or 4 servers seemed flustered and confused. It only got worse as more customers arrived. No one is greeted when you walk in, and it isn't clear if you wait to be seated, or seat yourself. Once seated, menus were tossed at us hastily without a word being said. We quickly decided what we wanted, put down the menu and waited, and waited and waited until we eventually flagged someone down. She didn't ask us if it was our first time, didn't ask us what we wanted to drink, didn't ask if the sky was blue, nothing.  We neglected to order drinks and had to flag her down again. They didn't check on us ONE TIME during our meal, we had to flag them down for extra napkins and bibs which should already be provided because...messy. During our meal we saw several frustrated customers having to regularly flag someone down to get any services. I saw a women with a To-Go bag walk BACK in, speak to a server regarding her bill and then walk away, I made eye contact with her as she was leaving and she rolled her eyes and said "OMG". 
I hear ya girl! They also made a *BIG* error on our final bill. 

On a side note, the guy running around in sweat pants, who I assume to be the owner and didn't seem to do much of anything but hang near a couple tables in the back randomly turned on the music in the middle of our dinner, when he first turned on the music it was so loud, we saw several people startle, myself included. 

Food: This is NOT authentic. It is more Asian/Cajun Fusion. 
~ They should AT LEAST invest in Crystal hot sauce. It is straight from Louisiana.
1) Oysters: Can't really mess up raw oysters, but you CAN mess up the raw oyster experience. The limes (not lemons, LIMES) we were given were dry, they had no juice at all. The horseradish and cocktail sauce were in the same tiny container and if you don't like horseradish it was difficult to get the cocktail sauce out, they did NOT provide a spoon for the condiment and we had to try and use our forks....fail, Oyster Experience Ruined.

2) Hush Puppies - dry, hard and BLAND. Zero flavor. They came with a sauce which was tasty, but didn't fit with the Hush Puppies. SKIP THEM.

3) Alligator Sausage and Slaw - This was the best part of the meal. Sausage was flavorful, tender and juicy. The slaw was drenched in a tangy sauce. Good Combo. Needed Crystal Hot Sauce though!

4) Cajun Fries - Free with our YELP Check-In. The check in on Yelp says that it expired 6/30/2014, but apparently they are still accepting it. These were good, regular fries with a spicy seasoning. I'd order them again, but I'll never be back so maybe not. 

5) Shrimp and Clam Boil w/ Signature Hurricane Sauce - They should really put down what the Hurricane Sauce is, we were pretty disappointed. Given the name, we figured it would be a blend of true LA Cajun flavors...wrong. It is curry. The shrimp was cooked nicely, not overly done, however we have experienced shrimp much easier to peal than these ones.. The clams were good, but I did have a few that were really gritty. 

Decor: It is cute. I like the maroon wall painted up like bourbon street. I do think the other wall could use a huge mural of a bayou, but the small photo is OK too. 

Final Thoughts: I would not return to this place. I'll just go visit NoLa again.
author: Meghan L.

description:
Meh I had high hopes for this place but I left feeling just flat...

My friend introduced this place to me and I've also heard great things so obviously I was hella excited. Came here for dinner after a long study sesh at school. We were brain dead and haaaangry! We came a little bit after they opened so it wasn't too busy. 

Parking - it may be a little tough no matter what day of the week it is since it's a busy street. Mostly metered parking but there is also residential parking if you're willing to walk a bit.

Service - very nice and friendly! 

Food - 
1. Cajun wings - it was alright but I would say too saucy for my taste. I wish it was more spicy though. 
2. Garlic noodles - really good! Just the right amount of garlic! 
3. Hurricane shrimp - I liked it but I felt it could've been spicier. I think it's great that they serve it in a bowl instead of serving it in a plastic bag like other places do. Way easier to eat this way! 
5. Cajun fries - I would say they're average. Nothing special but the fact that they're free for your check in makes it better! 

Don't know if I would come back but I'm glad I got to try this place out.
author: Coco L.

description: Fulfilled my cajun craving. Nothing spectacular, but it's good enough. Happy hour menu is always a good option though.
author: Thomas C.

description: Food was delicious and reasonably priced. Everyone now a days compares to boiling crab, but Swamp has their own unique flavor which does not disappoint! No parking lot, only meter parking. Will definitely be back again!
author: April A.

description:
ZERO STARS on the service if I could! I'm writing this review as I am sitting in the restaurant. I'm here with my family on Mother's Day. The lady who seems to be running the place is rude. 

We're a party of 8 and they gave us 3 menus to look at. When I asked her for more menus she gave me the most sour look and then handed me 1 more. Again. Party of 8. The restaurant is empty I'm sure they can spare a few more for just a few minutes so we can decide on what to order. 

They brought us water, but only 6 of em. I asked them for more water and she looks at me, walks away... then comes back with 1 water. I REPEAT we are a party of 8! 

We sat here for maybe 15 minutes and no one came to check on us. I wave down one of the waiters, he looks over, attempts to walk our way and then asks another waiter to help us. The other waiter is in the middle of something so the guy I initially waived down finally makes his way over to us.... we've ordered... but at this point whether the food is good or not, I'm definitely not coming back here.

I'm back and updating as I go. I ordered chicken wings for my son, but I think they probably just killed the chicken in the back before frying it up because there are still feathers on the wings! I'm kinda scared to get my food... lol
author: Hazel Y.

description: Peaceful, intimate, no-nonsense atmosphere. We ordered two pounds of crayfish, which was just about enough to feed two. French bread was great for dipping in the sauce, and when the bread was through we ordered garlic noodles. Were able to catch some of the 2nd quarter of the nights Warriors/Hornets game on the screens. Fried banana ice cream was perfect way to end the meal
author: Paul B.

description:
Cajun seafood has slowly crawled up favorite foods list and I've definitely tried quite a few restaurants that sells that. Swamp definitely makes the top 3 in the Bay in my opinion. 

As always, I ordered a pound of shrimp, hurricane cajun, medium. We also ordered garlic noodles and a side of rice. Side note - you can't order half a pound like you can at some other places. The shrimp was definitely spicy and so good! I could taste a slight asian fusion twist on it. The garlic noodles were also awesome. Definitely what made it one of my top cajun places in the bay. The service was quick and the servers were very personable. It's a small restaurant so you're paid attention too. Plus we came at a not so busy time. 

Some other notes, even though somewhere online or something said that their happy hour is only Monday to Friday, we actually were able to get happy hour prices on Saturday! Just be wary if you want to order a Groupon...they're only valid Sunday - Thursday. I'll try their San Leandro location soon since its closer to home.
author: Jessica G.

description: Swamp is probably the best substitute for Boiling Crab.  It's about a 3 1/2 star place.  I gave it 3 stars because I got there during happy hour and they would not honor the free Cajun fries when checking in using the Yelp app, even though we ordered from the regular menu. I was kind of disappointed with the customer service.
author: Funk G.

description:
Went there after warriors game night. We were trying to get something similar to boiling crab, but near by. yelp and found Swap. It was only two tables when we got there around 9pm. First of all, have to say the waiters(two of them) are really friendly and didn't give us a attitude because of we are late customers. 
But the food was really just ok. really salty and the shimps were not that fresh. Cajun fries, bad. claim chowder, bad. mussel in hurricane sauce, good. crab in hurricane sauce, ok. 
I don't think I will go back anytime soon.
author: Michelle Z.

description: I am not sure why they are still advertising specials from Christmas that you can not order. The food taste good actually, but I really doubt I was given a pound of each seafood I ordered. The service was also questionable, I asked for a straw three times and never got it. With that all said, I would go back because there isn't very many places in the city that offers this kind of food.
author: Tina L.

description:
First Time eating Cajun in the city. I usually satisfy my Cajun cravings in South Bay such as places like boiling crab or my all time favorite KICKIN crab...

The food here is somewhat pricier than the South Bay locations but it's understandable since it's the city and everything seems more expensive... I got the lb of shrimp for 15$... Steam rice and sausages on the side. My friend got the garlic noodles and Cajun wings. We checked in for the free Cajun fries which was cool to have on the side. 

The shrimp it self were large sized and fresh.. In a balanced flavorful sauce.. (Hurricane sauce). Sausages and Cajun fries were on point but kicking crab has 12 pieces for 3.99 whole here was 6 pieces for 2.99. Garlic noodles were ... Like garlic noodles, so can't really complain about that .. 

I did however see a happy hour menu that's from 2pm-6pm with dollar oysters.. Cheaper garlic noodles($5), cheaper Cajun wings..($5$ and so on... I'll Probably come back for a happy hour season but for now... I'll stick with kicking crab in San Jose for my Cajun fix!!
author: Auden W.

description:
I've been here a couple times before and remember the food being pretty good, but I have changed my mind after coming here for dinner the other night. I came here with a few of my friends. We got: 

- shrimp in the hurricane sauce & mild spicy: this was very very bland. The sauce had a tomato-y taste, it was weird. I don't remember it tasting like this.. Maybe they messed up that day? 

- clams in the garlic butter sauce: this was pretty good. However, a lot of shells were missing the actual clam meat inside. We even tried digging through the sauce but couldn't find the missing clams! My hungry friend was not happy. 

- fries: FREEEEE w/ yelp check in!! Mediocre tasting but it was free so I'm not complaining

- garlic noodles: probably the best thing we ordered. Not too oily! 

They also service their seafood in bowls instead of bags like most cajun restaurants. I like this a lot more because it's less messy!

Shrimp is also $15 per pound right now. So the bill added up to be a lot more than expected. Service was great! The waitresses were ways willing to answer our questions and bring condiments that we ask for. Will probably come back since it's in my neighborhood, hopefully the sauce will taste better next time
author: Nancy C.

description:
Updated: Groupon credited me back for my Groupon so I will update my review. :)

This was my first time dining at Swamp. The server was nice but just like everyone else.... they would not accept the Groupon. They told me they switched ownership and to contact Groupon (which I plan to did).

The food... the house sauce at Swamp was good (not greasy/overly buttery) but it tasted like they used frozen crawfish which is a big no no. The meat loses its flavors and tenderness when its frozen so its not as good. I wonder if they used frozen due to seasonal reasons....hmm.... I would love to try this place again during crawfish season. The garlic noodles were very good. (I wished they sold that with chicken as a lunch special like the pics in yelp but when I called before, they said they stopped serving lunch.

We also tries butter garlic and coconut curry sauces. I like mixing the house sauce with the butter garlic so its not that spicy (even though we got mild, it was still too spicy for me)
author: Karen L.

description: Order take out. I spent 80 on a crab garlic noodles and soda and I tip even know I wasn't eating there. I get my stuff take it home and open the pan and it's not even a full crab... they gave me like 4 claws and a couple of legs. Un acceptable. Check your food before you go. A crab only suppose to have 2claw not 4. Smh. I'm pissed
author: Cali B.

description: This is one of my top 5 places for food in San Francisco. I always get the boil with crawfish and shrimp with hurricane sauce, and all the extras, and garlic noodles. The food gets 10 stars. But I have to bring my rating down because of the atmosphere. It's not very inviting and they have multiple TVs blasting different channels at the same time, which is very strange and irritating. They should be playing some new orleans jazz or something, that would be really cool and fitting. I've been there probably 6 times when this has happened. I would come here for lunch more, but no one is in there so it's awkward and I just opt to order takeout. I think its because of the weird atmosphere that's pushing some people away. I also have to say that I was there about a year ago on a Saturday night and the staff was very friendly but they were over-serving people alcohol. They even let someone take a bottle of sake to go, who was so drunk he was falling over breaking glasses and drooling on himself.  I'd reccomend they keep that in check.
author: Simone B.

description:
Boyfriend and I loooove The Boiling Crab so we had to try this place when we saw it was on the way to Golden Gate Park. 

We arrived during happy hour on Thursday and it was pretty empty, but more and more people started coming in after we did so that's good.

We got Thai iced teas (very good), and calamari to start.

The calamari was perfectly fried, tender, and had great flavor. Dipping those little nuggets of seafood in the chili sauce that it came with added to the deliciousness. 

We then ordered the garlic noodles and king crab legs in lemon pepper sauce..wanted to try the hurricane sauce, but the boyfriend is not a fan of curry :( I'd never had garlic noodles before, but I thought they had a good bite and were even tastier drenched in the lemon pepper sauce.

The crab legs were very meaty and they gave us a big portion. That crab was sooo good! I like that they pre cut the shell so it's easier for you to claw the meat out. The fact that they serve everything in bowls makes it less messy which we definitely appreciated. I think bibs and extra utensils are given upon request because we didn't get any, but we didn't really need them. 

I wanted to order more, but we were stuffed with 1 pound of crab and an order of noodles. 

Swamp is yummy seafood, cool NOLA decor, and friendly staff. Definitely recommend getting there for Happy Hour so you can get deals on wings, fries, oysters, and other small bites and drinks. Wish they had a location in Los Angeles :'(
author: Stephanie G.

description: Food was great ... came for the Happy hour shrimp special but no longer on the menu.  Food was still great.  The house special sauce was delicious.  We also tried the gumbo- very flavorful and the string beans was surprisingly good.
author: Jennifer T.

description: Horrible customer service, when I told s busboy crawfish not fresh at all . He was like yeah not a seasoned right now
author: JP C.

description:
Swamp was probably one of the first Cajun style restaurants that I heard of in the city, besides Boiling Crab but that's hella far, and I've always wanted to stop by here but I never really had a chance. My boyfriend and I made Craw Station our go to spot but that place has been too poppin' lately so it was a perfect opportunity to stop by Swamp! 

PARKING:
Be ready to drive for awhile to find parking. Try to find the little hidden alleys of parking lots (they do have meters). 

APPEARANCE:
Typical tacky boat decoration that you see at other Cajun style restaurants but Swamp doesn't have wooden walls and tables to write on. It was pretty dim inside. Lots of seating available. 

SERVICE:
Everyone was so nice, even when we stopped by 30ish~ minutes before they closed. A little laggy on water at first but they started filling up our waters more constant almost at the end of our meal. 

PRICES:
$13/lb of shrimp which is a little more than other places that usually charge $11-12/lb. 

FOOD:
We ordered a pound of their shrimp in their hurricane flavor, (Cajun, garlic butter and lemon pepper), wings, garlic noodles and rice. 

SHRIMP:
It didn't come in a plastic bag, came in a bowl which I'm not a fan of since it lets the shrimp cool down faster which is NO BUENO. Thumbs up on their hurricane sauce though.

GARLIC NOODLES: 
It was yummy, 1 order was definitely more than enough for 3 people. 

WINGS:
I didn't try them out but my friend said they were pretty good. 

I noticed that they had beignets for dessert so hell yeah I ordered them! 

BEIGNETS:
I've only had these babies at Disneyland so that's where I'm basing these off of. Swamp's beignets were more fluffy on the inside and they weren't hallow compared to Disney's. Definitely 2 thumbs up! 

OVERALL:
It was a great experience! I was really thinking of which place I'd prefer to go to: swamp or craw station, but having beignets on your dessert menu definitely wins me over, Swamp. Thumbs up all around!
author: Grace Anne D.

description:
I'm sorry, but I am not sure, either, how this restaurant gets anything near a 4-star.  French Laundry only got a 4.5, for Christmas Sake!  Anyway, even "factoring" the type of restaurant it is, "homey" it wasn't even very good.  Maybe this is based on having been to New Orleans and many other Cajun/Creole places in the Bay Area.

Let me first say the only server in the place was VERY pleasant, though she was on her smart phone apps a lot of the time., back by the bar.

We tried the three things you would judge any Cajon/Creole restaurant on ... 
Gumbo. Not!  This was nothing more than watery roux and some canned crab sprinkled in for, I assume, legal minimum reasons.  

The Soft Shelled Crab was bordering on tiny, so that it was impressively more viscera than anything else.

The Garlic Noodles were pasty chow mien noodles, not even garlicky enough to keep the vampires away.

Beignets were, at least, the good news at the end of every newscast.  It did make us feel better for a moment.  This unobtrusive place is more akin to a fast food place in quality.
(Think Long John Silver's version of a seafood restaurant)  I'm sorry but if you invited me, and paid, I would pass.

I don't have to name them, but there are much/many better Cajun places in the Bay Area.
author: James G.

description: Writing this as we are sitting here waiting for our food. Ordered over 40 mins ago and food has still not arrive. Asked the wait staff to check on our food and it seems like they just completely forgot about us. Granted they have a large party to content with, the place is not nearly full. We watched as the other party get plate after plate. After 40 mins, they get back to us and tell us our food is cooking now. They are either understaffed or do not know how to run their logistics to be able to actually achieve service of this magnitude. I rarely write reviews for places but this place inflamed me enough to pull out my phone and rant. Definitely the worst and slowest service I've had in my entire life.
author: Eric W.

description: The sauce for shrimp is so delicious. Oyster is fresh. Crawfish is wonderful! I want to try it again.
author: 鳳瑩

description: A very enjoyable and delicious dining experience! My boyfriend and I love boil-in-a-bag, order-by-the-pound seafood, and this place does a really solid job. I recommend the House Cajun seasoning but be warned that even the "mild" spice level might be a bit hotter than you're expecting. We had king crab, crawfish, mussels, corn, and potatoes all mixed together. YUM! I also have to say the hush puppies are BOMB!!! So crispy and delicious they will light up every pleasure center in your brain. One more thing: if Cajun-style seafood is your thing, I recommend Ray's Crab Shack in Fremont, CA. That one is my favorite, but I encourage you to try both and see what you think.
author: Erika J.

description:
The food here is good, but you can definitely find the same level of food nearby elsewhere and with better service. The middle aged Asian man who took our order was extremely rude. When asked if we could use the yelp offer even though we had a Groupon, he said "of course not". Wow, if it doesn't state that anywhere, how are we supposed to know? A simple "sorry, no" would have sufficed. Ive been here several times without any type of discount but after this incident, I will not be returning. 

Go to Cajun House instead.
author: Diana S.

description:
so. good.

be back soon for more garlic noodles/hurricane flavored shrimp!!!!
author: Rj L.

description:
Bought Groupon and used it for dinner here. 3 of us ordered 2 crabs (1 dungeness crab ($45) and the other crab for $37 - special promotion), 2 garlic noodles and 1 calamari. Calamari was forgettable, lacks flavor. Garlic noodles were pretty standard (can be good when you are hungry), came in a good-sized bowl.

Crabs were pretty decent size. We had the dungeness crab with coconut curry, The special crab was a little smaller and a little bit overcooked. Not sure whey the wait for the food took so long, it wasn't very busy.
author: Em T.

description:
The shrimp is incrediblely tasty, but the mussels have a bad smell. 

Good customer accommodation-keep it up guys.
author: William D.

description:
Stumbled upon this spot while I was in the area waiting for my boyfriend. I noticed their Happy Hour sign and was pretty impressed how they include weekends as well. So we ordered garlic noodles, oysters, wings, calamari, and got a free order of cajun fries from checking in on Yelp. We also ordered drinks. Their watermelon iced tea was SO F****** GOOD. It was so refreshing with the right amount of sweetness and it also had pieces of watermelon in it. 

We spent about $30 for all that food and we didn't even finish our noodles because we were so full. Def worth trying out if you're in the area. HH is from 2-6pm everyday. And the owner was a really nice guy.
author: Dara S.

description:
We couldn't decide what to eat on a late Saturday for lunch and since we found a parking near this restaurant, we decided to try it. 
If you check in on Yelp, you get a free Cajun fries :)
The ambiance is good as you walk in the entrance you'll see an alligator head screaming at you :& lol 
We ordered the hush puppies for appetizer and we had our free Cajun fries too!  For main course, we ordered the 2 lbs combination of shrimp and clams in a mild curry coconut and of course garlic noodles.
The hush puppies is good but it's something i usually don't order it so I can't really say if it's a best or there's a better one out there
The Cajun fries is a meh...I can't taste the Cajun part of it but then again it's free so no complain on this
The 2lbs shrimp and clams mild curry coconut is very good...I would prefer it spicy but my friend doesn't like spicy so we opted for the mild. The curry coconut is very flavorful (that I just want to dip a toasted sour dough bread on it) yum yum!!! Though, the 2 lbs seems so little compare it to the 2 lbs we order from other restaurants.
As for the garlic noodles...this is disappointing! I couldn't taste the garlic at all plus the noodles are overcooked. I had tried so many different garlic noodles in different restaurants so I know my garlic noodles! So I improvised and took some of the curry coconut sauce on my noodles and yes it became much okay and became curry coconut noodles!
I "might" come back to try the hurricane spice but will not order the garlic noodles again. 
Definitely "Kickin Crab" and "Boiling Crab" are still my go to place!
author: CJ B.

description: Went here on a random weekday with two friends during happy hour and all three of us were really happy with our meal. We got a few things to share off of the happy hour menu and of course some shrimp and crab legs. The garlic sauce we got was amazing, towards the end of our meal we ordered bread because we didn't want the broth to go to waste. Their garlic noodles here were so yummy! We shared a single bowl of the noodles but I'm pretty sure when we go next time we're each getting our own, it's that good!
author: Junelle T.

description:
I went here for the second time with my best friend from LA. The customer service was horrible. They forgot our drinks and took about 15-20 Minutes to get around before the actual drinks arrived. They have a deal for free fries if you check in. Apparently,  we could not check in and order off the happy hour menu. Also, before we got there we were prepared to use a Groupon to pay for the meal. However, there was so many rules and restrictions for the deals. We ended up just paying the full price on entire bill. We could only choose from ordering from happy hour menu only, checking in to get free fries or just using the Groupon for an regular menu. 

The food was still good but we were still hungry.
author: Carleen C.

description: Great service! I had a bowl with shrimps and clams with hurricane sauce which I didn't like it. I had better boil shrimp at another restaurant. I won't be coming back.
author: Jeanette A.

description:
I love that a restaurant like this exists in San Francisco. As someone who lived in LA, it satisfies my nostalgia for an affordable, no-frills, casual, food-forward establishment that isn't pretentious enough to call itself Asian fusion but is exactly that. Cajun shrimp is on the menu, but you can also have your seafood boiled in coconut curry broth. You can have a side of french bread, or garlic noodles. A pitcher of Lagunitas, or Singha. 

The staff is attentive and the owner is really amicable and energetic. You feel taken care of, but never rushed.

Dine-In Tips: 

- You can purchase a Groupon (although be wary of weekend restrictions)
- Yelp check-in for free cajun fries
- They take reservations! Avoid the line on busy nights
- They have TVs (in case you're worried about missing a game during dinner)

Food Recs: 

- Recommended sides: garlic noodles, crawfish beignets 
- Stand out dishes: two people I've dined with have independently said the clams in lemon pepper sauce were the best clams they've ever had; the green beans are fantastic, and basically anything in hurricane sauce is amazing
author: Rachel I.

description:
garlic noodz are my favorite noodz
--
So my friends and I pulled an asshole move and walked in to Swamp half an hour before closing, but the staff were super nice about!
We ordered 2 lbs of shrimp in mild hurricane sauce and 2 pounds of shrimp in medium hurricane sauce (and of course garlic noodles). There is a noticeable difference in taste between the two sauces: you taste a lot more sweetness in the mild sauce than in the medium sauce. The garlic noodz could have had more garlic. 
All in all, the quality of the food has gone down over time. 
--
Tip: I felt this place was a little pricier compared to other Cajun places, so if you really like the sauce, order an order or two of the French bread and dip it into the sauce! (We agreed it tastes better with the medium sauce than the mild). It's filling and it saves some money.
author: Joanne W.

description:
Love, Love, Love #SWAMPSF  Been going here since it opened and it just gets better every time! The combo shrimp/mussel boil is the bomb! Never pass up the alligator sausage and crispy sauteed garlic green beans!
Always a favorite place for lunch and dinner!!
author: Eileen A.

description:
Pros:
Happy hour menu prices
Pretty plump shrimps
Decent prices
Crunchy Cajun fries

Cons:
Inexperienced/incompetent service - even with only a few diners in the restaurants, the servers were flustered, confused, and missed a few of our orders
Garlic noodles were over-cooked
"Spicy" isn't even hot
It seems the shellfish were quickly tossed into the bag w/ sauce and brought out. I found myself pealing shrimp and clams and re-dipping them into the bag for more flavor.
author: Thao T.

description: Finally back again for more seafood. The shrimps and mussels were very fresh. We got it with medium spicy hurricane sauce. It's on the spicy side for medium but still manageable. Service was good and friendly. Got the coupon deal which made it super affordable. Will come back for sure next time.
author: An N.

description: Way better than crawstation in sunset. I ordered a pound of their shrimp in hurricane Cajun, medium spicy. The sauce was a little on the sweet side, but the flavor was all there. The medium spicy wasn't spicy at all really though, so it makes me want to try their next level up which was habanero spicy or something. I also tried a bit of my friends shrimp in coconut curry sauce which was also pretty good. It tasted more like a Thai curry, which I thought went well with the shrimp. Service was good and the beer was nice and cold. The watermelon iced tea was pretty good as well, and you can tell they used real watermelon as some of the white seeds and pulp were in the cup.
author: Sandy K.

description:
I love anything seafood! Came here with my sister and a friend for dinner. There wasn't a wait (Yasss!) and was seated to our table quickly.

The service was quick when we ordered but the wait for our food was loooong! 
After 10 mins or maybe more of waiting we finally got our food.
-12 raw oysters
-coleslaw 
-clam chowder 
-garlic noodles
-garlic fries(free when you check in)
-2 item combo (clams/shrimp) -mine!
-2 item combo (crawfish/clams)
-1lb crab
-beignets

Oysters were good to me but it was my fist time trying oysters, but my sister said it could've been better.
The coleslaw tasted like nothing, just bland.
Garlic noodles were delicious. Garlic fries were awesome but they came later during dinner so we didn't really get to enjoy them.
My clams and shrimp with flavored in the hurricane sauce with med spiciness. It was good, the hurricane flavor was like the original flavor you get at rockin crawfish. The beignets were tasty. We had to wait for them even though it comes with the meal if you order the crabs.

Overall I wouldn't really come back, the service was quick at first but it was slow after we ordered.  If we're in the area maybe but for now it's a no.
author: Janice J.

description:
I made the mistake of ordering the crab deal for $35. It was overcooked and probably the worst crab flavor I ever had and quite small too. 
The shrimp is good. I like the curry and the garlic butter is just ok. please put some garlic in there or don't call it garlic if it has little to no garlic. Go to any other place and you will find lots of garlic. This one I was looking all over for just one piece for garlic. Also a little over priced too. 
They do have a nice happy hour with oysters at $1 each.  And they make sure to keep your water filled also. 
I'd like to give it more stars but pricing needs to improve and work on that crab. If you're going to be paying a lot for a tiny crab make sure it's good at least.
author: Erick M.

description:
After trying numerous Cajun places in the city over the last couple months, I am confident that this one is the best.

Although their recipes are not traditional to cajun style, they offer the best sauce and the best service! Their Asian twist is something special that every foodie should experience. 

Swamp is the best here in SF and although it might be a trek out to the Richmond district to try it, it is well worth it! GO NOW.
author: Anna P.

description:
This is has become my go-to spot for my "Boiling Crab" addiction in SF.  I like spicy, so I usually get the Hurricane with medium spicy. I prefer getting shrimp over any other seafood here. There's a check-in for fries, so use that too! The garlic noodles are the next best thing here, its got great flavor, but not overwhelmingly oily and garlic-y which I appreciate. 

They are also on Groupon, so if you're planning to get lunch or dinner on Sun-Thurs I suggest the deal. I believe its $15 for $30.
author: Jamila W.

description:
Came here on a Friday night. My party of 8 was seated quickly. I was surprised that the restaurant was not packed at all bc I would assume a highly rated place like this would have a wait...?? 

Service here is a 4 out of 10. It was hard to flag down the 3 waiters on duty to order/ask for condiments etc bc they really tried to look the other way to avoid eye contact. I don't think they were too happy with having to help a large party. Also the younger waiter have tons of attitude when my friend corrected the order he had. He wanted medium heat but she brought him non spicy. She insisted he ordered non spicy but she wasn't the one who took our order the guy was... LOL OK. 

Food was mediocre at best. $16 for a lb of small shrimp that really did not seem like a lb to me. 12 small shrimps? Maybe the price for lbs of shrimp went up but this really did not seem worth it. the flavors were lacking. I tried the hurricane house special sauce non spicy. Tasted like slight spice with ketchup. I must say, the sausages were the best for me. 

Crawfish beignets - ordered bc the menu said "must try". Tasted like an odd take for seafood pizza. Large chunks of crawfish. would order again. 

Garlic noodles - 8/10 pretty good. Best thing on the menu. I could eat this only and will be satisfied. 
Once all of our food came out except my garlic noodles, I waited 10 min until I flagged down my waiter to tell him to cancel my order of garlic noodles because it never came out. He then said that they were cooking my garlic noodles and brought it out 2 min later. funny bc my friend got his garlic noodles 20 min prior to me trying to cancel my order. Lol I know you forgot about my order it's okay. 


Shrimp was overpriced and disappointing. Lacked in flavors. The food was inconsistent. My shrimp were small but tasted like they've been cooking in the broth for some time, but my friends shrimp were large like prawns but it tasted like it boiled in water aka no taste. 

I would not come again. Yelp has left me astray.
author: AJ C.

description:
Came here on Mother's Day and we ordered the following:

-Oysters (just OK) broken shell were on the oysters & too tiny. $1 each after 2pm
-Cajun Fries (OK)
-Fried Calamari (OK) $5 after 2pm
-Fried Catfish Fillet (OK)
-Mussels in garlic butter sauce (Just OK) 
-Hurricane Shrimp Garlic Noodles (Very Good) Garlic Noodle not the shrimp
-Regular Garlic Noodles (Good) $5 after 2pm

*Friendly servers
author: Wendy L.

description:
Came here for good food since we come here all the time but sitting down I realized they changed ownership. We got our usual which was cajun fries, clams, sausages and bread and lets just say I was very disappointed.
