The bread came cold and not even toasted and was as if they just cut it and through it in the toaster for 30 seconds. 

The service was horrible. The waiters were rude and yelling at other waiters and it was a mess. They obviously have not been in the service industry because they were carrying around food orders and instead of dropping it off at the table they went to get wet towelettes for others. They would continuously walk around with the food not dropping it off to the tables and doing other things instead. They were also very condescending in how they spoke and was rude as well. I would not come back anymore after the change off ownership.
author: Angela S.

description:
Not good at all... We were really disappointed with this as we had so been looking forward to a delicious experience. First off, you open the door to the pungent smell of fish- which is understandable, but hot, sour, fish smell in the dining/waiting space is a hard way to start your meal. We waited off to the side for about 15 minutes, but the staff wasn't very welcoming. 

They sat us down, and had some issues with pouring a Sapporo for my fiance. Asking him several times to repeat his order. Finally got to order, which was easy enough, no frills. We ordered alligator sausage, which tastes like chicken sausage, the garlic noodles which were nothing special, the Cajun fries were good, but how do you screw those up, and finally the crawfish is tornado sauce. 

We didn't get through half of the food because it just wasn't good. The sauce was not good, the crawfish were dirty tasting, even though I was open minded about them, I spent half my time cleaning out the veins. The noodles lacked flavor other than noodles and garlic. We kind of felt jipped when we paid. It was that bad.

We just won't be going back. 

Seems popular for high school/20 year olds.
author: Brianna S.

description: I wish I could give -2 stars. I unfortunately didn't get my food because the clerk refused to give my post mate my food unless she could touch her phone with her sauce ridden fingers. Even after I called the restaurant to ask them to release the food to her. My post mate went back to attempt to get the food again and they got in an argument resulting the clerk calling her a FAT PIG. That is beyond rude - it's mean and cold blooded. Take your business elsewhere.
author: Lauren S.

description:
I like Swamp but only because we don't have a Boiling Crab in San Francisco. I also like Swamp because they advertise on Groupon so you can get like $25 worth of food for $15 if you time it right. I also like Swamp because the nearest competitor Craw Station has a poor health score and I'm too scared to eat there.

The selection of both crustaceans and sauces is pretty standard. My go-to is a 1 pound combo of shrimp and clams in the garlic butter sauce. If they had snow crab, I would get that. I'm not about to drop $45 on Dungeness crab here. I would also recommend adding a side rice since the garlic butter sauce is so good. It's garlic and butter. Obviously it's going to be good.

Swamp is priced pretty appropriately but I can probably satisfy my Boiling Crab craving by making this at home to save money instead of waiting for enough time to pass so that I can buy another Groupon.
author: Charles L.

description:
Really sad to see this place going downhill since switching owners. This used to be my absolutely favorite place in the central Richmond. I went last night and ordered my usuals: spicy cajun wings, garlic noodles, garlicy green beans, and shrimp in mild garlic butter sauce. There was only one person working initially and he did not notice my friend and I for a long time - we ended up seating ourselves and getting our own menus by the door while we waited for him to come over. The server initially brought us fries, which we did not order, before realizing they belonged to another table - there were only 3 tables taken at that time. Two items in our order came out wrong, which we confirmed when we got the check: our spicy wings were written down as 'mild' and our shrimp came boiled with no sauce at all....I thought the waiter may have misheard me when I ordered so I repeated the shrimp order and pointed to the sauce on the menu, but it seems it was still written wrong. The green beans tasted fine, definitely the best thing we got, but the garlic noodles were noticeably dry and a smaller portion compared to my many previous visits. 

I get that switching ownership can take some adjustment, but it really feels like the quality of the cooking has gone down and the new staff is not well trained.
author: Vika M.

description:
I called a week before to make a reservation for party of 9 (with two kids), and requested for two high chairs. When we got there our table was ready with two high chairs (thumbs up!).

Our server asked if it was our first time and explained everything on the menu. We ordered shrimp and mussels with hurricane sauce (mild), garlic noodles, sweet potato fries, cajun fries and fried shrimp for the kids. I was so excited to try their sauce because I have been on a hunt to find a good sauce just like boiling crab and kickin crab without having to drive all the way to SJ. I was a little disappointed, because it didnt taste nothing like boiling crab. I mean, it wasnt bad it was just not what I expected. 

However, the customer service was excellent!
author: Nicole D.

description:
I woke up to a group message from my girlfriends saying they were STILL full the next day from our little feast at Swamp the night before! This place is soo good!

My girls and I shared The Special for Two, it's on the menu for $60 for 2 but we split it three ways and it was more than enough. The meal started with fresh, crunchy coleslaw and chowder made in-house. We devoured these. Next we had Garlic Noodles and Lobster in Garlic Butter sauce, and let me tell you, it was as decadent as one could possibly hope. 

There was a ton of meat in the lobster and the sauce was heavenly. We doused our noodles with the drippings and just stopped talking for a good five minutes to fully enjoy the grub, which is a really long time for us not to say something. We looked up after our plates were clear, smiling, faces buttery, and clinked our glasses of Blue Moon in unison.

For dessert we enjoyed fluffy, hot beignets sprinkled generously with powdered sugar. My two wishes: that we had some strawberry jam to put on the beignets, and that we had some dipping bread for the garlic butter sauce. OK now I must got eat something because it's torture to write about such a fantastic meal without feeding myself something.
author: Crystal C.

description:
The fried soft shell crab was good and the fries were okay.

The hurricane cajun medium spice flavored shrimp and crawfish were delicious! We added some corn for sweetness and it was perfect!!! Definitely will be going back soon!!
author: David T.

description:
Came here around 7:00pm on Saturday and there was lots of seating left. Pretty packed by 7:30pm. The four of us got: 
-clam chowder (really good)
-garlic noodles (nice and light)
-mild shrimp
-no spice crawfish and shrimp
-medium spice crawfish and shrimp
(All hurricane seasoning)

Overall, everything here is consistently above average. No qualms here. Just remember that even the nonspicy sauce is spicy to begin with, so adjust accordingly.
author: James H.

description: Our table ordered a pound of shrimp in hurricane cajun, a pound of mussels, and 2 lbs of the crawfish without seasoning (you can use the yelp offer of the buy 1 lb of crawfish, get one free!). The sauce for the shrimp was great and very flavorful. The crawfish are also huge and taste better with no seasoning. Would definitely come again!
author: Chantal D.

description: This rating is for the overall value and experience if you follow my advice :). The crab is a waste of money, it's too fried, but the pepercorn sauce is amazing. Still not worth the $45 price tag. Crow fish is delicious, but very small. Considering the size and effort, also not worth it. You can try those once, just to try. What you want to focus on is the hurricane shrimp and oysters. Tap beer was also good. Garlic noodles were also pretty good. String beans were mediocre, calamari way too fried. Still, if you follow my advice with shrimp, garlic noodles and oysters, you won't regret it.
author: Andrew S.

description:
I understand the novelty of Swamp if you've never had this type of cuisine. But if you've had experience with Boiling Crab or any other equivalent, this place is only okay. 

First off: Free cajun fries with a Yelp check-in. The fries definitely taste stale and overcooked. But they're free so I guess you can't expect much. 

Following previous Yelp reviews, I ordered 1 lb of crawfish and mussels ($14/lb for a choice of two) in hurricane sauce and medium spiciness level. The mussels were awesome and large. The crawfish was so tiny and it was hard to feel full because there was so little meat on them. I would not recommend getting the crawfish unless you like working 20x harder for barely any protein. We ordered a side of french bread to go with the hurricane sauce it was such a good call. I definitely recommend some sort of carb to soak up the flavors.

Service was fantastic. Our waters were constantly refilled and the waitresses were attentive. We were served promptly and the experience was nothing short of professional.

Overall, 2 stars because the food was very mediocre and "meh. I've experienced better."
author: Nicole J.

description:
Don't come here expecting Boiling Crab because it's not even close. With that said, it's decent if you don't compare (too much). The restaurant has a slight "mardi gras" theme, with beads and stuff hanging from the wall on the right when you enter. The old man, who I assume is the owner, was very nice and cheerful. He seated me even though my friend wasn't there yet.

It was kind of busy for a Saturday night -- the restaurant was about three-fourths full. When my friend arrived, it took a while before we had our orders taken since the servers were suddenly MIA and the owner was chatting up the table next to us. But as soon as he noticed, he turned around and helped us. He was very nice about the free fries with Yelp check-in (no rolling eyes or exasperated look because someone is redeeming a coupon THEY put up, so that was nice).

Food came rather promptly. I had 1lb of the 2 item combo with shrimp and clam ($14/lb), medium spicy and Hurricane seasoning (equivalent to "The Whole Shebang") with sausages (I think it was 6 pieces for $2.50, which is way cheaper than BC I think) and corn ($0.75?). My friend had shrimp with corn and potato (they literally give you one huge spud haha). Food came in a metal bowl and at first I thought it wasn't going to be enough for me, but I was satisfied at the end. The Hurricane sauce tastes a lot like gumbo...Tasty, but doesn't really sit right for a crawfish boil (but then again, I don't know much about boils...). Shrimp was cooked perfectly, nice and crisp. But the corn was defnitely soggy and overcooked.

Service was good overall. We had our waters refilled without asking, and limes were brought out after we asked. At the end of our meal, they didn't rush us to leave or give us the check. They also give you heated hand wipes, which is a nice touch! Doesn't really get the smell out, but a nice gesture.
author: Doris K.

description: Awesome place for happy hour. Huge fresh miyagis for $1.25, the beer & wine selection is fun, absolutely love the calamari. The ambience is a little strange (music ranges from country to hard rock to electronica to rap, all in the span of 4 songs), but that almost adds to the appeal and takes nothing away from the AMAZING food.
author: Joe H.

description:
Came here for brother's bday couple weeks ago since he was craving for crawfish and wanted to try a new place. My family were pretty sad and disappointed that they didnt have the crawfish saying that they're out of season. Even the lobster was out of season. Whoever i talk to on the phone to make a reservation could have told me that they didnt have crawfish in season. We couldnt do nothing about it since we were at the table and just wanted to give this place a try.

This place was alright. Nothing special about this place. Its expensive and they dont give you much. One of the things that we order was the oyster as one of our appetizer. its so small that its like bite size. 

Had the garlic. They give in a small bowl. Its not enough for 5 people. It tasted alright

Shrimps are pretty big and juicy...good sauce. Usually when you get 1 or 2 lbs of shrimps, its always more than 15 pieces if 1 lbs and maybe more than 20 pieces if 2 lbs. i dont know if they're cheap on giving out the shrimps or not, but they give so little.
We always had the clam and mussel combo. Decent size and good sauce. We had corns and regular sausages. Mix well with the sauce of the shrimp and the combo. This restaurant put your shrimps and clam/mussels was in bowl rather than the traditional plastic bag

Alligator sausage. Nothing special. Taste like regular grill sausage but it was fun it eat since it was new

Spill water on my brother and beer on the table. Should have gave us discount for spilling our drink. But the waiter was nice that he said sorry and trying to clean our table. Not sure if i would come back here again
author: Julie N.

description: Cajun fries with the Yelp check in are just regular fries with a pinch of Cajun seasoning. No flavor whatsoever. Service was nonexistent. The shrimp was overcooked. The shell was scorching hot.. but the meat itself was cold? 1lb of clams was literally 8 pieces. Not worth it at all...
author: Sandy W.

description:
One of the few places in San Francisco that do the cajun seafood boil (think Boiling Crab, but served in big bowls instead of plastic bags). 

The food for the "seafood boils" itself is good - I've only gotten the shrimp, crawfish, mussels. It's a bit pricey in my opinion ($15.99/lb) but worth it mostly due to lack of other options. I would skip adding the hot dogs / potatoes unless you reaaaaally want them. They're not amazing and I feel like it doesn't cook in the sauce long enough to really soak it up. I must say, the garlic butter sauce is delicious! For sides, I love the garlic noodles and the gumbo. 

For the ambiance - depends when you go! It's usually been pretty empty when I've gone (even weekends 6pm) so you don't have to wait very long. I personally prefer that because you can actually hear your party talking.  It seems like a nice place to watch Warriors games as they've got the big TVs, but no roaring crowd like in a sports bar or other venues to watch it amongst other fans. The decor itself is cajun themed and interesting to look at. 

Service is hit or miss. I've encountered strange waiters who make awkward and semi-insulting jokes, but also really kind and attentive one. I would imagine the service should be better because it's been empty with max 1-2 other parties when I've visited, but who knows.
author: Mary N.

description: Had a Groupon for two. We ordered a pound of shrimp in house sauce, cajun and sweet potato fries, and the coleslaw. Sauce was delicious, fries were great, coleslaw was whatevs. Most sides are definitely overpriced here, but overall, was a pleasant experience, but I wouldn't come out of my way to make another trip.
author: Shendi X.

description:
ORDER:
The Prix Fixe dinner for 2 is a steal at $49! We added 1 lb shrimp (+$14) and it easily fed our party of 4, with plenty of left overs to take home. 


FIXED PRICE MENU 
SERVED FAMILY STYLE for sharing:
* hearty bowl of Clam Chowder for 3-4 people, 
* side of vinegary Cole Slaw, 
* roasted Whole Dungeness Crab, 
* savory Garlic Noodles, 
* 6 light fluffy Beignets to end the meal.
** don't forget your order of amazingly crispy Cajun Fries, free with Yelp check-in!


THE BILL:
All that for $15.75 / person!  
2 pitchers of libations later and we doubled the $ amount per person (whoops), but sans alcohol, the food at Swamp is delicious and reasonably priced.


SAUCE RECOMMENDATIONS:
* "Hurricane Sauce" is the all-in house equivalent of Boiling Crab's shabang: Original Cajun, Lemon Pepper, and Garlic Butter (with a mild curry twist).

* Not your typical "Garlic Butter". The unexpected coconut milk base was rich and savory without being the usual oily sauces at other Cajun seafood spots. 


TABLE FAVORITE: 
Glad we tried the Swamp's rendition of Garlic Noodles, despite the mixed reviews on Yelp. 

Perfectly al dente, aromatic garlic flavor, all without the heavy greasy sauce typical of Vietnamese / Cajun Garlic Noodles. 

Pretty please remain consistently delicious. 


SERVICE:
Friendly and attentive.

The Manager interacted with each table, unfazed by the Friday dinner rush. He seated our party of 7 and explained the Swamp's sauce bases and their levels of heat. Nice guy with a great sense of humor. 

Our server made sure our long table remained well appointed with filled water carafes, plenty of napkins, hot towels, etc., all throughout our meal. 


PARKING:
Metered street parking until 6pm. Small public lot behind the building has a high turnover so once or twice around the block and you'll probably land a spot. 


GIST:
Yes we will definitely be back. Perhaps during Happy Hour (3pm to 6pm).


POST-SWAMP:
If you can muster up the stomach space, cross the street! 

It's almost impossible to save room for dessert but our fam favorites are right across the other side of Geary: a homemade scoop of Joe's Ice Cream or milk tea & boba from Sharetea.
author: Geminyna J.

description:
Last Sunday I visited Swamp. We had fried oysters appetizer I had the clams and mussel boil with two pieces of corn . My friend had a boil with shrimp , potato and corn. Plenty of food delicious and fresh. Service was attentive and it seemed to be a pretty busy place for the Richmond district. 
The food was good  but not too exciting atmosphere ok nothing special.  Clean and fresh they are trying.
author: Stef M.

description:
(....music please!)

Shrimpie, Shrimpie, ya ya, dada!
Shrimpie, Shrimpie, ya ya, heeeereee
Cajun Chocalate ya yaaaaa
Creole Shrimpie Marmalade!

Voulez vous mange avec moi, ce soir.
voulez vous mange avec moiiii.....

I walked into Swamp on a Saturday night with Princess Carewee ready to try that Creole Shrimpie Marmalade. I don't usually pick up chicks like Marmalade on street corners, but i decided that this Shrimp Marmalade was gonna be worth my money.

The NOLA decor here is fantastic. I haven't had the chance to visit the Big Easy, so I think Swamp did me a favor by giving me a sneak preview. You can feel that french-influence here with the thoughtful silverware and also the New Orleans Mardi Gras decorations hanging on the walls. I seriously felt like a Southern genteel while dining here.

The Hurricane sauce here made me raise my Brow like Anthony Davis. They went cray cray on the garlic. So while I loved the taste, I don't think Princess Carewee appreciated my breath during our walk home. (Altoids didn't help) I can only blame myself. I soaked up all the Hurricane sauce with that $1.50 generous side order of crispy French Bread. I didn't get a good night kiss that night and I'm okay with that, because the Hurricane was worth it. 

I can't wait to visit New Orleans, or Moulin Rouge in France. Until then, I guess I'll just listen to Christina Aguilera's Lady Marmalade and get my Cajun experience here at Swamp! 

Voulez vous mange avec moi? ce soir? a la Swamp?
author: Ringo M.

description: I bought vaucher from Social living and visited this place for a first time. I surprised how small the portions for even grilled asparagus, 8 pieces cost $8.50, I am not recommend to go here, you just wasted the time and money and you go out still hungry...
author: Kateryna S.

description: Crawfish is a must  better than where I live...per Cindy owners wife there's is  no Middle man..she orders Crawfish straight  from Louisiana and picks it up  from the SF airport or fishing  dock ....the taste unbelievably is not muddy or earthy taste...your choice to decide if it better than other places. I recommend this place...pls try again  or for first timers...
author: E J.

description:
Came here on a Tuesday after 6pm. It was not too busy so we were seated right away.

We ordered 2 pounds of shrimp (1 lb curry coconut and another garlic butter medium with 2 corn mixed in), an order of cajun fries (free with Yelp check-in), and an order of steamed rice.

Usually 2 lbs of shrimp isn't enough for us - we'd get 3 lbs and barely have any left over. But this time 2 lbs filled us up; probably because the shrimp were a pretty decent size.

I preferred the garlic butter over the curry coconut, but overall both flavors were good. 

At the end of the meal we were offered warm towelettes in a plastic package to clean our hands; it was refreshing and nice.

I would definitely come back again. Especially for the happy hour oyster deal since my boyfriend loves oysters! And maybe to try the alligator dish ...
author: CK G.

description:
tldr:: Food was okay. Prices are a little higher for the shrimp than I am used too. Dark New Orleans kind of interior design and atmosphere. 

Came to Swamp on a thursday afternoon around 3:30 with my boyfriend for their happy hour which runs from 2-6 pm. Place was kind of empty, but groups came in here and there. 

Ambiance/ Appearance:
It was kind of dark inside besides the tables near the window, but I guess that's kind of the feel you would get if you're sitting next to the bar area. Not really digging the interior design, but I am not here to judge what the restaurant looks like.

Service:
The service is pretty good. There was one guy working the front. Only thing that kind of bothered me was that we came in for happy hour, and there is a separate menu for that. We originally wanted to order the happy hour wings and calamari...but when we saw the bill, the guy was like you pointed to the regular menu, not the happy hour one...no big deal though. Wish he was a little more enthusiastic or looked like he even cared about the service, but it's chill; he did what he had to. I liked that at the end of the meal, they gave us a hot towelette; makes the bathroom trip afterwards a lot cleaner as far as touching the handles and what not. 

Taste: 
For appetizers, we ordered the cajun calamari, cajun wings, and got a free cajun fries by checking in on Yelp. The calamari was pretty good, it had like a curly fries taste to it and they were really crispy. The cajun wings were meh... I thought they were going to be dry rubbed sort of wings, but they are really saucy. I am guessing the sauce is their hurricane sauce. I was not digging all the sauce on the wing, although it was okay tasting. Imagine the shrimp sauce on a wing? The fries were really good. They're perfectly crispy and seasoned; comparable to the Boiling Crab ones. 

We also ordered 1 lb of mild shrimp in the hurricane sauce with one corn. Shrimp was so friggen hot, so be careful when you start peeling them. Shrimp was pretty good. Sauce is on the thicker side, but still tasty. 

The bill came out to $60 after tax and tip (bf ordered a lb and 2 corns togo) (before that the total was around $35). I was surprised to see that a lb of shrimp costs $15. I am used to paying ~$10 at boiling crab, so the price kind of shocked me. Overall the food was good. If I am craving Cajun style seafood, I can imagine coming here again, since Boiling Crab is too far away.
author: Vivian Y.

description: Where does one begin with a one star bad review.  The service was horrendous. I was trying to order a po boy and was informed that they no longer serve that. I could have the $58 crab though. In what realm does an $8 sandwich equate to a $60 substitute? Fine, jambalaya wasn't an option so gumbo, hot link, Cajun fries and beignets is what I ordered. Gumbo was pepper, like that was literally the only spice they used. Hot links side was a half a link cut into 6 pieces (seriously?!). Cajun fries were french fries with an over abundance of season salt. And if that wasn't bad enough you can dip your hot link and fries in some authentic Cajun dip made up of a mixture of ketchup and barbeque sauce.  Last, but not least, we get to the beignets.  Only 2 had powdered sugar on them, and they were burnt.  If you are going to make the foolish mistake of burning something, and then have the audacity to serve it, the least you could do is cover that mess with sugar. I laugh now, but at lunch time it was not so funny. Thank God I didn't get the $58 crab.
author: Monica F.

description: Our server was wonderful!  I didn't catch his name, but he speaks Chinese.  He gave us our free lb of craw fish through the Yelp offer.  We always get the coconut curry flavor.  The craw fish were kind of small this time...but still delicious!  They have happy hour on Saturday?!?!?  That was nice.  They have a good list of items on the HH menu (sadly, the oysters were not fresh...I would not get that again).  Beer selection is fair...again, the service was wonderful.  Our server was very attentive and quick with our orders and changes.
author: Karen Y.

description: used to be our fave restaurant but service tonight sucked and garlic noodles was super salty! it took forever for them to replace and our food was cold already!!
author: Jaide F.

description: Being fans of PPQ, we were happy when they opened the Swamp.  We have been here now a number of times, always fresh, tasty seafood.  Last night we started with the garlic fries, good beer on tap and house wine.  We shared the green beans, garlic noodles and a bucket of muscles in the curry sauce, and a bucket of shrimp in the hurricane sauce, everything was delicious.  The noodles are a perfect accompaniment to the muscles and shrimp, perfectly cooked, chewy and doused with garlic.  Messy, but you are given bibs and plenty of napkins.  Service is excellent.  Fun spot to come for the New Orlean buckets of seafood.  Would be fun for larger groups to share even more, clams, crab etc.
author: Carole W.

description:
Came here the other night and ordered fresh oysters, a pound of shrimp, a pound of clams, garlic noodles, and cajun fries. The combined sauce was quite good- super flavorful and not too overpowering. The garlic noodles were delicious and probably the best I've ever had since they didn't have huge chunks of garlic in it like most places. However, the fries weren't very good- not sure if it was the cajun powder or if they weren't fried like other places. The servers were very polite, however, the service was quite slow. It took a while for us to get all of the items and we had to flag down two servers to get our fries (which we finally received at the end of our meal...)

Not sure if I would return.
author: Marny N.

description: SWAMP is one of the best Cajun /seafood restaurants in the SF area . Their hurricane sauce will make anyone sweat and ask for lots a water . I love spicy food . I'll recommend this place to friends and family.
author: Pedro C.

description:
Flavor. Lots of it. 

Unfortunately I've become allergic to shellfish as of last year, so I can't give you a review on the shrimp.

The garlic noodles however were superb - rich butter and garlic without being overly greasy or overpowering. The noodles themselves were firm, not soggy or overdone. 

Clams were cooked will, not chewy or overcooked. Garlic butter sauce was extremely garlicky, which is excellent if you like garlic - you are forewarned. 

Beignets were delicious - crispy and fresh. No Cafe du Monde, but for obvious reasons. 

The service was efficient and quick - nothing fancy needed, but they were attentive and responsive.

The atmosphere was loud, but not obnoxious - Giants and Olympics were on.
author: Kyle C.

description: Great fresh seafood by the pound. Cooked quickly and properly. Garlic Butter is the flavor to get!
author: Jet V.

description: I was not impressed. I got the king crap legs and it really looked like it came it of swap.  Very dissatisfied on my vacation to San Francisco.
author: Kyle P.

description:
We look so happy getting seafood! We ordered 3 dishes and we ordered more.  Crab legs with lemon pepper, clams/shrimp combo with coconut curry, calamari, green beans and coleslaw. I was not a big fan of coleslaw but green beans were great! We needed vegetable.

So fortunate to be friends for almost 20 years and we look like 3 year old babies here.
author: Erena S.

description:
Satisfying meal using the best tools you have...your hands. We had the boil which included crab and lobster amongst other meats and proteins. The marinade was flavorful without being too salty. Garlic noodles were a mass of garlicky and butter goodness.

Friendly staff and decent prices.
author: Julie L.

description:
One waitress to take order and and answer questions
Very slow for food to come to your table
Food tasted okay
Two other waitress were not attentive to refill water glasses
Had to wait 15 minutes for the one waitress to write up our bill.
author: Arlene L.

description: Avoid this scam at all costs. They added a mandatory 18% tip for a table of four. Food was not good
author: Ryan Q.

description:
Service: 

Waiter was 50 flavors of salty and rushed us to order as soon as we sat down. The staff spoke Cantonese to each other and would talk negatively about the customers. 

Food:

Crawfish beignet: Not a traditional beignet. Dough was too doughy and there wasn't enough of crawfish. Very average. 

Shrimp: got the hurricane cajun flavor. The texture of the shrimp was decent and the flavor wasn't bad. Not worth $15.50 for the pound. You can find shrimp of equal quality at other places significantly cheaper. 

Gumbo: Very plain even after adding salt. Didn't taste homey and comforting like a gumbo should. I would not order this.
author: Courtni W.

description: One of the best seafood places in DT San Francisco. Came out here with my family, we had to stop by and get some grub before our next event, the food was great, the server was Very polite, and respectful, I definitely will be stopping by every time I'm in the Bay Area, hands down
author: Ronald G.

description: Came in early on a Saturday night (around 5ish) and was able to get a table (though it filled up fast). Ordered crab, shrimp, and crawfish in the garlic and hurricane sauce. I wasn't blown away by either (the hurricane was a little bland to me and the garlic definitely needed more salt). We also got the garlic noodles and crawfish beignets which were just ok. The experience was fine but everything was only to the point of ok where I wouldn't come back again
author: Sara F.

description:
Don't let the photos on Yelp fool you. I think I am being generous with 3 stars. 
It definitely does not look and taste like how the food is represented in those photos.

The seafood was definitely not fresh. The crawfish was not good at all. The meat stuck to the shells and they barely had any tomalley in them. Ordered an order of potato for the boil and it came with just half a potato.

The crawfish beignets were not good at all either. It tasted like pizza because it had huge pieces of bell peppers. That was mostly what you could taste.
The gumbo was just gravy with some veg in it.
Their signature hurricane sauce was nothing special. I think the boil was better [which means no flavoring]. The spicy habanero spice level wasn't that spicy as well. 

Definitely a poor man's version of Boiling crab.
author: Heejin L.

description: This place is crazy good. I don't know how they only have 3.5 stars. At first, I was skeptical of how good this place could be, but I thought, why not, and bought the groupon anyways. Boy was I glad I did. My boyfriend and I didn't want to order too much at first, so we got 1.5 pound of shrimp and hot link sausages (6). We got the mild hurricane sauce and the sauce was what made us fall in love. It was the perfect amount of sweetness and saltiness, and we doused our plump and juicy shrimp in the sauce before taking each bite. The shrimp was so fresh and sweet! After we finished out 1.5 pounds, it was so good that we ordered ANOTHER POUND and added a garlic noodle as well. Even the garlic noodles blew me away. I hate garlic, but the noodles were soooooo good. It was very simple, but mixing it with some of the hurricane sauce and eating it with the shrimp made it extra tasty. I'm drooling just thinking about how good that meal was. Definitely left very satisfied. I will be back!
author: Vivian T.

description:
HAPPY HOUR REVIEW

First of all, for anyone coming here, buy the groupon. You can use it during happy hour.

I ordered everything on the happy hour menu except for the wings. All food is priced just about $6, raw miyagi oysters priced at $1.25 each.

Fried catfish - Mediocre. Tender inside, decent breading, lame spices for a creole joint. You get small to medium pieces.

Fried calamari - Mediocre. Salty, again not seasoned with spices enough. Enough to share between two people with medium appetites.

Garlic noodles - Standard garlic noodles. Buttery and garlicky. Decent helping, comes in a medium sized bowl.

Oysters - This is the main reason I came here. Didn't want to go to bar crudo or hog&rocks due to my hate of crowds. Standard miyagi oysters. Clean, however $0.25 more than they are at the aforementioned oyster happy hours.. and that adds up since We ordered two dozen oysters.

Draft beers - $4
House wine (looked like a single serving bottle of some grocery store wine) - $4.50
I've heard worse prices for happy hour beers so no complaints.

Service - Very nice, but a bit slow and incompetent, kind of like that really old person in your college101 class who sits front and center.

I'll come back to try the boiled shellfish.. maybe. When groupon has a 25% off deal.. maybe.
author: Douglas Y.

description:
Swamp doesn't sound like the most appetizing word to associate with food but the restaurant keeps with its theme - look for the actual swamp photos on their walls and the gator head at the front door - and is worth the visit. 

I came here on a Friday night with a group and it wasn't very busy so we were able to get a table with no wait. Service was very friendly and warm. We started with the gator sausage which was good. It was salty and tasty but the flavor didn't mimic your typical pork, beef or chicken sausage. There was nothing funky about the flavor but I would say try it if you're curious. I also had the shrimp, clams and mussels (yes, they have mussels which were super plump!) all in the hurricane sauce, mild. The sauce was tasty and not overwhelmingly spiced or too bland but their mild sure tasted like medium. It was fine for me but a little too much heat for others at the table. 

Keep in mind that Swamp does not use plastic bags for the seafood. They actually use big white ceramic bowls which I prefer. You don't have to roll down the sides of the plastic bag or dunk your hand in to search and fish out the seafood. In the bowl, it's easy to see all of the seafood and pick out a piece. Also, I appreciate the use of ceramic bowls which is very green and doesn't produce all the waste that plastic bags do. 

If you want dessert, I saw a sign on the wall saying they now have fried banana served with Mitchell's ice cream. I think it's only vanilla or chocolate ice cream offered but macapuno with fried banana would be bombsies. 

Also, we were able to catch part of a Giants game playing on the TV above the bar, which does have beer on tap.
author: Maya S.

description: Great food, customer service is great.. plus they have lots of flat screens to watch my Golden State Warriors! Plus it's kid friendly place too!
author: Jason L.

description: Warning.. Ownership has changed, I have refused to come back here since my friend ordered takeout after ownership changed and the food was no good and nothing like it used to be..
author: Terilyn T.

description: I give the food 3 stars but an extra star for quality service. Service was amazing! All servers were attentive and really care for their customers needs. There was no wait time and food came out fairly fast! I got 1 pound of the hurricane sauce mild flavor shrimp and clams. If you like tangy with a kick to it, then you will like this sauce. However, shrimp was a bit overcooked but overall a good dining experience. Make sure to check in to get the free Cajun fries!
author: Roseanne V.

description: Made reservations through Yelp for a Friday night dinner for 7 people.  The staff was friendly and attentive.  We ordered the fried oysters (good size oysters!), fried catfish fillets (not the usual cornmeal coating, but it was tasty), sauteed string beans, garlic noodles, two crabs and a pound each of clams and shrimp in the butter garlic sauce (one mild and one medium).  Food was yummy.  They forgot to add our corn and sausage, but quickly brought out the items to add to the bowl/sauce.  Appreciated that they came around to clean out the bowls for discarded shells regularly. Will definitely be back!
author: erika t.

description:
The food here was very tasty! 
I got a lb of crab (pre-cracked) in garlic butter and a lb of shrimp in their Cajun house sauce. I also got the garlic noodles and oysters. The sauces were not overpowered in garlic which was nice. I hate smelling like garlic after visiting these types of restaurants. 
Also the oysters were very fresh/creamy. The service was amazing too. I will definitely be back :)
author: Annabelle S.

description: I'm not big on dine in restaurants unless I know it's a very clean place and this place is that very clean service is nice food is delicious and if your a seafood lover this is the place small and cozy.
author: Ruthy R.

description:
I'm a fan of Boiling Crab and Red Crawfish. But they are both kind of far. The reason I bring up these two is that they are popular in the Bay Area. I've tried other crawfish/seafood places in the city, but Swamp takes the cake. When I can't make it to San Jose, this is the first place I'll go to. 

It's also cool that they provide gloves along with the bibs. My pet peeve is getting my hands dirty and this kept them clean and not smelly. The service was quick and they came by with water often. 

The HUGE plus is that I was there with my family and it was prime time at 6pm on a Sunday and we got really good service still.
author: Cynthia L.

description: Food was okay nothing special. The seasoning sauces very light. It should be  thicker and tasty. Service was just fine. If they make the sauce more tasty and thicker it would be better.
author: Originalall S.

description:
SWAMP is San Francisco's Boiling Crabs. I feel that if I had never tried Boiling Crabs prior to Swamps, Swamps would have been breath takingly amazing! But I tried Boiling Crabs sooo.. well they're pretty much the same thing. I had the shrimp with their hurricane sauce medium spicy. It was finger licking good!! (Literally).. The sauce covered all over my fingers as I was pealing the shrimps, I found myself licking my fingers the whole night. It can get really messy with all the peeling but other than that this place is great! 

Parking around here is terrible. Just a heads up.. lol
author: John L.

description: Service was more than accommodating to our very large party. Also it was a birthday and they cut our cake we brought and served it to us! Excellent waiters and chefs. The food was very delicious and we barely waited. 10/10 would return.
author: Monica B.

description: I was skeptical because of some of the reviews but I usually take them with a grain of salt and go strait to the photos. I'm glad I did with this place because the food was the bomb! The seafood was fresh and the sauces were better than most. We got the Crab with the new peppercorn sauce, yum! We also got the clams and shrimp combo with the hurricane sauce in mild so the kids can have some too. The garlic noodles were very tasty and even better when you add some of the hurricane sauce for a kick, got this idea from another review. The calamari was very good too. I would definitely come back to this place whenever I am in the area. The service was friendly and attentive.
author: Ravenous T.

description: Upset how management changed. New management now charges extra for sauce in the bowl. Owner told me there were $1,$3,$5 options without telling me how much oz are in each size. The servers always hide in the back so no one stays on the floor. Food is still good (I only come when its crawfish season) and glad the yelp check in is available. Overall, I'm on a search for a new Cajun restaurant.
author: Emily L.

description:
We came here because of the Groupon deal. I was a little hesitant because I equate restaurant Groupons with "desperate for business". When we walked in at 4:30pm, I thought my fears were realized since it was mostly empty. They even seated us by the window. A classic restaurant trick to attract outside foot traffic.

But as others have stated, the service here is great. The waitress was patient when we wanted  the crawfish and was told that it was out of season. We ended up ordering a whole crab with garlic butter sauce, the shrimp & clam combo with lemon pepper sauce, 1/2 dozen raw oysters, gumbo with rice, garlic noodles, corn, potato, and French bread for dipping.

The oysters were not that great. I don't think they were as fresh as they could be. The gumbo is one of the best that I had and tasted very authentic. The crab was tasty. The legs were full of meat and I was pleasantly surprised that they included the "goo". Shrimp and clams were fresh and went really well with the lemon pepper sauce. I would pass on the garlic noodles in the future. It was a little clumpy and did not have that garlic punch that you would expect from other crab places in SF.

Extra bonus was that they still offered Happy Hour prices on a Sunday. I would definitely come back again even without a Groupon deal. Also by the time we finished up, the restaurant was 80% full.
author: Michael T.

description: While the service was really helpful and sincerely great, the food was stunningly poor quality considering this restaurant had a four star yelp rating.  I love cajun southern food, I've been to many of the restaurants in San Francisco that offer Cajun food, so I thought I'd mix it up to try a new Cajun style restaurant.  While I appreciate this restaurant's best efforts to try to combine two different genres of food between Cajun and Asian fusion, for someone who loves Cajun it just didn't taste like the type of food I was hoping for.  I ordered three different dishes and none tasted to the quality that I would expect in a 4 star restaurant, let alone two dishes really didn't taste like the normal Cajun dishes I repeatedly enjoy.  All I'm saying is, if you're looking for traditional Cajun food, this is not a place to go.
author: Rhys T.

description: The food was mediocre and over priced compared to other seafood places like so. Also know if you use a Groupon they put an automatic 18% tip so make sure you don't tip twice (unless you want to). It seems they don't go by the fine print or make their own rules up in addition to terms and conditions of Groupon so make sure you ask any questions beforehand.
author: Remeca A.

description:
Awesome.  Not too crowded or loud.  Eating here doesn't get messy either.  

I've ordered the shrimp with lemon pepper.  It's got a nice pepper kick to it; mild and not too spicy, it was tasty.  The garlic noodles are in a small bowl, which was buttery and not overwhelming of garlic.  For fries I recommend the cajun fries over the sweet potatoes, but skip the calamari, it's not worth trying.

This place is comparable to Cajun House, but I prefer coming here instead.
author: Karen L.

description:
This is my third time giving swamp a try. The first few times were not that great. There was something about the flavor that I just didnt enjoy as much as say, Boiling Crab, but I couldn't put my finger on why it wasn't really for me. But, i decided to come back to give them another try because my friend told me that "it got better". 

Coming here a third time, I appreciated that the shrimp is actually fresh, unlike some places that serve mushy, overcooked shrimp! I also pinpointed the flavor that I was not too fond of -- coconut milk! It is a different twist on louisiana boil. It made it taste a bit curry like. If that is something you're interested in or think you will like, this is the place for you! It's also a bit pricier than other places, which gives me another reason why I may not be coming here again any time soon.
author: Nicole L.

description: Food was great and service was awesome. Definitely comming back for seconds. The garlic sauce is perfect mld.
author: Anthony G.

description:
I like that they put their seafood into tin bowls instead of this plastic bag as most other places do.
Service is very friendly and comfortable. 
Beers are available and wonderful to go along with your seafood! 
House Cajun sauce is yum. 
You can add sides into the sauce like sausage or corn. 
The Cajun fries are a good add to munch while you wait
author: Veranna N.

description:
Everything was really good, especially the sweet potato fries, hurricane sauce, and watermelon ice tea. We also had $1 oysters during happy hour- delicious. Took two stars off for the service. They were nice but it took an hour to get our main food, male server said we should have waived him down to take our order. We're used to the server coming back on their own after we asked a little more time to order. 

Overall very good, will come again.
author: Riarose C.

description:
Great first experience at Swamp.

I called to make a reservation one day before our planned dinner but Swamp is closed on Tuesdays. I left a voicemail and the next afternoon someone returned my call  and I confirmed a reservation for 10 people. 

We actually arrived at the restaurant about 20 minutes before our 615pm reservation but were seated right away since it wasn't busy. Two of us were able to redeem a Yelp check in offer for an order of Cajun fries which was cool. We placed our orders and the appetizers came came out about 10 minutes later. Our entrees were served another 10 mins after that. 

My boyfriend and I shared 2 pounds of shrimp w medium spicy hurricane sauce and it was perrrfect! Just the right amount of spice, nothing unbearable and still very flavorful. We also got corn and garlic noodles. For dessert we got complimentary orders of their beignets for Swamps one year anniversary. They were very light..would be yummy w some chocolate sauce or Nutella mmm. A couple folks with our group ordered the fried banana w Mitchell's ice cream - one mango and the other vanilla (I think?). Gotta get on that next time. 

Anywho, great service and yummmy food. Our waiter was super friendly and even hooked it up w paper bags for our food to go lol. Will definitely be back here soon!
author: Camille B.

description:
Note: New Ownership. Didn't know that until we walked in and sat down.  Sad to say that the service is very lacking now. We had a party of 7, and for some reason half the food came out first for 3 of my friends. While they were eating, the remaining 4 of us waited an additional 30-40 minutes for our food to come out (Overall, it took about an hour.  I know because I had to re-feed the parking meter). When we asked why it's taking so long, the server said  "because your orders too big.." Come on! We honestly should have just canceled our order. 

We used to be regulars here, but I do not think we will be coming back here any more.
author: Shawn S.

description:
Best crab place in sf I love how they cut the crab shell for you to make it easier to get to the crab 
Yum
author: Ruby M.

description:
I've been on a seafood kick lately. Specifically crawfish, crab and clams! Swamp is one of the places in the richmond I haven't tried yet, so I thought I'd pick some up on the way home. Got there right before 6p, so I got the happy hour discount. 15% off. Yay! I tried to be the greedy Asian girl I am and get the free fries as well for the yelp check in, but no luck!

Crawfish, original cajun, spicy habanero. Just a warning. The spicy habanero is not really that spicy, so if you're afraid of burn your mouth off spicy, this is NOT that. Someone that normally likes med will probably be okay with this. The original cajun is sauceless which I knew when ordering, but I actually found that I was missing the sauce! It was missing that juicy saucy goodness!

Clams, hurricane, spicy habanero with sausages. This is what I ended dunking the crawfish in. The clams were a little sandy. Maybe they didn't soak and wash them properly? But the sauce was good. It just needed an extra spicy kick to make it super delicious! Sausages were good and normal sized slices.

Crab, garlic butter, med with corn. Crab with garlicky butter?! Yum! My one complaint was my crab had one normal sized claw and one tiny anorexic claw! I kept thinking, did this come from the same crab?! It made me feel a little gypped! Corn was yummy. I kept dunking it in the garlic butter with every bite!

Garlic noodles were nice and al dente, but needed a little more garlic to really be garlic noodles.

All in all, I'd give the food 3 stars, but with the happy hour discount, they get 4 stars!
author: Elena N.

description:
Don't be fooled. There is nothing Cajun or New Orleans about this place.  The food is mediocre at best.

I ordered crawfish beignets, which were more like hot pockets with oozing cheese and no crawfish at all.  I ordered alligator sausage, which is mostly pork with a splash of alligator spice.  My partner ordered a bowl of crawfish with corn and potatoes...and the best part of his meal was the broth.  The crawfish was meatless.  The meals were overpriced and very flavorless and disappointing.  If you want something close to New Orleans cuisine, go to Hard Knox.  At least they have sweet tea.

Don't waste your time here.
author: Di P.

description: Love the food here. We're from San Diego and we're craving for seafoods. Would totally recommend the place especially their happy hour.
author: Susan B.

description: I feel like I've just discovered the delicious deal of the century. We checked in on Yelp to get the free Cajun fries, then ordered the $59 prixe fix for 2. Slaw, chowder, garlic noodles, a ton on crab, and 4 beignets??? Hello heaven, I've just died. I'll be back.
author: Adele A.

description:
My expectations were completely non-existent.

Got the Crab in Hurricane boil, medium spicy. Was pretty bloody awesome.
Got the shrimp in lemon pepper, as spicy as that ran. Flavour was great, though some of the shrimp at the end were a little overcooked. (possibly cooking while still in the serving pot)

Really awesome hole in the wall in terms of flavours
author: Donald C.

description:
Variety of fried dishes, assortment of shellfish, and great for large groups!



Grilled Alligator Sausage ($6) - I was excited to try this as it sounded exotic on the menu.  However, I'll pass on ordering it again the next time I visit.  It just tasted like a regular pork sausage.  

Hush Puppies ($6) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/swamp-san-francisco#c8IXP1U-QtPQbdq8kFQmPA) - You get about 7 or 8 in a basket.  Too doughy and lacked in flavor.  I'd say skip this.

**I initially ordered a dozen oysters, but the waiter came back and said they were out, which was why I ordered the hush puppies.**

Cajun Fries ($3.50 or Free if you check-in on Yelp) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/swamp-san-francisco#LWCwmvTqXVsBgOrZ05S5tg) - A bit salty and lacked in heat.  However, can't really complain since it was free!

For the assortment of shellfish, there are four different boil flavors and spiciness levels to choose from.  

Boil Flavors:  Original Cajun (no sauce), Garlic Butter, Lemon Pepper, & Hurricane (all-in)

Spicy: None, Mild, Medium, & Spicy Habanero

1 lb. Habanero Hurricane Crawfish ($12) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/swamp-san-francisco#rTkc1evTmPI4g7lCfa9pYQ) - Tasty, but too spicy for the hubby.  I enjoyed it.  Next time, I'll have to order a side of French Bread to sop up all the sauce. 

1 lb. Medium Hurricane Clams ($12) - Clams were huge, but a few of them weren't edible as the shells weren't opened all the way. I felt like we didn't get our money's worth since there weren't a lot of clams in the bowl.

Service:
Friendly & attentive

Parking:
Can be a challenge since it's on Geary Street
author: Candice H.

description: The service was amazing! I have never had someone come and refill my water, soda, and napkins like they do here. The servers are also so friendly and had smiles on their faces the entire time. I'm so happy I went there! The food is also amazing! So much food for such a good price. Everything tastes fresh and the spices they use are amazing! Thanks swamp!
author: Nelly L.

description:
Came here yesterday for a late lunch with my bf! We got here around 3pm, and we were happy to see that their happy hour is from 3-6pm, and you get 15% off your bill!!!! (SCORE) Also we were super excited because with a yelp check in, you get a free side of cajun fries.

My bf and I each got a pound of shrimp in the hurricane sauce (cajun, garlic butter, lemon pepper, and coconut curry mixed together) with corn, along with garlic noodles and the cajun fries. 

The cajun fries came out first--thin crunchy fries covered with cajun seasoning. Loved them!! After a while they did get a little spicy, but you have to expect that from anything cajun haha. The shrimp came out next in bowls! I liked this because your hands don't get as messy (for example, at BC or craw station you have to reach your hand into the bag and get your whole hand dirty haha) and it came with a spoon! We ended up spooning our hurricane sauce on top of our garlic noodles and O M G they were sooo good!! The garlic noodles were definitely a nice addition--needed a starch to cool our mouths off from the hurricane sauce hahah!! Super garlicky and not too oily.

The sauce here is thinner than boiling crab or kicking crab, but definitely has good flavors!! I loved the addition of the coconut curry and I could definitely taste it! The only gripe that my bf and I had about the sauce was that it was pretttty spicy. I don't necessarily like or dislike spicy stuff, but I can definitely tolerate it; my sauce definitely had a bigger kick than what I was used to for "mild"! Next time I know to order non spicy, because my bf's sauce still had a kick to it even though he got non spicy (probably just the cajun flavoring). 

Prices are around the same as craw station on 9th. Shrimp is $14/lb and I think that is a bit expensive. The garlic noodles were $7.50 and I think the fries were $3.50 (remember to check in!!!)

Because we came at an off hour, there were only 2 workers but they were both really nice and attentive. The total for the bill was around $34 too!! Great price considering we were both stuffed after!
author: Tara A.

description: Fried cat fish fillet tastes really good, they also make great Cajun food. Sweet staffs, nice service
author: Jing S.

description: Food is pretty good! We order the hurricane cajun and garlic butter mild spicy and I think which is perfect!
author: Xu J.

description: Terrible service. They straight up forgot our food and we had to ask for our order to get started. Never want to have to advocate for my meal
author: Caitlin T.

description: We indulged in raw clams, shrimp in garlic butter sauce, deep fried soft shell crab, cajun fries, and gumbo soup. Overall, the food was fresh and pretty decent though we had to flag the waitress down few times since during our lunch time there was only one waitstaff running around. Pretty good deal since we brought Groupon, can't complain. Most definitely, returning for crawfish season to get our Cajun fixes.
author: Stella L.

description:
Came here on a Friday afternoon around 3:30. It wasn't busy which is good so I can take my time enjoying my food here. We ordered a pound of clams in garlic and butter mild sauce, a pound of shrimp in their house medium sauce, garlic noodles, and we also got Cajun fries for free with a check in. I really enjoyed their garlic noodles the most! I think they have the best garlic noodles here. Their Cajun fries were also well seasoned and cooked just the way I like them, perfectly sized and crisp.
The sauces were really good and well seasoned! 
The garlic and butter seasoning for the clams were great! They used a good amount of garlic and butter so it covered up that clammy smell. The Cajun house seasoning for the shrimp was great and I was surprised the by the size of the shrimp. I thought it was a really great portion and everything tastes really fresh. Will be coming back here again when the cravings hit!
author: Michele W.

description: Not bad. Lots of shrimp and clams
author: R W.

description:
We came here for my husband's birthday and enjoyed our meal!

For a party of 5 adults we ordered (and were completely stuffed after finishing):
- 2 lbs of crab
- 1 lb of clams
- 2 lbs of shrimp
- 3 orders of sausage
- 1 order of gumbo
- 1 order of garlic noodles
- 1 order of cajun fries (free with yelp check in!)
- 5 pieces of corn

Food came out at a good pace and the only hiccups we had with our meal were that the sausage was accidentally left out and that we were slightly overcharged for the crab special. To Swamp's credit, each issue was quickly remedied! We also used a groupon with the meal which helped bring down the cost.

We're already talking about the next time we'll be going back!
author: Jenny C.

description: Soooo love this neighborhood spot. When they are busy the service is slow but-----the hurricane shrimp absolutely awesome
author: Lisa T.

description: We walked in the restaurant for the first time because we found a parking close by and the pictures on the window looks great. We select the option two people for $59 recommended by the waitress thinking it would prob cover good food and she emphasize the crab is good. I saw there's a crab or lobster option but we wasn't being asked. The first food came Out was cold slaw which was okay. And then come the clam chowder which was good. But the main dish came out was one crab and it wasn't fresh. The meat are soft and falling apart. I am a sea food lover and I would know the different between fresh or Dead Seafood which I think the crab was dead before they cooked it that's why the meat are not chewy and soft. So for the price I would think you get some quality food but I guess not. The garlic noodle was not bad, a little too much garlic for me but It was just my personal preference. Also the waitress ask for what side dish would I want and I said French fries and I saw an extra charge for French fries.  I didn't look carefully to see if French fries was on the side dish menu but if it was not she should still let me pick a side dish that came with the order and lastly at check out I wanna pay with my birthday gift card and she said I'm not sure if the machine will take it. I just get so upset at the end. I think I would have liked it more if we order individual items like crawfish, shrimps or clams
author: Serena Y.

description:
First experience but won't be my last!

It's better than boiling crab, hands down! The perks are the food, service, and watermelon iced tea. 

Make sure you get the garlic noodles!
author: Lei F.

description: Very good garlic noodles. Lobster, crab, and sausage were wonderful. The happy hour special is wonderful too.
author: Erik O.

description:
I am the poster child for Swamp! (Inside joke between my bf & I, hehe) 

One thing for sure, this place isn't swampy, hehe. I've been here twice and have had a good experience for both. My bf & I were both craving cajun food (second time) and it was between Swamp & Cajun House. Last time we were to Cajun House, it was super crowded, hard to find parking, and a bit of disappointment after purchasing a GroupOn deal. Swamp is located on the busy streets of Geary, but I don't think parking is too bad as compared to 5th Ave.. and they also have the awesome check-in deals for dine-ins - FREE cajun fries as appetizers! 

The interior here kinda brings me back home in NOLA because of all the festive decorations they have up. The staff is friendly and attentive. The manager(?) I think .. whoever the guy is, is funny. 

My typical order is always a pound of shrimp and a side of corn and rice. Hurricane flavor with medium spicy (always a regret). 

Pricing for my order: 
Shrimp - $14/lb 
Corn - $0.75
Rice - $1.50 
Coke/soft drink - $2.50 (free refill!) 

I guess for my review, I will let you know what my bf & I do. When our order comes out, we like to dump all the shrimp onto the plate to cool off. After a couple mins (even when still kinda hot), we peel all the shrimps and dump the excess remains into a bowl (provided by staff) and put the shrimps meat into the bowl that it came with (into the sauce bowl). Before we add the rice into the sauce bowl, we take out the excess sauce with a spoon and put it onto our plates, since we have no where else to put it (and in case you took out too much, you can add it back in). Lastly, we add the rice into the sauce bowl that already has the shrimp, and we mix it! Ta-da!! Even the manager guy liked our idea! ;) 

As for the medium spicy, I always forget that I shouldn't order it and regret it during my meal. For my second visit, I asked our waitress how spicy it would be and she said on a scale of 1-10, it'd be a 6. I took the chance and it felt like an 8!! T_T I should just order mild next time .. 

From what I remember on our first visit, we ordered Grilled Alligator Sausage ($6.50) and it tasted like chicken to us. It's always a good experience to try something new though, even if you may or may not like it. The gumbo ($8) from what I remember was good, nothing all that spectacular but maybe I'm biased because I lived in NOLA for awhile. 

Overall, I always enjoy my experience here and would definitely come back. When ordering the pound of shrimps, I highly recommend the hurricane sauce! Add a corn to your liking too ;)

Want to know the inside joke for the poster child thing? It's cause my bf & I were seated next to the front window when the restaurant was empty. People would see us eating and stop and stare or look at the menu before walking off or coming in. We would have a little argument that one of us was catching the attention and being the poster child, haha.
author: Mandy G.

description:
Very nice place - very clean 
Great staff 
I had to give it three stars because I got the steak and most definitely tasted like it had been frozen and not fresh. A $25 steak should not taste like it's been previously frozen sorry. The veggies and french fries were good.
author: Philip C.

description:
Sooooo... this place is quickly becoming one of my addictions. I'm what you would consider an Asian version of Mr. Bubba, himself. 

I sure do love me some shrimp. 

I like 'em sautéed, deep fried, barbecued, on kabobs, grilled, sashimi style, etc etc, but most of all, I like 'em boiled and slathered with heavily seasoned sauce. 

Mmmm mmmm! 

I came here late night ready for some good grubbin' and sure enough, I was not disappointed. 

I've tried the dungeness crab in coconut curry, coleslaw, cajun fries, hot links, garlic noodles, grilled asparagus, sautéed string beans, and a pound of shrimp tossed in spicy hurricane sauce. It was all so good! 

As the indecisive person that I am, I would recommend the hurricane sauce. It's a combination of all the sauce options. No need to choose. You get it all! Personally, I think it tastes best too.

Oh and don't think you can roll up in here all cute and dainty. They hand you a bib for a reason. I must've been flinging crab meat all into my hair throughout the entire dinner. 

Great service, casual ambiance.

Winner winner shrimpy dinner.
author: Ann S.

description: Came here on a Saturday afternoon and it wasn't busy at all. I ordered the two item combo with shrimp and crawfish in a spicy habanero lemon pepper sauce. The amount of spice was perfect. I liked that all the spices didn't clump up at the bottom like at Boiling Crab. The shrimp was a little overcooked but the crawfish was amazing and super fresh. The only thing I didn't like was the Cajun fries because they put garlic flakes and just too much garlic overall. Happy hour deals are good and the service here is great!
author: Michelle Ann C.

description:
It has been about a year since my last visit to Swamp and when I went then, I fell in love with their hurricane sauce, but today it wasn't good at all. Today, my crawfish seemed a bit off. The sauce wasn't think like the first time and it was very bland. The crawfish hadn't soaked up the sauce yet either so that didn't help either. 

My first time when I visited Swamp the older gentlemen (owner I believe) was so spunky. He was cracking jokes, he was funny and super friendly. This time around he wasn't as nice. He was actually a bit rude. Just seemed very short with us and we weren't asking for much except refills and lime. Hopefully next time I come back he will be in a better mood.
author: Joolz N.

description:
It was my second time eating here with my boyfriend and I have to say...it's probably one of my favorite seafood spots. It's close to home and it's not crowded like how boiling crab is. Don't get me wrong, I do love boiling crab, but there's something about Swamp's Hurricane seasoning that just taste so much better to me than the whole shebang. Another thing that I love is that they have garlic noodles, which taste equally amazing as the seafood does.

During the weekdays, they open at 2, which to some can suck, but the cool thing about this place is that happy hour is from 2-6. Honestly, with an instant happy hour like that, I'm definitely not complaining! The staff is amazing, they're not like other seafood spots that serves you and checks in only once, they'll come back to make sure that you're doing alright and ask how your turned out.

Can't wait to come back!
author: Kasandra S.

description: I came here at 4pm on a Monday afternoon for happy hour, and the restaurant was empty but clean. I was promptly greeted and seated at the bar. During happy hour, both the fried calamari and the garlic noodles were $5 each. The fried calamari came with a lime and cocktail sauce. It was fresh, hot, crisp, with little kick--delicious and a bargain at $5. The garlic noodles had a lot of fresh garlic, but were a bit dry and not my preference. I'd like to come back for the oysters during happy hour some day.
author: Chris H.

description:
My wife and I had the crawfish beignet and Cajun fries as our appetizers.  The beignets were so good I had to preemptively snag my 2nd half out of fear my wife would steal it!  Fries had just the right amount of seasoning.

The pound of shrimp with the medium spicy hurricane sauce was good, and it really should be ordered with some bread so you can sop up the sauce.  That sauce was *really* good.  

We also ordered their lobster special with the "Golden Shallot Peppercorn" seasoning and it was excessively good.  Take a lobster, chop it up Chinese style, and then Cajun-ize the seasoning.
author: Herb L.

description:
After reading decent reviews I was pretty excited to try swamp. But when i tried it, it was average, nothing to write home about.

My friend and I checked in and we got the promotional free sweet potato fries. They were ok, very crispy but they tasted like ones you get from the frozen aisle at a grocery store.

Seafood:
Hurricane shrimp with medium spice: 4/5- had a good amount of spice and seasoning to it. It was nice that it was in a bowl so that it wouldn't be that hard to scoop shrimp out. It was similar to boiling crab but not as flavorful or buttery. 

Garlic butter clams : 2.5/5- it was mainly shell. Did not taste garlic or butter in the sauce though it was cream like sauce. The clams itself were perfectly cooked. But the lack of flavor, did not help.

Total for 2: $40
Overall, it was an ok experience. Would I come back? For the hurricane shrimp, yes. For garlic butter clams, no. Also come during their happy hour from 3-5 you get 15% off the bill.
author: Stella J.

description:
We had a large group of 14 people for a birthday and the service was amazing!  They were  attentive and very fast with cleaning up the waste bowls (which is so important for places like this).  The food was delish! Recommending the Lemon Garlic shrimp and Hurricane combos!  

Great for large groups!
author: Gabbi d.

description: The food was good but the review receives 3 stars because the lack of service.  The waitress could not figure out what table ordered what between the only three occupied tables in the restaurant. The waitress never came back to fill our water glass and I had to remind her half way through our meal that we were still waiting for our garlic noodles. Ya I'm not coming back here.
author: Mike W.

description:
I first went there after searching Yelp for new places to try.  I came across this one.  Being from South Louisiana, I'm always searching for places to "take me back".  

On Jan, 18, I drove to SwampSF from Oakland.  Not really set on a particular dish, I order the Oyster Po-Boy, to go. While waiting for my order, I wanted to buy one of their shirts, but the server couldn't find the size I was looking for.  :(  

When I got back to my car, the food smelled so good, I had to try it before I got home.  I ate half of the Po-Boy before I put the car in drive.  It was delicious.  Perfectly fried.

I told my coworkers about the place.  I could tell their mouths were drooling.

On 2/2, I took a coworker friend there.  He order the fried catfish and hush puppies.  I ordered the gumbo and crawfish beignet.  He was blown away with the catfish and hush puppies.  He's still talking about it.  My gumbo was good, not like I had growing up, but it was a good "fix".  The crawfish beignet was interesting.  It wasn't bad.  I could taste that it was frozen and it wasn't fully heated through.  There were "cool" spots in the middle of the beignet and crawfish.  I'll pass on ordering it again.  Overall the food was good, and they had the size of shirt I was looking for.

I'll definitely return.
author: Scott A.

description:
Check-in on Yelp for free cajun fries!! And happy hour between 2-6pm = 15% off entire check! 

Overall, Swamp seems to be a cleaner, "classier" version of Boiling Crab with a more extensive menu (garlic noodles and other hot dishes). However, prices are more expensive at $12-15/lb and service is much slower and very spotty.  

I've only tried the shrimp ($14/lb). The shrimp is fresh and HUGE (perhaps better quality than Boiling Crab) and the Original cajun flavor is really good. It is also a lot cleaner and easier to eat, because it is served in a bowl instead of a plastic bag. 

Service was really really slow.. and spotty. 

I would eat here again but only because there is no Boiling Crab in SF :( and because there is no wait!!
author: Samantha C.

description: The food was mediocre. The shrimp was overcooked, crab legs were rubbery, meaning it was reheated, and the crayfish tasted like the inside of my freezer. For $100 I was really hoping that they would have something that we'd like that night, but instead we ended up going to Quickly for their popcorn chicken. This place needs better quality control and maybe more servers.
author: Anthony N.

description:
The food wasn't as good as I wanted it to be. I got the clams, shrimp and crawfish in the hurricane sauce and all of the seafood was fishy, with the shrimp being the worst. The shrimp had a heavy fishy flavor and were overcooked and rubbery, the clams were also rubbery, the crawfish had the best texture of the three but didn't taste fresh. 

The garlic noodles were fine. Mixed with some hurricane sauce they were great. 

The Watermelon Tea was good, lots of fresh watermelon. 

The service was ok but for the price I paid it just wasn't worth it.
author: Bobbi C.

description:
I came here when my family was in town and I wanted to take them to a place like this with big seafood pots.  I probably wouldn't return though.  

Their sauces were tasty enough, but their actual seafood wasn't fresh.  I can still remember the taste of the crawfish, you could tell it wasn't fresh and was long dead and probably just frozen and defrosted.  It reminded me of meat that has freezer burn or something.  

If don't care that it isn't fresh, perhaps you can try this place but I still wouldn't order the crawfish.  Maybe stick to clams and mussels, those weren't as bad.  

You can also consider this place if you want to catch a sports game.  They have some large screen TVs up too.
author: Elaine C.

description: Came to this place on Yelp due to the high reviews, but found it to be absolutely disgusting!  Seafood was extremely NOT fresh, in fact, it stunk!  I love mussels (love seafood in general), but the mussels here were not edible, they stunk and tasted terrible!  I wasn't able to eat them.  Even soaked inside the sauce they still tasted nasty.  The Hurricane Sauce was nothing special, pretty bland, in fact.  The garlic noodles were also bland.  Would never come back to this place.  Disgusting, old seafood.  The Cajun wings were pretty good, so one star for that.  Seafood - zero stars.
author: Jennifer W.

description: Garlic noodles were great. Fried catfish was very good. Fries were good. Calamari were good. Hush puppies were forgettable. Hurricane shrimp were dull. Service was super slow even though the place was almost empty and there were a couple of people on duty.
author: Kris F.

description: I've always had a good experience at Swamp. Every time I've been, there hasn't been a long wait. The waiters are very attentive to customers and check on you frequently. Compared to places like Boiling Crab where they serve their food in bags, Swamp serves it in big bowls. I really like this because it's easier to dip the food into the sauce and its a lot less messy. I love the Hurricane Sauce! You should also try Lemon Pepper mixed with Garlic Butter. A pretty good mix! Their Garlic Noodles are decent, but they taste pretty good when you add the sauce from the seafood! Give it a try! Overall, good experiences here and don't forget about the free Cajun Fries with a Yelp check in.
author: Carmelisa M.

description:
Our group of 5 came here around 6pm on a Saturday night and we had no trouble getting seated. We started off with 2 dozen oysters. They were good (pretty big + fresh) but not amazing. We also got free cajun fries for checking in on yelp. The fries were fantastic.

I ordered 1lb of shrimp in the hurricane flavor, no spicy. The hurricane flavor is the Boiling Crab "whole shebang" sauce equivalent, with all the boil flavors combined. The sauce was comparable to other similar places I love (Boiling Crab, Kickin Crab)- it was flavorful with a good consistency. 

However, unlike the other places, Swamp's Hurricane sauce contains coconut curry which really made a noticeable difference. I could very distinctly taste the curry and the coconut was very fragrant. Not sure if I liked it or not, and probably could have done without it, but it certainly was interesting. 

For portions, my friends and I felt like they gave us less shrimp than other places do. Amongst our group, 3 of us frequent Boiling/Kickin crab in the Bay, and usually we're more full after 1lb of shrimp than we were at Swamp. But actually I felt like the potentially smaller portion size was perfect, because I was at a good level after the meal. 

For sides, you can choose several things to be added into your sauce. I highly, highly recommend getting at least 1 or 2 pieces of corn. The corn is sweet and hot, and tastes super good drenched in sauce. We also ordered garlic noodles, which I thought were phenomenal. The bowl was pretty small (think 2 girl adult hands cupped together) but it was worth it because the noodles were insanely good.
author: Michelle J.

description: If you like boiling crab or kickin crab. This is the place I would recommend to go to. Other than the places I went around SF because it's too far to travel San Jose. This is by far the best Cajun flavored crawfish or shrimp place for me. They have groupon deals as well. Try it!
author: Majell V.

description: Very good and well priced. Garlic noodles were good. I loved the spice on the calamari. Try the curry coconut. Not too spice so you could add a bit of heat to it. Nice owner. He's working the tables and offers great suggestions. Not much for alcohol selection so don't come here for the booze. The wine was decent though. Come for the seafood and service. Great to support a local small business!
author: Heather W.

description: Great, unique dining experience. The menu is simple, but with so much to try. It was my very first time having oysters on the half shell, and thanks to this place, I'll be having them again.
author: Nicole K.

description:
We are all looking for that Boiling Crab comparison without the distance and long line waits. I want to say, as of so far, no one can really compare. We have to set a new standard of just saying what taste great without any comparison to Boiling Crab.

For the Swamp, it is highly recommended as its own entity. Compare to all the other Cajun crawfish / shrimp / seafood restaurants, this would have to be the next best that I have had so far. If i really needed a fix, i would definitely come here again. 

From its atmosphere to friendly staff, it was definitely worth the trip. The shrimp sizes were larger than Boiling crab and for the crawfish was larger in its head, but the body smaller. My only complaint would be that the food did take a while to come out and some of the crawfish wasnt of quality. I have had this experience with crawfish at boiling crab as well.

Like the rest of you, i had my hesitation in trying this place, trying to find the next Boiling crab. Going to other cajun places that have been severe disappointments in taste and pricing. But this was worth it and i have no regrets.

Swamp does have a different take on its sauces, but it is not without flavor. It is more of an Asian flavor though and could be more bold.

Pricing is comparable to Boiling crab, given you dont forget that there is a groupon and free fries upon yelp check in.

Places i have tried and are ranked from Favorite to least favorite:
The Boiling Crab
Swamp
The Kickin' Crab SJ 
Tom's Crab Shack Concord

I would Rank "Swamp" and "Kicking crab" being similiar, But Swamp being slightly better. Sorry to say, Tom's Crab shack was flavorless and i would never be going back.

I also have to beg to question, why is it that boiling crab is the only place that has good corn?
author: Nunyo B.

description:
Louisiana crawfish are back, but crawfish season is ending soon. They're still better than the Sac crawfish, but I think some tonight were frozen. 

Service is as good as always and the hot, moist towelettes are always a nice touch. 

Beignets? Why thank you very much!

We're curious what the new flavor of coconut curry will taste like. Maybe we'll hit up some crab (finally) once crawfish season is over.
author: Dylan T.

description:
Giving it 5 stars based on the service. 
Stuff I liked: 
Friendly and attentive waitstaff 
Free Cajun fries
The crab
15 % off my bill for being there during happy hour
So much food!!!
Found parking in the back
