The decor is cute. 
The instant instagram feed 

Stuff I felt could have been better:
Not enough napkins!!!
The music! They had radio Disney on which was awful. In keeping with the theme of the restaurant, why not some southern classic rock like C.C.R. or Lynyrd Skynyrd?
author: Lobster G.

description:
This is the place I go to when I want some Cajun shrimp. I mean it's nothing compared to the one in New Orleans but pretty close. The Garlic noodles are so delicious! Get the garlic shrimp and the hurricane shrimp. I usually mix the garlic sauce mixture with the garlic noodles!  super garlicky goodness. She's calm fries are free when you check in. 
The service there is great and the guy there is super funny. And it doesn't hurt that the lady walks around with a giants red cup to take away all the shells. It makes me feel less like a fatty cause it doesn't seem like I ate as much as I did. Haha 
Will definitely go back there sometime soon. :)
author: Fanny C.

description: My fiancé and I ate here on Valentine's Day and it was fantastic! Very friendly people, great service, reasonable price and great food. We got curries muscles and garlic butter clams and both proteins were huge and delicious. They also have great clam chowder and the crawfish beignets were awesome. I definitely recommend eating here.
author: Alexa M.

description:
I came here for dinner, but I got my food to-go, so I can't comment on the dine-in service. But all of the workers were very nice and accommodating. 

I got the crab prixe fix dinner for two, and it was totally worth it! The chowder was a nice start, but it was a tad too pepper-y. The crab had a garlic butter sauce, and it was delicious. I just wish the pieces were cracked a bit more. The garlic noodles were very tasty as well. The cole slaw was pretty standard. And the beignets were a little disappointing. They weren't very fluffy, and they were a little too oily.
author: Rachel H.

description:
After reading some of the reviews, I feel like it all comes down to preference. I prefer Swamp's Hurricane sauce/flavor (spicy), rather than Boiling Crab's. From my experience, I thought Swamp's was less greasy than BC. I always feel like crap after eating at BC, because of all the grease. I had the crab in the Hurricane sauce (the Hurricane sauce has a sweet, curry taste to it), probably smiled the entire time eating it haha. The shrimp with lemon pepper is definitely what I will order the next time I come back.

Side note: They do serve pitchers of beer.

Tip: You get one free cajun fries with check-in.

+Staff were friendly and attentive.
-Inside looks a bit outdated and tacky. I could imagine Chef Robert Irvine come out of no where and do a Restaurant Impossible make-over.
author: Ron D.

description:
Came here with family! My uncle knew the owner so we got a discount :)

It was my first time eating Crawfish and honestly, I did not like Crawfish because of how small it is. Instead, I liked their clams and shrimps which were spicy and flavorful! If you are not a very spicy person, get the lowest spicy because it is really spicy. 

I LOVED THEIR GARLIC NOODLES!!! The Alfredo sauce with one of our seafood bowls were PERFECT to mix with the garlic noodles! Their sauteed garlic string beans were delicious too but Im not sure if it's worth the price. 

I'd be happy to come back with family!!!
author: Josie D.

description:
We used to love coming here, and were very friendly with the previous owner and his family.  However, after tonight's visit, I doubt we will be coming back...

On the door today was a notice of change of ownership - not a great beginning, and it didn't get better from there on.

Although the food was basically the same (however, who on earth skimps on an order of rice???), the service was severely lacking, both in timeliness and in honesty.  I had to waive down a server whenever we needed anything, from getting menus, ordering, asking where our food was (it took about 40 minutes for 2 lbs of shrimp to come out), and then asking where the rest of our order was (garlic noodles came, for some reason, at the very end of our meal).  Regarding the garlic noodles, it was pretty obvious that they basically forgot we ordered them.  Instead of admitting it, they kept telling us that it was because the kitchen had to make "fresh" noodles (despite other tables around us getting their noodles).

Overall, we're not coming back.  So sorry to see such a wonderful family run place take such a turn for the worse.
author: Michael A.

description:
Some homeless people's signs say "not gonna lie - it's for beer". I'm not gonna lie either - I ate here solely because hushpuppies were on the menu. Ordering a mixed pound of spiciest-level clams and mussels was just a forgettable means to an end.

How were the hushpuppies? I say above Boxing Room (which isn't intrinsically saying much) and below Brenda's French. My second-opinion Southern friend & I couldn't wrap our brains around the presence of whole corn kernels, but the overall texture and taste were in the acceptable range of what can be expected in this part of the country.

I may be back to try the alligator sausage or to get more hushpuppies. But if the not-all-that-hot Hurricane Spicy Habanero was their highest heat level, I'm going to look elsewhere for seafood boils. I heard some place has an X-Men danger room Torgue explosion type level.
author: Dan B.

description:
Definitely my to go place when I'm craving for boiling crab. The BF and I usually order a lb of shrimp in either the hurricane or garlic butter sauce (both really good) with 6 pieces of hot link, 2 corn, and garlic noodles. Thats enough to fill us up until the next morning ! Go in the afternoon because they offer happy hour and no wait. 
 This restaraunt is a must try!! don't forget to check in on Yelp for free Cajun fries.
author: lala l.

description:
Fiancé wanted me to try this place, since there are no Boiling Crab restaurant near San Francisco area. Walked in and it was dead, but we arrived around 5:30pm so it was still early. I ordered combo with crawfish and shrimp with garlic and butter while fiancé ordered shrimp only with all the garlic and butter and coconut curry. We also check-in on Yelp to receive free cajun fries, a bowl of rice, garlic pasta and oysters for appetizers.    

Oyster came out first and they were decent. The seafood comes in metal bowls and they give you empty bowls to put the shells which is nice so you don't a mess make everywhere. It took awhile to peel the seafood because it was scorching hot, but we were hungry so we fought through the heat to peel them. My fiancés' one pound shrimp had about 10-12 shrimps in there and I had 6-7 shrimps and 9 crawfish. We managed to eat everything in sight and was pretty satisfied and full. 

Overall, I have a bias because I compare all seafood places to Boiling Crab and this restaurant is decent, but not as good as boiling crab. I personally don't like curry sauce in my seafood so that's why they lost a star for me and as the prices for boiling crab is cheaper than Swamp. Service was excellent and I would go back if my fiancé wants to go.
author: Christina N.

description: this will forever be my favorite Cajun place in SF!!! Get their clams, they're super big. Their mussels, on the other hand, are kinda disappointingly small.
author: Jenefer N.

description:
Walked in for happy hour with the Missus. We were pretty excited about getting our Cajun on in SF. 

Inquired about happy hour because I didn't notice it listed anywhere.

I made the mistake of asking if it was a certain percentage subtracted from the bill. Let's just say I was off by 5%. 

He, waiter/owner/Old Man River, then took it upon himself to berate me, condescend me, and literally question my intelligence for a few minutes. All of this while pressuring us to order. 

A real top dick, this guy was. 

Then it hit me:

I really don't want to give you my money! I really don't! Not under any circumstances! So, I picked my jaw up off the floor and we left. 

It's funny because all he had to do was correct me and leave it at that. Mistakes happen and it's no big deal. I was about to order king crab legs for Christ's sake!

There was no need for trying to put me in my place or whatever the hell he was doing. It's no wonder there was NOBODY in there during the last 15 minutes of happy hour. 

There's no happy here at Swamp. Just over-priced, Cajun bandwagon crap that can't hold a candle to The Boiling Crab. I don't even have to eat the food to know.

I do get the namesake, now. You'd have to be raised by bottom-feeding, swamp crustaceans to treat customers in this manner. Truly appalling. 

Give it up, guy. 

It's not worth it. 

Just leave it, mate!
author: Aren A.

description: Just came here last night for a nice dinner, and a nice dinner was what I got! Food is amazing, wish I had played with the menu a little more than I did. There's a lot of things I missed out on that seems delicious, until next time! I was recommended by my boyfriend, so I didn't really get to check Yelp about what's good here, so I sure missed out on a lot! I love how the staff & the manager always come by & check on how you're doing, really fun guy! Will be back!
author: Mikayla T.

description: This is a top favorite restaurant for my husband and I. Our go to items are: raw oysters, Cajun fries, garlic noodles, the shrimp and crawfish (Hurricane Cajun, medium), and sometimes we add the sausages. Highly recommended eatery, also not bad as take out. I have a long drive home, so I reheat the shrimp/crawfish by throwing everything into a pot on the stove for a few minutes.
author: Calina N.

description:
Came here for dinner because a friend told me that it was a good place for groups and we had a reservation for about 15 or so people. 

I ordered a bowl of rice  and a pound of crawfish and clams with the medium spicy hurricane flavor which was a combination of 3 different flavors. I was worried about the combination of flavors combined together, but it really is good! Although it was only medium spicy, I found it to be more spicy than I had hoped for, so I had a bit of trouble eating my hot seafood. The manager was very nice and the food was delicious! I even got a free order of seasoned fries with my check-in! One of my friends ordered the alligator sausage just to try, and it was also delicious as well!
author: Christina C.

description:
We order to go a whike back and decided to try this place at the restaurant.    Parking is difficult at this location.   The owner is chinese and he speak cantonese to us.   He is very friendly.   We ordered the following-

Wings - the batter is thick and the seasoning is bland

Catfish - its okay but not great

Shrimp - its good but the hurricane is very spicy

Crab - my fav dish,  it tasted good.  most cajun place cook their crabs without  the flavor.
author: Wasabi L.

description: The worst service ever. Ordered for pick up on eat24, had the confirmation email, shows up on my app, even have ID to prove it was me but the server won't allow pick up because there was no button on the yelp app to confirm order pick up. Yes I understand there might be people who take other people's food but there are SO many other ways to double check you're giving the order to the right person and to not even try it but give the customer attitude that's just bad service. While I was writing this review and waiting for a rep from yelp to pick up the server finally decided to give me the food with a terrible attitude. The food wasn't even good enough to make me want to deal with this kind of service ever again. Do yourself a favor and go to the other Cajun food place in inner Richmond.
author: Vera K.

description:
This place was so OFF THE CHAIN I wanted to BARK!  The 2 pound crawfish that we ordered with the hurricane mild sauce was like opening up a can of whoop ass on your taste buds!  It has been Taste bud certified by me! 


The Cajun fries had me at helloooooo.  Can you taste me now?  This place makes Joe's Crab Shack look like a piece of root beer cake that not even grandma would eat hahahah.
author: Brent M.

description:
I ordered:
-Alligator Sausage (~$6?) - It came with a side of cole slaw. I wasn't expecting it to taste anything different than a typical sausage, so that's what it tasted like. Since they use alligator meat, the portion is smaller than a usual sausage. 
-Crawfish beignets (~$6?) - I was mildly disappointed with this. The taste was kinda "fishy" and the dough wasn't light and airy as what I would expect from the texture of a beignet. 
-Shrimp (1lb, mild spicy hurricane sauce) ($14) - I was expecting this sauce to taste close, or nearly close to the shabang boiling crab but was deeply disappointed. Not only did I feel like the portion of 1lb was smaller, but the sauce was bland and flavorless.
-FREE Cajun Fries w/ yelp check in - It could use more seasoning, but hey it was free? 

I give them 3 stars for a good effort and I guess if you live in SF where there is no boiling crab, this is the closest thing. Most of the dishes I had were lightly salted so at the very least, its slightly healthier/less sodium than boiling crab? :P
author: Michelle H.

description: One of my favorite place to eat at when my friends and I crave for seafood. I love their cajun fries and the fast service. The food is delicious!!!
author: Marjorie K.

description: We ordered the shrimp seafood boil with the garlic butter sauce. It was really filling and big enough to share. I would recommend trying the grilled alligator (really yummy seasoning) and the seafood gumbo. The oysters weren't the best I've had in the city.
author: Alli N.

description: Terrible service and portions are a ripoff. The "2 lb" lobster was really a tiny 1 lb chicken lobster. It took 50 minutes to come out and the meat was cooked onto the shell. The food came out completely out of order and the lobster came out well after everything else was finished. Will not be going back. Don't believe the portion claims it is a RIPOFF.
author: Stephen G.

description:
The service was excellent. They constantly keep you shell bowl empty and your cups of water full. 

Food: Lobster was decent for the price. But the garlic butter was awesome. Get that on everything. 

Clams were small. I don't recommend. 


Tip! Don't forget to get the free cajun fries with the check in.
author: Christopher S.

description:
One word summary: Delicious!! 

I got the Hurricane sauce crawfish with garlic noodles, and man, this is easily some of the best Canjun food I've had. The spiciness is definitely there but not intense - it's really the right good amount of spice for what it is; it really compliments the flavor instead of covering it up. A good amount of it probably comes from the garlic, too. I could just keep eating those noodles and crawfish and that sauce forever. The cole slaw as a side was very good too!  

At $10 for lunch it isn't super cheap, but it also isn't terribly expensive. It's enough for two meals if you're paying intention, but with how delicious the food is, I wouldn't be surprised if most people polish it all off. 

I went here for lunch, and it was basically deserted. I highly recommend it, such good food really deserves more attention than that.

Will absolutely definitely be back, and I'll bring friends. I probably won't order alligator though :(. Poor alligators :(.
author: Chris S.

description:
I came here at happy hour and loved that we got 15% off before 6! We got hurricane flavored shrimp/clam combo, garlic noodles, corn and clam chowder.  The shrimp, clams and garlic noodles were top notch but clam chowder had about 2 clams in it. Spent abut $27 total for 2 after happy hour discount.

The waiter got friendly towards the end but started off a bit rude and standoffish and that's why this is 4, not 5 stars.
author: Stephanie T.

description: i come here religiously for their happy hour menu. dollar oysters, and 5$ wings, catfish, calamari, garlic noodles and beer !! i really like the garlic noodles and their hurricane sauce is bombb. its decently priced for a cajun house, a little on the pricey side but its whatever. i like that they use bowls instead of plastic bags- feels less cheap and i don't have to worry about plastic melting in my shrimp. parkings not too bad theres meter everywhere and even if they're all taken up i just wait a minute and someone will leave lol otherwise theres a lot but all i gotta say is this is probably one of my fave cajun spots. all time favorite happy hour spot forsure.
author: Diana N.

description: The food here is great! Shrimp in hurricane sauce (that is of course if you like spicy) is very delicious. We also get crab in butter sauce with corn and sometimes potatoes. Additionally, the alligator sausage with coleslaw is very good! Definitely check this place out.
author: Masha V.

description:
"This is definitely not first date food," my friend remarked, crab juice spraying all over our faces, red sauce dripping down our wrists to our elbows, shrimp legs and shells clinging to our lips, all manner of sea creature bits wedged in our nails and between our teeth. I almost agreed whole-heartedly, wondering what poor date would be able to stomach the sight of me mangling cooked crustaceans in my hands and then ingesting them, but then I had an important revelation. No, this is THE first date place for me. The ultimate test, if you will. Because if this guy can't see the sexy when I'm in the throes of utter foodbliss, in this state where I plan to be as often as possible, then sorry, we are over before it even starts.

My life was incomplete before being introduced to the wonder that is the hurricane sauce here. Butter, garlic, spice, an overwhelming symphony of flavor and sinus clearing!! Shrimp are fat and crisp, clams plump and fresh, crawfish large and juicy. The dungeness crab is also fantastic, but I find that the pound of other seafood is much more worth it. Be prepared to look like you did just trek through a swamp, but hey, embrace it. Lick that sauce from your fingers and revel in it. In the words of my fabulous dining companion, "There are few socially acceptable places to wear a bib, even though we need one most of the time". So don that bib, get all up in that saucy seafood, and go crazy with it.
author: Carol C.

description: everything i've ever had at swamp has been five stars. great service too. the hurricane sauce here is off the chain! last night we came here for girls night and had - one pound each of the mussels and shimrp, garlic noodles, fries, wings, asparagus, crab in a 'new sauce' that theyre test driving and the crab beignets. if we were any more of savages than we already are, we would have polished off the entire table full of food. it was amazing. i think i will take my parents here when they visit!
author: Christina L.

description: We had a bad server! He was very rude! First he gave us a hard time using Groupon because he thought we lied about our party size. In order to use it the party size need to be 4 or more. We had four people but one is running late. Then he decided to kept our cash change without saying anything even though 18% tips was already included in the bills. It's very interesting that somehow he thinks he deserved 30% tips for his services. Won't come back even though the food is really good :(
author: Peter N.

description: I saw someone post pictures on Yelp, so I checked out the Yelp page for Swamp on Geary in the Richmond and decided to bring my friend to try it. He kept talking about having crawfish at a restaurant, so we finally did. I had 1 lb. mussels and clams with garlic noodles, hush puppies. and crawfish beignets. We tried quite a bit off the menu. The total came to $55. I also got a diet coke and they gave me refills. Service is nice. Owner comes by and checks out his customers. It's got this Asian influence, and for me that makes me feel at home.
author: Denise C.

description: Love love love this place.  The free cajun fries for checking in are a big plus and I love that they serve the seafood boil in special heating bowls rather than plastic bags like others do.  I always order the hush puppies and a variety of shellfish in their hurricane sauce. Compared to other places that serve boiled and seasoned seafood, Swamp has a great non oily sauce.  My hands aren't covered in grease after eating here. This place is good for groups, but make sure you make a reservation on weekends since this place is pretty popular.
author: Joanne T.

description:
When I was craving Cherry Stone clams my friend suggest we go here. She told me that she's been here once and their cherry stone clams were really fresh. And when I came, it was! It hit the spot and I was completely satisfied. 

As for other food, we ordered 1lb of the garlic butter shrimps with hot links and corn and a side of garlic noodle. The shirmp was on the bland side (not much flavor besides the shell). The corn and sausage on the other hand soaked up the sauce and tasted amazing! And the garlic noodle is just garlic noodle on the soft side. 

Would come back here but probably would not get the shrimp again, but it was really fresh (the shell came right off as you peel it).
author: Tiffany C.

description: The food just so so , service ok . I order habanero sauce 1# shrimp & 1# clams Nothing special , garlic noodle it's no good .
author: tang c.

description:
When I don't feel in the mood to take that 2 hour drive and wait for an extra 2 hours in line for the Boiling Crab, Swamp destroys those cravings for Cajun food, in a good way.

I love the tornado mix at medium, (similar to the whole shabang at the Boiling Crab), and the shrimp is also flavorful and amazing. However, I'd wish they would add some more garlic to the sauce which ultimately gives it an extra kick to the whole order. The sides are also pretty good. Especially the cajun fries which are the bob dot com. Crisp and tasty and an exploding taste of peppers gives this dish an authentic thumbs up! The garlic noodles are also very scrumptious. 

For dessert had the beignets. Really small plate but I guess it was because we used a free yelp deal. -_- Pretty tasty, but by that time I was already full so I didn't enjoy them as much.

Overall, Swamp is my next favorite after the Boiling Crab and plus it is more local and less of a wait. Whenever I crave that good tornado sauce and those cajun fries I will hop on over to Swamp.
author: Jessica E.

description:
This place is just okay.. Just dont come with high hopes. Come for you seafood fix without a long ass wait. I came with a party of 6 (on a Saturday) around 3:30 and there is was only 1 other party of 2 so service was fast! Our food came sooner than we expected. 

Skip the crawfish beignets, i was excited but there is nothing but bell peppers in it, you're lucky if you get a tail every 2 bites.

Regular beignets are good.

Garlic butter sauce was ok, it probably would have been a better experience for me if i got something spicy.
Thai tea was good! We ordered 3 there and 1 to go
I'd come back for the garlic noodles and if I really wanted seafood

Service was super friendly and helpful.
author: Dee S.

description:
K. I might be screwed because I live on the other side of the bay and I simply enjoy Swamp WAY too much.

Came back last night because PPQ was packed like no other.

I think Swamp has put the finishing touches to their meals ever since opening. Food comes out quick enough (But it's never fast enough when you're starving!), sauce is on point, and noodles were springy and perfect.

Asked for the sauce to be Xtra Spicy, this is a good spice. It's 'ssss' inducing, but no face numbing over from pain. I personally think you should order two different sauces for the variety.

Noodles were springy and perfectly garlicky. They have a secret ingredient to make sure it keeps moist and delectably creamy. I can't say that I didn't think it might be one of the best garlic noodles I have ever eaten.

To top it off, they have a pitcher of beer for $12 (Blue Moon, Hennepin, Sapporo, etc) until Football season is over on Mon and Thurs.

And yes, the $49 set dinner was pretty bomb.
Cole Slaw
Clam Chowder
Crab
Garlic Noodles
Beignets (PS, soft, light, fluffy and ridiculously powdered in confectioner's sugar. YUMMY!)
author: Winè C.

description: Where do I start......I really do expect great service where ever I go. These people were so overwhelmed the young girl was running all over the place. I hate when I have to flag you down to get a refill, napkins or  whatever. Food was ok, it was over cooked and dried  out. Boiling Crab is my spot for Cajun crab boil messy stuff in a bag. Swamp needs to get there s$?t together.  I won't be back I'm good. This was our Valentines Day dinner and was disappointing.
author: Ali W.

description:
Had high hopes for this place due to all of the good reviews and I must say, it definitely lived up to my expectations. We came on a Saturday night around 9PM. Called in about 15 mins early to see if there was a wait and the person we spoke with said he would save a table for our party of five! Got there and there was a table ready for us in a packed restaurant, how awesome is that! 

Now onto the food..

We had the grilled alligator sausage, calamari, and Cajun fries for appetizers -- so good!! Calamari and fries were perfectly crispy. For the entree, I went with the 2 item combo with shrimps and mussels drenched in Spicy Habanero Hurricane sauce. Crawfish was out of season. :( The flavor was so delicious!!! The combination of all of the flavors complimented so well with the side of garlic noodles! Fully enjoyed every bite of it. We also ordered the gumbo which was just OK. It wasn't bad but I wouldn't order it again.

Compared to Boiling Crab: the sauce was not as thick, but definitely flavorful. It was much easier to enjoy as they put it in a bowl instead of a plastic bag.. Easier to use a spoon to scoop up some delicious sauce onto my garlic noodles with shrimp. They both have distinct tastes so if you're used to eating at BC all the time, then make sure to come here with an open mind.

Service was great! They tended to us quite regularly and cleaned up our table as much as they could throughout the course of the meal. No complaints there.

Overall, I would definitely come back! :-)
author: Nhung D.

description:
Ate here yesterday. Cannot believe how wonderful the service was. Bill was completely accommodating and was very attentive. We had a 6 people the food was out quickly. 

We ordered garlic noodles, hurricane crawdads/clams with corn. Garlic butter clams and shrimp. 

Everything was delicious and affordable. I really enjoyed eating here. If not for the food... Do it for the service. You won't be disappointed
author: Julie N.

description:
Yummy yummy! I love crawfish, garlic noodle, and corn and butter and POTATOES! Definitely coming back when I get a craving. :P 
I had to take a star out though cause they took forever to take our order. Me and my boyfriend got there on time but my friends were running late. And once they got here and was seated, it took maybe 20-30 minutes before they approached us to take our order. :/
author: Stephanie Z.

description: This place is welcoming! The workers are really nice! I'm from SoCal and came to San Fran for vacation this place reminds me of boiling crab and kickin crab back in so cal, but taste so much better. I would really recommend people to trying this place out if you love seafood! I recommend getting the garlic noodles it's amazing they have happy hour from 2-6 and the garlic noodles are 5 dollars during that time. I also got 1lb shrimp with butter garlic it was amazing!
author: Juliette B.

description: I visited this restaurant on a friday evening. The place was packed and booming with business. The food was off the charts. I ordered 1lb of crawfish - garlic butter seasoning - and it was ahhhhmazing. My lady went in for 1lb of shrimps - hurricane cajun - and finished it for a petite frame girl that she is. I was impressed in terms of service, managerial interaction, food quality, ambiance, seating, and food choices. I will bring a party here to enjoy and taste the sweet serenity of seafood heaven, then maybe head home and sh*t it all out - praying mantis style. Extremely satisfied customers. Recommend.
author: Robert L.

description:
The cajun food lover in me stays true to Boiling Crab. Swamp is a decent alternative if San Jose is too far.

On separate occasions, I've had the crawfish, cajun fries, chicken wings, shrimp and sausage. Cajun fries and chicken wings are okay, items that you can find anywhere at a different restaurant. Shrimp and crawfish are pretty decent, the sauce is runny and has a watered down consistency unlike that of Boiling Crab's oily and thick sauce. The sausage are perfect bursts of flavor and definitely spice up your bags of seafood.

The service here is always amazing, just wish the food was a tad bit better.
author: Mabel Y.

description: Our 6th time back! Celebrating Mother's day! 1st time having their raw oysters platter and they were supermouth-watering fresh! 2lbs of Hurricane (Medium) Shrimp and their delicious garlic noodles! Every time gets better and better :). Definitely recommend this place for lunch and dinner!
author: Annie T.

description: True creole/Cajun restaurant all the way down to the alligator sausage! First time eating something like this but had a great time and enjoyed the food! Oysters were good but I've had better. Fried catfish was very good and the garlic butter boil with garlic noodles was pretty amazing! Service was ok, had a few moments we had to wait for but all in all it was good. Be prepared to work for your food but I'd say it's worth it!
author: Conchita L.

description:
This place was ok.  The staff was friendly and the sauces we had (garlic butter in one bowl and hurricane in the other) were decent.  The shrimp and crawfish were pretty good, and the crab wasn't bad, but it wasn't good either.  It didn't taste fresh.

I'll probably try another place for the next time I want cajun style seafood.  If you haven't been here before it's worth a shot, but I won't be back unless I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Heywood J.

description:
SWAMP. In my book, second only to Boiling Crab. Yea, I went there. So good I had dinner here twice in a span of four days (and no, I'm not ashamed).

My typical order: pound of shrimp, mild, hurricane sauce, and one cob of corn. YUM. If you're still feeling famished, throw in an order of sausage as well. The hurricane sauce is SO friggin good. My friends and I think it is tomato based. Who knew a sauce that wasn't loaded with sticks of butter would still be delicious? Not me, no siree bob. And dinner would be incomplete without some sides. We checked in on Yelp and got an order of cajun fries on the house. Crispy, crunchy fries, with a bit of a punch--so good. Even better cause they were free. Also yummy were the deviled wings, alligator sausage (highly recommended if you are a fan of Spam haha), garlic noodles, and of course some french bread to sop up that decadent sauce. 

The owners are really nice too. They like to come around and make sure everything is dandy. Great service, yummy food. Swamp's where I'll be when I'm in the city and too lazy to drive to Boiling Crab.
author: Audrey T.

description:
I was a first timer to "Swamp" last night (Friday, October 10th) and I must say my first experience was a tasty one.  I had the gumbo with rice with lots of hot sauce (I love spicy food) - it filled me up and was tasty. My friends had the shrimp (1 lb. on the mild side, and 2 lbs. with butter and garlic). Both were scrumptious. The atmosphere is laid back, and the staff was very attentive, friendly and humorous. Overall, it had a family homey feel which I liked. I even bought myself a "Swamp" t-shirt the staff was wearing.  

I will definitely be back.
author: Marie M.

description:
Came here with friends on a Thursday to grab lunch. My friends are fans of seafood, especially crabs so we decided to try the place. Unfortunately, i didn't get any since I'm no seafood person but instead ordered a Five Spice Chicken w/ Garlic Noodles. I actually came out full from finishing so it was worth my dollars at least. The noodles were my favorite and the chicken was alright. My friends said the crab was tasty and went well with the sauce. The crab came in a large bowl. As you eat, you toss away the shells in another bowl that they provide you with you. The crab was no doubt pricey because of the seasons. 

Service was good. The server we chatted with was awesome. He walked some of the stuff through the menu for us and made recommendations. We got free fries from checking in. The place was clean and had some music to go along with the dine. The place wasn't too busy around noon on a weekday. Overall, good food for the experience.
author: Tony C.

description: Thursday night dining for 2. Had the crab dinner special for $59. Includes clam chowder (3), 2 lb crab in sauce of your choice (3+), Cole slaw (4), and beignet (4) for dessert. Food was fine and a great value, but the service was atrocious. 2 wait staff split time at our table.  During the meal BILL at least checked in once. But the waitress IGNORED us completely, never asking anything and actively avoided us! It took us almost 30 minutes to get dessert after dishes were cleared, and only after I walked up to BILL at the register!Fire your waitress and turn some tables = happy customer= make money
author: Scott S.

description: Average food but good service. Ordered a pound of shrimp in their hurricane sauce, some crawfish beignets, and checked in for free cajun fries. Fries were good, crispy and the seasoning was banging. The shrimp was pretty fresh and big - definitely no baby shrimps in the bucket. I was really excited for the beignets but I guess when you expect too much, you become that much more disappointed when what you get isn't what you wanted. As other reviewers mentioned, it was pretty fishy inside - I had to mask the fishy taste by dipping it in the hurricane sauce... though the breading outside the filling was a lot, it soaked up the hurricane sauce pretty nicely.
author: Ava F.

description:
Just went to Rockin Crawfish about 4 or 5 days ago so will compare to that.

I was so happy the sauce was thicker here than at Rockin Crawfish, but ultimately would still want it thicker.

The shrimp was mediocre but the crawfish was good.

I enjoyed the Cajun fries as well although the seasoning reminded me of the one used at Quickly for their fries and popcorn chicken.

We ordered for pick up and the older Asian man was very curteous.  The place was clean and I liked that our to-go items were neatly packed in large box and instead of bagging the seafood, it was in Tupperware - just felt cleaner.

Unfortunately, the food wasn't memorable but I would definitely be willing to try again.
author: BizzyLizzy K.

description: Came here with some friends on a Saturday night. Like everyone else recommends, don't forget to check in for free cajun fries! We had the clam chowder, garlic noodles, shrimp, and crawfish. Like every cajun seafood restaurant, the sauce is always extremely flavorful. What stood out to me was the sweet french bread that customers usually order to dip in their  sauce. Of course we had to try it, and it was great! The bread comes out warm and lightly toasted. Nothing extremely exciting, nothing bad either. No complaints here.
author: Annie L.

description:
0 Stars (weren't served after 30 minutes so don't know if the food was good).

No service.  Really, no service.  We had to get up and walk over to talk to several waiters over the course of 30 minutes asking to be served.  This was despite new customers being seated and their orders being taken.

Finally we got up and left.
author: Tony Y.

description: Pretty empty late afternoon on Monday, but that was a good thing.  My friend and I got two dozen oysters each ($1.25 each, happy hour price), fried catfish appetizer, and cajun wings. All very decent, full of flavor, and very fresh (for the oysters).  Would repeat.
author: Maksim S.

description: Mixed reviews and craving seafood.  I can wish for Boiling Crab to establish one in the city all I want, but that won't help me.  And driving to San Jose is like far.  Swamp seems to be okay and we enjoyed all the stuff we ordered:  2 pounds of clams in lemon pepper & garlic butter sauce, shrimp, corn, garlic noodles, fried oysters and beignets.  All were delicious.  Don't expect it to be Boiling Crab-like seasonings though because then you'll be disappointed.
author: Emy B.

description: The seafood options were okay--I like the Hurricane boiled flavor the best. Don't forget to get a bowl (or 2 ) of garlic noodles!
author: Benjamin A.

description:
Whenever my Mom and I are craving Boiling Crab, we head to Swamp. 
We always get there before 6 to get Happy Hour pricing (15% off) and we love the staff. They're always friendly, attentive and the "scraps" pile of the shrimp and clam shell bowl is always emptied.

My go-to order there is usually 2 lbs of shrimp in hurricane mild, 1lb of clams in hurricane mild, 2 garlic noodles, 2 corn and FREE Cajun Fries (via the Yelp Check-in). I love how the clams are always huge and all of them are open. I hate it when I go to restaurants and half of the clams aren't cooked. The shrimp has always been big and not overcooked. 

The Hurricane sauce that combines all of the sauces together creates a distinct sauce that separates them from Boiling Crab's Whole Sha-Bang. Perhaps its the addition of herbs and spices plus the coconut curry? I think I may like Swamp's sauce the best out of all of the Cajun food places (boiling crab, craw station, kicking crab).

My Mom and my favorite item has to be the GARLIC NOODLES!!! We used to order one order and now we get one each. One of the staff told us it was the same recipe as  PPQ Dungeness Island!! Ah! No wonder! You must try the garlic noodles. 

I hope Swamp sticks around, its definitely my favorite cajun/boiling crab style restaurant in San Francisco for sure.
author: Leah F.

description: I ate here once and it was not bad. Service was so good and it was really fast. The food is so good and tasty
author: Mahima D.

description:
I really, really cannot understand how this restaurant got up to 4 stars. We ordered:
garlic noodles.......extremely dry and not garlicky enough. Did not have any sauce to wet it up and add flavor.
cole slaw because there was no other salad type dish....too much mayo and $6.00 for appr. 1 cup.
raw oysters...OK
cooked oysters, catfish, calamari, shrimp.....All had the same "cooked in old oil" taste and though crispy on the outside, raw batter inside.  Felt punished for ordering too many  fried foods!
crawfish beignets....Lacked flavor and not sure if they were supposed to be crispy or not.  They were not  and much too gummy and bready.
chicken wings.......comical. 6 miniature size 2nd portion only  wing part slathered in ????sauce. $1.00 per part.  Definitely not spicy. We get the 2nd portion only in many Asian restaurants. When we finally requested that they throw in a drummette or 2 we were told that is the way they come in the bag. No choice.  Cheap chicken meat!  Some other restaurant gets the bag of drummettes I am sure for a higher price.
All of our dishes came out one at a time so, we were eating cole slaw with nothing else. Raw oysters arrived at the end. Calamari was hard on the outside and rubbery on the inside.

I really feel bad writing bad reviews, but I do not want anyone going with too high expectations and being very disappointed.  If I had read reviews prior to going, I probably would have been more disappointed because they do not reflect our experience. If you take the chance, I hope your experience does not mirror ours.
author: LaVerne B.

description: My daughter and I decided to try something new & we love seafood. We decided to ordered takeout of gumbo, fried oysters, alligator, garlic noodles & fried shrimp. Can you say delicious. The alligator was on point! I ordered so much but I didn't realize, they gave us a box. I definitely will be going back & trying more menu items, plus the oysters & gator. I really struggle with guilt from eating the gator but gosh it's good...
author: Tosha F.

description:
Dispite some bad reviews, I still decided to give them a try and I have to admit; I'm so glad I did. I absolutely love there hurricane sauce (combo of all the sauces they offer in one). I took the sauce home to go to eat over rice. 

I ordered crawfish (which I asked prior if it was fresh and told they were indeed fresh) but they turned out to be frozen. Other than that little issue, I am now officially now a fan of Swamp. 

Their fried chicken wings are crunchy and perfectly seasoned. The raw oysters are perfect size and very fresh. 

The service was great too.
author: Smiling T.

description: This food is too labor intensive. Both my guy and I had upset stomach later. The boiled sea food not so much , but the raw oysters were yum yum and taste really fresh. Skip the crawfish . Too much shell around the small amount of meat. Good price 4$ for a nice IPA pint.
author: Johnna G.

description:
It was our first GNO of the holiday season and what better cause do we have to try out Swamp, the new Cajun house on the block? The four of us strolled in at 8:00 to an empty restaurant. Sweet, no lines at all! Although I predict that there will be lines in the near future.

Birds of a feather do flock together because the 4 or us almost had identical orders. Together, the 4 of ordered a total of:

4lbs of shrimp in hurricane mild- I was so impressed by how big and juicy they were and the sauce was nice and thick.
4 corns -- perfectly flavorful
18 sausages --can't vouch for this since I didn't order any
1 order of alligator sausage - The only thing I would suggest to skip-- I'd say it's a one time thing only to test it out

 I like it that they serve their food in a bowl instead of bags-- it helps the food cool down quicker to avoid burning of my fingers when I'm peeling away. My only complaint of the night is that one of the servers (maybe the owner) kept coming over and insisting that we should order more food. I felt that we already ordered enough and felt almost like he was being a pushy salesperson. Other than that, the service and the food was great!

To be extremely honest, I wanted to head right back the next day but I resisted. It's the holiday season and I'm indulging enough that I really don't need to have two rounds of Swamp in two days.
author: Tiffany U.

description: Loved it so yummy. It made such a strong impression the first time; we went 3 days later. The vibe is very vivacious. We brought a BABY with a stroller both times and they were super accommodating. When the baby woke up from her nap and cried, it wasn't awkward at all because there was a lot going on with good music and lively conversation.
author: Marie L.

description:
I was so excited to find out about crawfish restaurants not too far from my house. This place had four stars, so we thought to give it a try.

We got the crawfish in hurricane sauce with corn, sausage and potatoes. Be sure to check in for free cajun fries!

Unfortunately, I was disappointed. I've had better. Here are the reasons why:

1. Crawfish comes out in a bowl. A BOWL. What happened to the bag? I know SF is an ecofriendly city, but come on! I love rolling  my crawfish around in the sauce. The bowl isn't as fun and the sauce stays on the bottom.

2. I don't think the crawfish were fresh and along the same lines, they were small. BOTH disadvantages to a high rating. 

3. It's weird, but I expect the typical teenage staff - they move fast! Sometimes, it took us forever to get SWAMP's servers' attention. 

Overall, it satisfied my craving. The fries made the dinner worth it - they were yummy. I also like additions, so corn, potatoes and sausage were great too. The Hurricane sauce was okay - we got mild and probably wouldn't be able to handle the other levels. Be sure to ask for salt, pepper and lime sauce. They don't bring it out otherwise. We may be back...maybe.
author: Mimi V.

description: Swamp is so good I make sure to workout real hard before I come here so I can eat one of everything. I especially love the gumbo, garlic noodles, clams boiled hurricane Cajun style & habanero spice level. The gator sausage is amazing too. Do come here, bib up & nom!
author: Katie W.

description:
Friendly Staff, good food. The crab is cut before cooking, which isn't my favorite, but everything otherwise is great.

Definitely would recommend for a 'Boiling Crab' style seafood fix.
author: Alejandro V.

description:
Great crab! Awesome garlic noodles and wonderful dessert. We also had excellent clam chowder. I loved everything they had to offer and can't wait to come again for more crab. 

I'm absolutely coming back, with even more friends. This place is kind of unknown, and deserves to be shown off.

One final thing. The staff was great, they gave us excellent service, and we were treated well.
author: Ariel S.

description:
I went here with with my boyfriend and we enjoyed it!

My review is based on our experience at Boiling Crab, Craw Station, and Cajun House. 

What we ate:
1 pound Hurricane Boil Shrimp: Mild $12/lb
Cajun Fries: $3.50
2 Corn: $0.75/each
Sausage (6 pieces): $2.50
Steam Rice: $1.50

Total cost without tip: $22.79

Food Review:  Overall Good

Hurricane Boil Shrimp: Mild 
 - Great sauce but we were looking for something with more "POW"/ spiciness.
- The sauce had a great texture where it was not too watery and not to thick. 
- Shrimp Tip: Peel most of your shrimp and put it back in the sauce or else it will taste bland
 
 Cajun Fries
- Normal portion size.
-Lacked Cajun flavor: basically it was regular french fries. (We asked to get more powder on it to make it better -- and it did)

Corn 
-Good corn but we wished it had a more crisp kernels. 
- The boil tasted great on it

Sausage 
- Flavor was average
- Small portions but consistent with the price

Steam Rice:
-Slightly sticky but acceptable

Service Review: Above average
- The waitresses were very helpful but both were definitely new to the job.
- They were so helpful that they asked if we were "ok" 3 times within 10 minutes 
- Additionally whenever we were close to running out of water they filled it up
- Another patron asked what was in the jumbo and the waitress did not know the answer besides "chicken and ......"
- Friendly staff

Decor/ Environment: Good
- Large seating area
- Bar Seating
- Large TV screens
- Top 40 music playing

Tips & Thoughts
- We will come again!
- Happy Hour 3-6PM which is 15% off everything (beer & wine included)
- You can order beer by the pint and wine by the glass or bottle -- hopefully they have beer pitchers soon!

Ranking local San Francisco Cajun Styles Restaurants: 
-1. Swamp
-2. Cajun House
-3. Craw Station

**Boiling Crab is still the best!!!!**
author: Janelle P.

description: Best cajun seafood place in the bay!!!! Fyi to everyone who dropped a comment to this place "if you want spicy order spicy" don't complain that it's not spicy if you ordered mild lmfao. Hurricane extra spicy is bomb trust me!!!!
author: Tommy Rainier C.

description:
$50 for a three course dinner for two that includes crab! It's pretty good and it's totally worth it. 

So I have been looking for a good Cajun place in the city that serves delicious crabs and oysters. But when I saw the dinner for two I couldn't say know. It comes with coleslaw, clam chowder, crab, garlic noodles, and beignets! That's a great deal if you ask me! The crab was alright but everything else was great! The restaurant is Chinese owned and the service was great! I was extremely full by the end of the meal and felt that I got my money's worth. 

I didn't know what to expect when I first came to this place but I am happy that I have it a shot.
author: Jacqueline C.

description:
Yum. This little spot is the best Cajun in the neighborhood. The decor really is in need of some major help. It's your basic florescent filled Richmond restaurant but the food and service are great.

The Hushpuppies are very good. Try them. I do every time.
Alligator sausage is OK and I'll have it again but not every time. 
The Clam Chowder is good. If you like chowder you'll like this.
Hurricane sauce is really very good. Request bread so that you can eat it all after you finish your crawfish.
author: Justin S.

description:
No more driving to San Jose to get good seafood Cajun food. Food was really good, priced super low, customer service was awesome. 
Note to owner: as a small business owner myself, get your business out there! We had a hard time finding you online, and I would have paid more for the food. It was really good.
author: Parker S.

description:
What an unexpected surprise! We saw this restaurant's high rank in stars and raise and got dressed up to enjoy their food.
 This place is super casual and the food was amazing. The crawfish Benitez were delicious as well as the catfish fillets. Cajun and Asian fusion is the taste we didn't know we needed.
author: Johnny K.

description: Fresh shrimp in tornado sauce with a hint of spiciness~ Cajun fries were free with yelp check in. Definitely would go again. Don't forget to order garlic noodles and add corn to your order~ scallop was fresh,big and juicy! $22 for a dozen scallops. Similar experience as boiling crab except that it doesn't come in a plastic bag. Comes in a bowl!
author: Elena K.

description: Always love coming here! The seafood is fresh, the price is reasonable and their garlic noodle is yummylicious (best eaten with garlic butter sauce)!!! The Asian male waiter makes dining here more fun with his sassiness!
author: Brian K M.

description: I absolutely love cajun seafood, in particular crawfish.  This place cannot compare to Boiling Crab or any places I've eaten at in Sacramento or San Jose.  But it honestly gets the job done. The seafood is fresh and their hurricane sauce isn't too shabby.  Its very clean and the owner is very nice and upbeat.  The garlic noodle was good, the cajun fries is yummy, the calamari was just right.  Honestly, its a little sad that there is no real amazing cajun seafood joint in San Francisco.  You literally have to venture outside of the city to attain great cajun seafood.
author: Angela V.

description: 1 pound mussels/shrimp hurricane spicy and happy hour items (i.e. 6 oysters, fried catfish, and garlic noodles) was the perfect amount for the gf and me.  Great service.  Everything was clean.   I loved it.  Would come back again.
author: Brian E.

description:
The spicy cajun sauce was GOOOD!!! I had a pound of shrimp, 4 pieces of corn and sausage in it and it was lovely! Addicting actually. I ordered an extra basket of bread just so I could get more of the sauce. 

Besides that everything else was more like an "Eh". Hush puppies didn't have much flavor. Fries were just fries and the clams in lemon garlic sauce was pretty plain. 

There are a few more Cajun houses in Sunset/ Richmond area. I'd check out those places before I come back and try swamp. Maybe it will get better after it's been open a bit longer.
author: Linda L.

description:
Try the hush puppies 
Shrimp is so sweet 
I love hurricane or garlic butter sauce.
And I always get the gumbo
author: Janipher C.

description:
Meh, definitely have had better cajun styled food around town. I went and got a pound of the shrimp in the hurricane sauce. There wasn't anything that was wrong with the sauce and the shrimp, but there wasn't anything outstanding about it either. 

The price range, and the menu is very comparable to the Cajun House which also happens to be in the inner Richmond area, but I've found that their sauces has better flavours. One neat thing about this place though is that they currently have a free order of cajun fries as their check-in offer.
author: David C.

description: The food here is good for the price. Tony was very helpful and attentive to our drinks. However, the service was extremely slow. They were not prepared with enough staff for rush hours. On top of that, we were over charged. Would not recommend for service.
author: Mandy M.

description:
Excellent service, even better food.

Went here with my girlfriend after discovering this place on Groupon. Boy, were we glad we came here. First off, the service was top notch. Very quick, attentive, and the great conversation they provided really made the experience worth while. (Billy Boy was awesome!)

We ordered the Dungeness Crab w/ the Hurricane sauce, medium spicy. This was the best decision ever. The Hurricane sauce happens to be their house special, and it is for a reason. Also ordered the oysters and gumbo which was a perfect starter before the crab.

Will absolutely come back here again, and plan on it at least once a month, just to have a crack at everything on the menu.
author: Joe N.

description: I was not at all pleased with this . I guess u can say I had a bad first experience. I was craving garlic butter shrimp so my boyfriend decided to bring me here since I didn't wanna drive all the way to San Mateo. It was my first time here & all we ordered was Cajun fries, 2 anchor steams, garlic butter shrimp & the hurricane mussels. We received the shrimps & mussels but never got our beers & fries. We literally had to ask 3 different people. I don't think I would ever recommend this place to anyone. P.S. The 2 stars are for the mussels & Cajun fries.
author: Maria P.

description:
Came here on a Friday night with my boyfriend. Ordered shrimp and crab legs and beignets for dessert. 

+ free order of Cajun fries with check in 
+ hurricane sauce was AMAZING
+ great portions
+ good price 
+ prompt and friendly service 

I don't have any complaints. This was a very enjoyable experience.
author: Laura L.

description:
I can't believe its my first time eating Cajun style seafood boil and I am a big fan of seafood! Why are all these Louisiana seafood boil restaurants here in the Bay Area opened by Asian people? I'm always a little perplexed by that. They must have a lot of  Cajun culinary talent!

Started off with a dozen of Kusshi, Washington oysters to share. They were fresh and meaty, but didn't have a lot of flavor. I usually enjoy oysters that are sweet and briny. It came with one slice of lime which was weird because I think oysters should be served with an abundance of lemons. There were 3 of us and we went with two orders of the 2 item combo, the first combo with clams and mussel, and the 2nd with crawfish and shrimp, in the hurricane boil (all the flavors in one - Original cajun, Garlic Butter, and Coconut Curry), medium spicy and threw in 3 corns, $14/pound. The hurricane boil flavor is definitely recommended; the sauce is rich from the coconut curry and spices. I loved it. My favorite items from the 4 we ordered are the clams and the shrimp because they were much more rewarding and meatier. The clams were big and plump that night. I have made the decision that I am not a fan of crawfish because for the amount of work you have to put in, the reward is meager. The garlic noodles are delicious and garlicy. I like to pour the hurricane sauce all over it for more flavor! For checking in on Yelp, you get a free side of Cajun fries which was a nice addition because I wanted to add that anyway. I love free!

It wasn't very busy that night so the service was great! They came around to empty our shell bowls frequently. One big plus about this place is that the food is served in nice metal bowls, we get real plates and utensils instead of paper plates, plastic forks and food served in plastic bags. This was definitely a plus! I would love to come back again and try some of the other food such as cherry stone clams on the half shell, hush puppies, alligator sausage, gumbo and beignets! So much to offer on their menu!
author: Janny S.

description:
Wow!!! The best crawfish! I had the combo: crawfish and clams hurricane medium sauce and my friend picked the shrimp with hurricane very spicy sauce! She loved it and I loved my meal I added white rice and my friend opted for corn. 
Enough spices and affordable, the waiters are all attentive and friendly.
author: Ty N.

description: Wow this place was great. I brought my uncle here for his birthday. We each had a pound of shrimp in the hurricane sauce. Cooked perfectly. Would definitely come again.
author: Darius A.

description: The dungy crab was fresh and very good a little spicy. The Cole slaw was fresh and the beer was cold which is always nice.
author: Jeff K.

description: I go there very often and I love their food. The price isn't bad and everything so delicious.
author: Bruna R.

description: Boiling Crab who??  Really glad I gave this local place a try. Sauce is amazing with just the right amount of butter.  March is crawfish season .. the crawfish here are yummy!  Not sure if they are frozen or fresh but either way I can't tell. That's a good thing right?
author: Monique T.

description: I love this place not only is the food amazingly good it's in reasonable price the staff is so welcoming and the establishment itself is superclean. I recommend you get the crab legs with buttered garlic and garlic noodles and make sure you check in because they give you free Cajun fries ;)
author: Mary Grace B.

description:
Eehh... came here on my birthday after searching for places that sell clam chowder in San Francisco on Yelp. The Waitress was a bit preoccupied with her conversation at the bar to realize we were waiving our hands like crazy people trying to get her attention. We got our fries first, which were actually quite delicious,  spicy and crispy but not greasy. When we got our clam chowder it was bland and required way too much salt and pepper to wash it down. 
Overall this place was Just ok--- For clam chowder at least. The noodles looked amazing as we were leaving, so if we came back it would be for the Garlic noodles.
author: Sharen C.

description: Groupon is way too dangerous for my waistline!  No, I didn't have the alligator, need to work my way through that menu to it.  Came exactly at 5:55 pm, had 5 minutes to order from their Happy Hour Menu, and so glad I did!  The oysters were so fresh, so next time we have to order at least a dozen!  Only $1 each, what the hey!  Splurge!  It's so great to have someone shuck them and present them, all I do is slurp them.  We had cajun chicken wings.  If my non-spicy friend can eat them, you can too!  We had to order the rest through the main menu since groupon does not cover Happy Hour items.  We had the 2 combinations with Hurricane sauce:  Mussels and crawfish.  Skip the crawfish next time, not much meat.  Stick with the shrimp.  Service was great, ask and you will receive.  Love having the bib, just because the messy person inside me always wants to come out.  The crawfish beignet was nice and savory.  There's more crawfish there then in our combination and less work.  It reminds me of a donut with savory crawfish inside.  The garlic noodle was the last to come out and we were waiting for a long time to go with the "mild" spicy Hurricane. The "mild" really need something to go with it.  The garlic noodle had at least half a stick of butter?  (That is just a guess).  I can keep on eating that garlic noodle, but had to stop since I was really full from so much food.  They do have a set meal for $59 with clam chowder soup and probably everything we had.  I had to take home the sauce, no sense to waste such yummy sauce.
author: Helen L.

description:
This place is no boiling crab do not come here server knew shimp was bad and still served it to me and my girlfriend. Shrimp were smooshy, not fresh, filled with poop, and all the heads fell off on thier own. And server tells us yeah the shirmp aren't good. 

How the fuck do you serve someone something that you know taste like shit.

Gordon Ramsey would,ve had a field day with this place if he was served that crap.


Clams were good.
author: Anthony M.

description:
Overall, food was too salty! This is my first time ordering for delivery, so maybe there being too much salt was a one-time thing.

Cajun Fries - Missing, so I can't comment
Fried Catfish - good, crispy, fresh, tasty, but overly salted
Fried Oysters - good, crispy, fresh, tasty, but overly salted
Clam Chowder - ok taste, but too watery
Deviled Wings - not very gd, didn't like the sauce, not very big wings
Garlic Noodle - pretty good, lots of garlic, fresh, would order again

If they can reduce the salt, I may order regularly from them in the future.
author: Sonia D.

description: Delicious food with lots of options to customize! Super friendly service. Came during happy hour and had the $1 oysters, great deal! Also had the shrimp and clam steam pot, seasoning was really good, portions were big. Desert was yummy!
author: jasmine w.

description:
I JUST love this place! What a treat to have in SF. An affordable, fresh cajun seafood restaurant, with a highly efficient staff in a fun atmosphere. What's not to love? 

I am super picky about my *shramp* as I am from the South--- you won't be disappointed! 

Try it, you'll love it!
author: Hez B.

description: happy hour 15% off the entire bill was what I walked in to 3-6pm! I wanted to try a new seafood place and found this on yelp. SWAMP, what a name, but it got great reviews! so what's it all about? it's like the typical seafood places around with the bags of seafood engulfed In sauce, except Swamp has them in bowls with a spoon. I've tried many seafood places like this and havnt had one where I loved their sauce so much that I ever go back twice since my favorite local spot shut down on me. I think I have found the place!!! their sauce I think has curry in it, but it's bomb diggity!!! I ordered a pound of clams and there was an abundance of them in it. it sure was swimming in a swamp of sauce, love it! the clams were fresh and made just right. a 12 of raw oysters were also ordered.  I know when oysters are good, oysters are good when they are shucked fresh and put on the tray right away, not pre shucked oysters and bathed in water until serving time. these are shucked then and there at order!  Cajun fried were crunchy and seasoned just right, free at check in on yelp! customer service, I can not say because we were the only other table. will be coming back for the tummy sauce.
author: Jessica W.

description: If I could give them ZERO stars I would! Service was the worst of any casual dining place I have ever been to in SF! I then went home and had the worst stomach ache of my life!! Not sure what it was I ate but I'm never ever going back to this place no matter how reasonable it is. From the horrible service (waited almost one hour for our food and it wasn't even busy) to how salty the food is... it's a bad deal.
author: Susie M.

description:
I'm not sure why this place has so many stars. Take it from a New Orleanian, this place offers nothing like we've got down south. 

First off, the prices are outrageous for the quality of food and the amount of food you receive. I called my mom to tell her the price per pound of crawfish here--- $14.50. Are you kidding me?! My mother's statement explains it all "...you've got to be kidding me! That's highway robbery!" Truth, mom, truth. (And I get it, of course crawfish will be more expensive here....but $14.50 per pound is outrageous--FYI back home it's $1.50/lb) 

I could go on forever really. Nothing served was authentic. The gumbo tasted like rice with gravy--any yelpers who enjoyed the same gumbo I received have clearly never tasted authentic gumbo. The "fried catfish" looked more like fish n' chips from an Irish pub. Even I can make yummier fried catfish than the Swamp; this coming from a girl who can't even properly make Kraft mac and cheese. 

The experience overall was pretty pathetic. Oh and since when is boiled crawfish served in a soup? Never. Since when does crawfish not include your corn and potatoes? Unheard of. 

And last, but not least, the service was awful. I think we waited for about 15 minutes for anyone to even ask us what we wanted to drink. 

This place is not Cajun. There's no southern hospitality present, and most of all, the food is nothing like home.
author: Chelsie D.

description:
So Perilla closed and Swamp opened up. Same management however.

This place is suppose to be a cajun themed restaurant and yeah it definitely did its thing, I wasn't taken aback by it. You get some crab, some alligator sausage, some noodles and you pay around 70-80 with tip. Of course there's nothing wrong with paying that much but if you don't feel like it's filling you up and giving you gustatory satisfaction, it may not be right for you.

I think I'd prefer PPQ or Crustacean.
author: Julia P.

description:
Is not bad, but maybe I need to try more.

Came with a few friends and we could only decide on shrimp...so we had 3 pounds of shrimp. In 3 different flavors. The shrimp itself was quite good - only one was the "mushier" that I read in another review. The majority of the shrimp were pretty fresh. And pretty large.

hurricane sauce: a little spicy. Felt like there's curry in there somewhere. Pretty good.

Lemon Pepper: Sour. And Pepper. 'nuf said.

Garlic Butter: My least favorite. It was ok...but I could not taste garlic nor butter distinctively. It was like a bland tika masala sauce. 

Garlic Noodles: ok. Not too salty, which often happens with it.

Cajun Fries: Free with check in on yelp! Pretty good, a bit spicy.
author: Lily W.

description: Always love the shrimp here! Hurricane mild sauce was bombed except that your shrimp no longer comes in a big bowl of sauce anymore! Asked the waitress for extra and luckily they had some but only after she said they never served it like that before....? Sorry honey, I've been coming here since the grand opening and the best part was dipping your bread/rice in your shrimp bowl. Still enjoyed it!
author: Ashley R.

description:
This is a very interesting hybrid of two styles of cooking: Asian and Cajun (rhyme time!) but with seafood and spices it just works. Came here two weeks ago for lunch on a Tuesday, it wasn't busy so that was good. We ordered:

-Seafood boil with corn and Hurricane Sauce (this is the mix of all their sauces) /definitely has the most tastiness and kick
-Garlic Noodles / tasted like those from Thanh Long or PPQ (seems like garlic noodles are a SF asian seafood restaurant staple). Was even better when you added Hurricane sauce to it!
-Hush Puppies / small, crisp with just enough cake moistness in the middle to balance the fried outside. can't stand too big hush puppies where you run out of crunch...
-Whole Dungeness Crab with the garlic sauce / Crab was good sized, fed 3 adults generously. Not terribly crazy about garlic sauce, it had a good consistency but I wished it was a bit more buttery tasting. Had enough garlic but was missing something else, IMO. 
-Cajun Fries (free with Yelp check in)
-Crawdads w/ Hurricane Sauce / Personally, I've never been a fan of crawdads just because I feel like I'm getting jipped. They look big and meaty, but they're really just for sucking and minimal chewing, unless one likes chewing shells. Don't get me wrong, I'll eat 'em if someone puts it in front of me, but its not my first choice of water critter. 

Everything was good and tasty. I really enjoyed my meal here and I'd definitely come back when I'm in the area. 

Pros:
-Public parking on the back side, entrance on 18th Ave
-Clean and casual restaurant
-Give lots of sauce, definitely ask your server for a container to take the leftovers home! The hurricane sauce could definitely be used on a lot of things (eggs, chicken, as a dip..)
-Good service, friendly, knowledgeable
-Fresh seafood

Cons:
- Its a bit pricey but it's quality seafood that's well cooked so can't totally ding them on that. 
-Depending on the time of day, parking in this area of SF can be tricky, but on a Tuesday at 12n, lot in the back was open.
author: Elizabeth N.

description: Great service as soon as you walk in the door! Bill was very helpful with suggestions & very efficient with as many people as were in the restaurant. Last but not least the food was amazing. Defiantly will be back!
author: Geronimo W.

description:
I really have to say the shrimp I had at Swamp were the best part of the meal and everything we had was really delicious. What we ordered was a pound of mussels in garlic/butter sauce (no-spicy) and pound of shrimp and corn in garlic/butter (no-spicy) and another pound of shrimp with sausages in hurricane sauce (mild). Not being a spicy food eater, I absolutely loved the sweetest shrimp I've had in a long time in garlic butter sauce. The mussels were really tender and falling out of the shell, really delicious. Please use the bib they provide, because this food is MESSY but by the time you crack the head off your first shrimp with your bare hands, there's no going back. By the way, shrimp is the way to go - crawfish is a lot of work for such a tiny bite!

They serve the seafood bowls (not bags) steaming hot with enough sauce to dip your naked shrimp back into or french bread or whatever. We tried the alligator sausage which was tangy and spicy.

The servers are new to the job and twice we asked for things and didn't get them (water, garlic noodles) or they asked if we wanted water and then forget. Halfway through our meal the employee asked if we wanted bread and then about 15 min later it showed up. The lady next to us asked how to eat crawfish and the girl said she'd wash her hands and show her, but forgot she said that and never did. I agree with the other review about the constant perky "Are you OK?" They're just glad to be busy after the Perilla failure.

We live so close so we're going to go here instead of Cajun House, just for the proximity and that OH SO DELICIOUS shrimp!! They only have four kind of beer, but they have a few wines as well.
author: Kira B.

description: Great food. The Hurricane sauce is a great choice as sauce wise. The hurricane shrimp garlic noodle is really great. :-) Good for groups! Great happy hour discount on food. ^_^
author: Stephanie D.

description: Just ate here, wow one man show but crab was delicious, Washington Oysters outrageous, Gumbo was good too.  Price is fair.  Good food good service, will come back for sure!!
author: Lex R.

description: My husband and I were craving crab one night and decided to give this place a try after seeing the reviews. Upon receiving the crab beignets we should of left. You get 4 pieces of beignets and 3 out out of the 4 only had 1 small piece of crab meat. The rest was just cheese and onion. It tasted like a Philly cheesesteak minus the meat. We ended up staying and decided to give a shot at their entrees. My husband got lobster and ingot the crab legs. The waiter insisted I get some type of flavor on the crab legs because they were not that good without flavor. I got the lemon pepper and really happy I took his advice. The crab legs with the flavor were still not good, edible, but Def the worst crab legs I've ever had. My husband got the lobster and that was decent. The staff didn't ask us how the food was or if we wanted refills until we were done eating and the bill was still expensive. It's better to spend just a few extra dollars and get better seafood and ambience in the fishermans wharf area.
author: Brittany B.

description: I chose this place for my birthday dinner since I am a huge Cajun Seafood fan. FYI, this place does take reservations. If it wasn't for the great group of friends I had at my dinner, I don't think I would have enjoyed this place at all. I had appetizers ordered and got 1 lb of shrimp to share with my boyfriend. Usually at other Cajun Seafood places, 2-3 appetizers and 1 lb of shrimp comes out to be a very generous portion of food for the both of us. Oh, geez. That 1 lb of shrimp seemed more like a 1/2 lb of shrimp. Perhaps the sizes of the shrimp were simply larger so what they served may not looked like a lot of shrimp, but it was not filling at all. I ended up ordering another lb of shrimp for myself. Flavor of the sauce was okay. The experience here was very underwhelming. I would not want to return.
author: Karen T.

description:
NOT GOOD with big groups -- We've been coming here a lot, so when I made a reservation for 15 people for a birthday party I thought it would be no big deal. Big mistake. 

So many things went wrong:
- We had to wait OVER AN HOUR for our reservation to actually sit down.
- When they did seat us, they split our group up into two separate tables so we couldn't even talk to each other.
- They ran out of crawfish.
- They didn't apologize once.
- They didn't offer us any kind of discount in the end. 

It ruined my husband's birthday dinner experience. Thankfully the food is good, hence the 2 stars, otherwise it would've been a one star. It's obvious that they didn't care to actually hold tables so that they would be ready for our large group. I understand getting overwhelmed when the restaurant is packed, but at least apologize and say sorry for it and try to make our experience better. Or just say that you can't take large groups.
author: Gina R.

description:
Place is pretty good! The broth is thinner than most places like kickin' crab or boiling crab. I like the spicy level they have. The group I was with said it was a little spicy so it really depends on your endurance of spice. The flavor is all there though, regardless of spice level. $14 per pound for a pound of shrimp. Seems a little pricier than other places. Service is A+ I loved our server, he was super funny and joked around with us while getting us anything we needed. Water levels were always full. 

Crawfish beignet was NO BUENO. Cannot compare, after you've had Brenda's beignet. 

There's parking in the back! And remember to check in for free caujin fries!
author: Ryan E.

description: Lemon pepper king crab legs, mussels, garlic noodles, beer and tea for 3 can't beat the price for this quaint little place!  Staff is great and place is cozy.
author: Carolina S.

description: Everything was fine. The service was average, nothing fantastic nothing terrible. The food was fine and came quickly. I would rather give them a 3.5 maybe 3.7 stars but thats not an option here. The food was good but I don't know why everyone raves about it. I do think they have a unique offering and a good bit of options. I do wish there was at least a main dinner option for non seafood people.. Everything was at least freshly made. Beignets were fine but have had better. A bit too dark for my taste. Parish cafe does better here..
author: Crystal T.

description:
I liked the set menu, the two of us got the crab, choice of flavor, clam chowder, salad, bread and garlic noodles were all tasty, but the stinky smell as i walked in to the  restaurant made me to question the cleanliness of the food.

I asked the waiter about the smell, he said "I don't smell anything, maybe it came from outside!" 

Could it be the displayed alligator head rotting? I will never find out.
author: SJ L.

description:
The food was alright, but definitely can't be compared to Boiling Crab. The service is really good and they are very friendly. However, when we went in to order some fries togo, we wanted some of the hurricane sauce to go with it. They charged us about $3 dollars for a soup size cup. They wouldn't put it in the small sauce cups they put ketchup in and we literally could have ordered a side of corn and get the sauce for free... We didn't find out till a friendly customer told us right before we left.

This is our 5th time to this place and 3rd time ordering to go. Our fries orders were always in a generous portion. But today it was about half of that amount. Must be a bad day today.
author: Brandon C.

description:
The owner of this place is condescending and he cooks the nastiest crawfish in existence. As a native of South Louisiana, I grew up on crawfish boils and I think I know a little about the customs and flavors that should accompany a proper boil.

What threw me first about this place is that the crawfish is brought to the table in a bowl, with a small bowl on the side for the peelings. What's wrong with a single large platter for both? Then, the taste of the crawfish itself was far from appealing. Bland, rubbery, with a side of dirty. I knew I couldn't stomach the food but at $14 a pound I was determined to get my money's worth, so I asked the owner for some crawfish dip. I was met with a look of bewilderment. Paraphrasing, such things don't exist, the residents of New Orleans simply enjoy the flavor of the mudbugs themselves, and no I don't have mayo, ketchup, and mustard for you to make your own. 

I could go on, but I'm smell of this weak attempt at crawfish lingers on my fingers and I have to find something decent to eat tonight.
author: Anthony P.

description: This is one of the best places to get cajun seafood in the city. There is usually little to no wait to be seated. Parking is pretty easy to find (if you park like a block away). My go to meal is the shrimp with the Hurricane seasoning which is all the different spices combined. The price isn't that bad either. Service for the most part is okay. The service can be inconsistent and sometimes the old guy who manages the place has a snarky attitude. The last time I went, they didn't even come check on my table at all. Overall, this place is worth trying but don't expect stellar customer service.
author: Lisa H.

description: The 2 stars is for the food. If I could get a no star for the service, I would. I have no complaints for the food but the service is really bad. This is our 2nd time coming here and the 1st time was really good. The food was great and the service was good too. But today for some reason they were rude and very slow. The guy server seems like he didn't want to work there. We have to look for them in order to get service. I am very disappointed. I don't think the food is worth the frustration that you get from their service.
author: Canary J.

description: I've had better crab, the sauce was decent. The claw chowder was a bit watered down... However the alligator sausage was so yummy! I will definitely come back for that
author: Xiomara S.

description: This is my second times here. First time was okay, food was average, big disappointment on second times, I ordered garlic noodle, raw clam, and house spice prawn. Garlic noodle was okay but the raw clam was very terrible, fishy and not fresh, $15 for half dozen, not worth. Prawns was over cooked, can you imagine a chewy sea food?!!!
author: Gung S.

description: I LOVE SWAMP. It is my go to cajun spot. Their garlic noodles are amazing. The manager or I think owner was my server once and he's great he even remembered that I come pretty often (good or bad?HAHA) The service here is always consistent and the food flavor is always consistent as well. I always leave satisfied.
author: Jasmine K.

description:
Had our crab craving yesterday so we came here for an early dinner. To our pleasant surprise, we got 15% off our total bill. Score!

We ordered the dinner for 2 deal (for $49 before discount), 1 lb of crawfish, corn, and (with a yelp check in) also got a Cajun fries for free. 

The food is great and the service is excellent. We would definitely return, which says a lot since our list of returned restaurant is less than 10 in all over Bay Area.
