author: Tracy L.

description: Ok so Bill was great, friendly helpful and everything you would need from a manager that had the time to chat, food was really yummy we had oysters Cajun FF, chowder and most importantly crab and lots of of it! food was really a positive for out group of 5 and draft beers rounded off the dinning experience. the restaurant is very clean and tidy so for those plusses I am upgrading to 5 Star.. Give it  a try hopefully your experience will be as good as ours.
author: David O.

description:
Y'know what, I actually like this place a little bit more than Boiling Crab.
Yup, I said it. You can shoot the messenger. But I'll tell you why.

This place is a LOT less crowded, for basically the same quality and type of food. I like how they actually give you a garbage bowl & you have WAAAAY more space in order to eat your food. I appreciate this place for that fact. 

I also really like the people that work here - they're always so friendly and check up on your needs constantly. Even with large parties, they get it done right!
author: Kai S.

description:
service was good....there was a middle aged man (I'm assuming owner) who was actively managing the resturant experience.  He was excellant!
I don't know that I agree that price reasonable, I thought a bit high.  But......the king crab was WONDERFUL!!!! The garlic noodles were the perfect pairing for the hurricane base I had the crab cooked in.....very tasty.  Gumbo was unique,  It didn't actually taste like gumbo, but some type of creamy? ?? who knows-what?  Final thought: would go back for the tasty food...on a relaxed, no rush evening.
author: Sharine d.

description: the food is ok, but the service is suck. We have to wait one by one  for the foods coming, each time we have to wait 20 mn to get the next one. The place is not that busy but why they cook so long?
author: Riky M.

description:
Let me just preface this review and say that I am a die hard Cajun seafood fan. We don't have this style of food up north in Toronto, but every time head down to the states, I go all out and visit as many Cajun seafood joints as possible. 

I went in December, and felt that this was a huge let down. It's not terrible by any means, but Cajun House (also in SF) and the Boiling Crab both rank much higher in my opinion. I think for me, the sauce was too thin in consistency, and quite bland. The garlic butter sauce was yellow, instead of red - very different from all other Cajun seafood restaurants I've been to. The sauce itself was quite bland, but the butter taste was so overwhelming, I actually felt sick. I decided to order another 1/2 pound of shrimp in the lemon pepper sauce, and again, a total let down. Unbelievably bland. I probably would not return here, because I know there way better options near by. This is a real shame, as the service is very friendly.
author: Jennifer W.

description: Had a great time last night! The delicious taste of Hurricane sauce of our the crab is still lingering in my mouth. Service from the 2 guys ( the asian manager or owner and good looking funny young man) are very casual, funny and superb. I like that they made the atmosphere very relaxing and chill. From the coleslaw to the clam chowder to the crab are to die for! The hurricane sauce is sooooo good. Love the food, ambiance the service. They have happy hour too!
author: Art M.

description: I've visited new Orleans, french quarter, and I was stoked to find a place where I could get alligator sausage and a po' boy. Unfortunately I couldn't get my po'boy bc they DIDN'T HAVE BREAD?!?! HOW DO YOU HAVE A WHOLE PO'BOY MENU BUT NO BREAD. I got a happy hour order of fried catfish. ...which was all breading, IRONICALLY, and very little fish. Too $$ for the quality of food and lack of service I received. Wouldn't waste my time on another visit.
author: Jessica J.

description:
So I came here last Thursday with my cousin AGAIN. 

The difference in my rating, 1 EXTRA STAR, why? 
I tried a different sauce from the last visit and I must say, not too shabby Swamps. 
I think I found a winner in you, you trickster!

I ordered what my cousin Chewy normally gets, Hurricane & SPIC-AYYYY! 
LOVEEEEEEED it, it had my mouth burning with good lovin' and what more can you ask for? Oh wait.....wait for it, on your rice! Slap some of that goodness onto my rice and I was all set for my dinner.

With that being said, I can understand some people have grown to love Boiling Crab, maybe that's where they got their Creole virginity taken from. There's just some places that can't live up to others, but everyone need to keep in mind that other joints have their own spin to the sauce, so keep an open mind.
I love BC too but f***, it's certainly not worth the drive and the 1-2 hour wait. Maybe if you're in San Jose, than why not? 
OVERALL, IT'S JUST NOT THAT SERIOUS PEOPLE. I rather spend that $10-$15 bucks that I lost from burning my gas and hit up a local bar/dessert shop after my meal in the city. 


But heyyy, that's just me, I know where and when I should be spending my money.
author: Kimmi Mey S.

description:
Went to dinner here for my sister's birthday. Normal seafood place with the sweet potato fries and house noodles. But the manager (forgot his name) was exceptional in serving us and making sure that we were refilled with our drinks. 

Parking does sort of suck since its a busy neighborhood, but a solid place....
author: A L.

description: One of my favorite places to eat at in the Sunset. Huge portions, good prices and incredible food! The garlic butter sauce for the seafood boil is slaying the game!
author: Ruby V.

description: Best garlic noodles to pair with your seafood of choice! The hurricane shrimp is delicious! The workers are very nice and it was awesome when one of the servers took his time to teach us how to properly eat a crawfish!
author: Christine R.

description:
We ordered 1 pound of shrimp and 1 pound of mussels and cole slaw.
We waited a long time for the food and when we tried to get the attention of the wait person we were ignored. The shrimp were overcooked and the mussels were also overcooked and chewy. The cole slaw was tasteless. The other tables were offered plastic gloves and we weren't offered the gloves.We ordered the butter and garlic sauce and got the coconut sauce.  We were so hungry by the time we got our food we would have eaten the bowls.  We won't go back.
author: Judy B.

description: If you're used to the boiling crab and the kickin crab style, then this place is gonna take some getting used to. The reason I say this is because they're not nearly as generous with their sauces here as they are in other crawfish places. Their flavors here are a little less 'intense' if that makes any sense, but is still very enjoyable. I, myself, love the thicker, richer sauce of other places so I didn't enjoy it as much here. Also, being in San Francisco means San Francisco prices.....certain items here are a couple dollars more per lb than its South Bay counterparts and other items can fetch even more $$$. One thing that I kinda do like here is that they use dishes for everything instead  of just plastic all the things..
author: Marco M.

description:
1lb shrimp
1lb clams
Hurricane style, Mild
French bread
Sweet potato fries
Corn
Sausage
To go tupperware for the sauce..@@
author: James O.

description: This is our first time here. We were on our way to visit Legion of Honor Museum. Swamp has a good review on Yelp. We decided to try it out. Services was friendly and attentive, food is delicious, price is reasonable. We also got the Cajun free fries from yelp. :) We will be back for more.
author: Blueberry S.

description:
The coleslaw has the yummy crack taste of a certain chain; you know what I mean. If you don't, the slaw here is good.

Crawfish bengiet. So good if you like crawfish.

Generous delicious portion of hushpuppies. 

Garlic noodles also made of crack.

I meant to eat only half the grilled alligator sausage.  Someone stole the rest. Or did I eat it? It's all gone.

Only came on for a snack.  Had to try several different dishes.  Do full, and I have take out.
author: Peter K.

description: Came here for happy hour oysters and decided to order their shrimp! Also got some garlic noodles which were on HH. Everything was delicious. Coming back for sure.
author: Ryan S.

description: Amazing place for crawfish, shrimp or crab!! The hurricane shrimp is so good and I'll eat it time and time again. Well decorated, warm and inviting. Overall just a great place to go.
author: Marcy L.

description:
They serve very small portion here. We ordered a gumbo without rice, they brought over a plate of source with two pieces of chicken and a few small pieces of chopped up sausages inside. It was $8.95!

We have tried many Cajun restaurants in the bay area, this is the most expensive one yet serves the smallest portion. The flavor was okay, but I won't come back.
author: J. X.

description: First time here and I must say I was impressed!  Had the Cajun fries to start. They were spicy and good! Ordered the king crab boil with the garlic sauce. Delicious!  Food was served fast and warm. They even special made a lunch item at dinner for my boyfriend who doesn't do seafood. Service was also great. Great place to stop in at if your looking for something different and tasty!!!
author: Melissa B.

description:
Great little place run by a nice asian family. The Cajun fries are really simple and good, just some fries doused in old bay seasoning.
A pound of shrimp is definitely enough food for one person, but the muscles and clams are a bit less filling just because of the overall weight.
Crawfish were out of season when I went, unfortunately, but the shrimp were great regardless.
Happy hour is 15% off and ends at 6. The discount applies to your whole check, so get there early!
author: Harry L.

description:
1lbs of Hurrican Spicy Shrimp Pls! Bomb!!! As side from traveling to BC in
San jose, this is by far my 2nd favorite spot for cajun food!!!!=P******** 

AND the staff is just super nice!!!!!!!:)

Do not forget, to also stop by joes ice cream across the street for dessert! That will top of the night.. By having "Coffee crunch" ahhh the best thing to end a dinner date! Hehe=P
author: Joyce P.

description: The staff is very friendly and the decor is on point with the theme, but the food is not up to par.  The seafood comes in a bowl instead of a plastic bag, which is what I'm accustomed to.  At first, I thought the bowl was an upgrade.  Turns out, no.  The bowl traps all the heat, which ends up overcooking the seafood, which you can tell wasn't fresh to begin with.  Also, the sauces aren't that great.  We ordered garlic butter for one of them, but we couldn't taste any garlic.  It was a real disappointment.
author: Negar A.

description:
It's no Boiling Crab, but it satisfied my "cajun seafood" fix on my birthday. They have a check-in freebie for free cajun fries, hence why we picked this place compared to the other cajun seafood place  on Geary. Walked in on a Saturday night around 6:15 and it was EMPTY. I couldn't believe it. We found awesome parking and didn't have to wait! 

What we got:
2 lbs shrimp, Hurricane style (The whole shebang), Medium spicy -- Nice BIG shrimps!
1 lb clams, hurricane style, medium -- Tasty
2 orders rice -- Have to soak up the juices
1 order cajun fries (free) -- taste like normal fries with a cajun seasoning dusted on top. Surprisingly hot and crispy
1 order sweet potato fries -- nice crisp and not soggy! 
1 order fried calamari -- Some places you feel it's 80% fried batter, NOT HERE. Actually very minimal batter.

The difference of this place and other cajun seafood establishments is they don't serve it to you in a plastic bag. There are plates and utensils on the table, and they bring your food in a pot. They give you an extra bowl for shells and routinely come around and empty the shells as you go.

Service was attentive, albeit it was extremely empty on a saturday night. Surprised too since we came during the Outsidelands festival and figured it would be crowded with festival goers.
author: Jenna H.

description: Great crab, chowder, seafood and dessert.  The ambiance is new and inviting.. cozy but not crowded.  The service is great and as well as the host.  There are flat screen TV to catch the latest game too!  A place that has something for everyone.
author: Keith W.

description:
Although the name doesn't sound too appealing to the ear... the place manages to stick with and keep up with their name as the common theme throughout the restaurant. I like it! When it comes to these types of restaurants I don't expect to sit down and eat in a place that looks fancy. The concept is based on using your hands and not forks, knives, & spoons! (Which they provide though) This restaurant style is popping up all over the Bay Area now and yet some have not managed to keep up with the game, Swamp definitely does! 

The man running the place who I believe to be the owner is very nice. As the evening rolled around to 7-8p the place began to get packed and there were only 2 servers plus the owner himself totaling 3 people who were serving the entire resto. With just them the service began to lag a bit. The bf and I didn't mind bc we were in no rush to be somewhere. They did apologize each time they came to the table for the lag of their service as they too knew they were short staffed. 

As for the food-- We ordered a dozen half shell raw oysters, fried catfish, cajun fries (free with your first time Yelp check-in there), whole dungeness crab in the garlic butter sauce, garlic noodles, and for dessert the fried bananas & vanilla icecream. 

The oysters were fresh and refreshing (wish we ordered more). The fried catfish was battered with a light beer batter and not with your normal flour/cornmeal. The fish wasn't overcooked, it was tender and flaky. The cajun fries were a little on the spicy side. The kick was a little overwhelming where at one point I couldn't feel my lips, bc they were just that much on fire. (BUT! I'm not going to ding them for a tiny error of over seasoned fries.) The dungeness crab in the garlic butter sauce was cooked perfectly. The sauce was off the chain, so creamy/milky. I poured the sauce over my garlic noodles as well! The garlic noodles didn't stick to each other and they were soft and tender. Dessert was splendid. It was the perfect ending to our meal. Not overly sweet! 

Will come here again! This resto gets my recommendation.
author: Cassie D.

description:
Maybe it's me but this place struck me more as quasi-Chinese seafood restaurant than a real "Nawlins" eatery. That's not meant as a negative, just an observation. 

The good news is that most dishes are smaller so you don't have to order food you  won't eat, and you can try a few things. Kudos to the place for not serving crawfish out of season. Preparation was caring and ingredients fresh;  the rubs were just spicy with no character. 

My companion and I had shrimp and mussels, good but simply prepared. The side dishes were mostly forgettable (especially the fries). I thought their ice tea and Arnold Palmers were quite good. 

Nice layout and friendly service means I will come back when I want more of this type food. 

I thought there were too many TV screens as it was distracting, but that is my thing. If I want a sports bar I go to a sports bar.
author: E F.

description:
Seafood, my love, my life. Why did you betray me so?

Having been to numerous seafood boil restaurants before, including the inevitable Boiling Crab and several establishments in the LA area, I had certain expectations upon entering Swamp. Long story short, the service was fast and courteous but the shrimp and seafood we had left my stomach rumbling. I don't know if it was just an off night or we ordered the wrong items, but I was nauseous the rest of the night after a close encounter with the seafood here. There are too many other similar places to take a trip back. Too bad!
author: Amber M.

description:
Tried to go to rockin crawfish first but there was a line.  While we were waiting, the waitress announced they ran out of crawfish.  This caused my friend to make a really bad joke to the waitress and when she didn't get the god-awful joke, he got embarrassed and we had to leave.  They probably wouldn't have served us anyway because the joke was so bad.  

Swamp sat us right away.  Really liked the alligator sausage and the gumbo.  The sauce with the crawfish was nothing to brag about, but once you've had the whole sha-bang à la boiling crab, nothing else will really come close.

The waitresses were friendly and the older guy was also nice to us.  Good thing we prevented our friend from making any more dumb jokes or else that probably would not have not been the case.
author: Ross I.

description:
If you happen to be in the area and happen to crave some Creole/Cajun food. I love how you can get a free side of cajun fries with a check in, TOTALLY worth it because the Cajun fries is delicious. It comes out piping hot with a healthy sprinkling of seasoning. It's salty and spicy and what a good fry should be. 

This place can fit big parties, so it can accomadate large parties. I know a lot of people might compare this place to Boiling crab and in a way the menu is simple like boiling crab. But, there are unique items on the menu as well. 

Garlic noodles; delicious and the noodle is like chow mein. 
Shrimp with the hurricane is pretty much a mixture of all the seasoning. It is their house special and it is really delicious. It is kind of like a soup and the flavors are really not overly salty. 
Gumbo: I would opt out of getting this item. Definitely not their strongest and the ingredients are really sub par. 

I would definitely go back if I am around the area.
author: Amy L.

description:
The main dish here came through and my wife is hoping to go back again.  This was my first time going here. 

The service from the waiter (possibly the guy running the place) is deplorable and combative. 

Food: We had a prawn and shrimp boil with cajun seasoning. The prawn were undersized, but my wife really liked them as they had good flavor. The shrimp (whole and with veins) was good sized and tasted fresh. The watermelon iced tea was nearly undrinkable. The cajun fries were OK, but not spectacular as it was difficult to taste the seasoning.  If you ask for more ketchup, they'll bring the bottle over and squirt some into the small ketchup dish instead of giving you the bottle. 

Service: Based on the service within only the first few moments of walking in the door, I was ready to walk out of the door. A few simple correspondences as a guest of the establishment shouldn't get your blood boiling and discomfort level up. For the quick and dirty on the place, you can stop here, if you are interested in knowing what happened, I've outlined the 4 painful experiences below. 

Unfortunately tone and volume are not yet transmissible via text, so you will need to imagine a very loud and angry guy who can make people uncomfortable with simple words. There were at least 5-6 witnesses (which is what I believe they should be termed in this type of situation) in the restaurant. 

#1 - Taken Aback: Walked in and the place was at about 20% capacity. The guy said "can I help you" from all the way across the restaurant which is a strange way to greet people.  Being that it was my first time here, I also walked in with that normal level of social anxiety of not knowing where to sit.  I responded in a joking manner that we're just trying to find a place to sit.  The guy told me that you don't choose, he will seat you himself.  Taken aback, I jested that there should be a sign if that is the case, but he said that they don't need a sign since he just tells people where to sit.... This went on for a demeaning 30-40 seconds. 

#2 - The Jab: They give you two menus, one of them has all the main seafood and one has drinks & lunch specials.  Outside the door they have a sign advertising Po-Boy sandwiches, this doesn't appear to be dependent on the time of day.  Not finding the Po-Boy on the regular menu, my wife found it on the lunch special page.  I asked if it is possible to get a poor boy at this time (after the end of lunch specials), the guy told me he could give it to me, but it wouldn't be at the happy hour price. I was fine with this pricing fact.. I guess.. but the way he said it was very rude and condescending. I would think that it's either on the menu or not (especially when it's on the sign outside and plastered in ads on the window). 

#3 - On the Ropes: We happened to have a Yelp coupon for free cajun fries.  I'm a scaredy cat, so after #1 & #2, I asked my wife to present the coupon to the guy.  She showed the coupon which still needed a few clicks to complete the transaction.  The guy very curtly said to her to click "this" now "that" now "this."  I don't recall the commands on the phone, but basically instead of saying, OK, you just need to click through these steps, he elevated everyone's blood pressure in the room by using a high volume to spew the commands at her. Sometimes an economy of words with people can seem so much ruder...

#4 - The Death Blow:  The menu for the seafood boils have prices by the pound.  We ordered a combo shirimp/prawn at about $14/lb, but didn't exactly say how many pounds and the guy didn't ask.  After ordering, and given the awful experience so far, I did start to worry that perhaps the default might be more than a pound, so I asked my wife to confirm with the guy when she walked back from washing her hands.  She asked the guy on her way back, and the guy got very loud and confrontational to explain how the menu works and that if you order the combo, it is simply $14.  She said that she was just worried because we didn't say one way or another and the price is in per pound increments.  The guy said he doesn't need to ask since it just is $14. She explained that it's our first time here so we didn't know how it works.  Disregarding this comment, the guy then "went over her head" and came over to me to explain how the menu works.  I told him that we just weren't sure and wanted to make sure and that I was the one who actually had the question.  He failed to grasp the situation and his handling was quite rude - particularly trying to go over my wife's head as though I could somehow explain his specious argument to her (if you've ever ordered something on a menu listed as market price, you know that you had better double check prices first!). 

P.S. Luckily he disappeared 20 minutes into our experience, so we were able to let our guard down and try to enjoy our meal on an otherwise nice Friday afternoon.
author: Brian L.

description:
Ordered the alligator sausage, cajun fries, garlic noodles, 1 lb of shrimp (hurricane medium spicy), and 1 lb of mussels. 

The alligator sausage wasn't that great, pretty oily, and the taste was unmemorable.The cajun fries needed to be crunchier/crispier and were steak-cut which I don't prefer. The garlic noodles are yummy though - should give those a try! 

As for the seafood, the shrimp and mussels were both very fresh. But the hurricane sauce wasn't thick enough to coat the shrimp so you have to dip the shrimp in there quite a few times. In my opinion, the mussels were the best thing on the menu. This place isn't bad, but of course, nowhere as good as Boiling Crab. (There's a reason all these imitation BC places have no wait.)
author: Sophia L.

description: Its okay if you are into curry taste of cajun sauce. For the seafood size, the price is fine. You can mix and match for $14/lb. if you want good garlic noodles. This is not the one. I havent been able to find a "good" garlic noodles place.
author: Jenny Y.

description:
So I ate here for my 26th birthday yesterday  and I liked it ! There was 18 ppl in my party and the service was okay I think they did pretty good considering there's only 2 ppl working the front ... 

Any who we ordered 

Shrimp hurricane style mild with 2 corns it's was yummy, it came in a nice bowl keeping it warm 

Calamari  yummy 
Free Cajun fries with yelp checkin also 
yummy

Watermelon ice tea  so good I had 2 glasses 

Crawfish beignet was ehh - tasted like a piroshki wouldn't ride that again 

Didn't order dessert cuz I had my bday cake 

We will be back
author: Erica S.

description:
Good food, good crab, good gumbo, in fact, everything we tried was good. This is the 1st time we went here, and we tried the Shrimp, Dungeness crab, King crab, Gumbo, alligator sausage and calamari......all good, nothing left to go. 

We have tried the various "crawfish" type places in the city, and the Swamp stands out as the best tasting so far.  We will be back.
author: Andy L.

description:
Shrimp - mediocre quality. Mushier than good shrimp. 
Mussels -also mediocre - a bit fishy.
Clams - good
Fried Oysters - big and juicy.. yum.
Corn was sweet.
Cajun Fries - not bad.. a tad salty.

Garlic Butter sauce was tasty/ok but mediocre and good for dipping bread into. It wasn't as garlicky as I had hoped it would be.. 

Lemon Pepper sauce was tasty/ok.

Best dish had to be the garlic noodles. They were really flavorful -- a tad on the oily side, but delicious.

Service was friendly. 4 flat screens tv's at the bar = great for watching simultaneous bay area sports teams if they happen to play at the same time.. ahem giants/warriors.

Overall 3.5 -- It's not bad, but I'm not dreaming about that garlic sauce. I might have to come back to try their other sauces..
author: Donna H.

description:
Just tried this place for the first time and I have to admit I felt sketchy when I didn't see anyone else eating there, but I went on and tried my luck! This place is delicious!
I had a combo plate cooked in garlic flavor and it was gooooooood! They also had a bar which I didn't attend to since it's still work hours.
I would defiantly recommend it to people and can't wait to tell all my friends about this  place!
author: Roman E.

description: 5 starts hands down! The garlic noodles, hush puppies, calamari, crab and shrimp combo cannot go wrong! I myself tried the shrimp and clams combo with the all sauce mix, and my dine in partner tried the crab with garlic butter sauce. No complaints. The sauce is different, it is not greasy nor heavy. It doesn't make you feel gross after eating an entire dish. I suggest this place for anyone looking for something different in sauce quality.
author: Vic A.

description:
After passing this place on the daily and thinking it wasn't up to our "standards"..my boyfriend and I finally took the plunge and tried Swamp. With not so high of expectations, despite the great reviews, I was very happy (and soooo full) after a meal consisting of:

fried oysters ($6- comes with 7-8 pieces, very juicy, not heavily battered, perfect starter)

hurricane/medium shrimp ($12 per pound- large non-skimpy sizes, tasted like a more tomato base sauce with garlic pieces, not super buttery, very yummy in my book & medium is pretty spicy) 

steamed rice ($1.50-just right to pour the sauce over of course) 

corn ($.75-it wasn't too sweet, but just soak it some sauuce and it'll be great)

garlic noodles ($7 bowl- the portion isn't soo large but perfect to share with 2 or 3 people and these noodles are bomb dot com, seriously, perfect bite to it, garlicy enough & if you were a fan of Perilla (the restaurant prior to Swamp) then you will love their noddles since it's the same owner

service - 5 stars (very friendly, attentive servers-my water was always filled, food came out fas and hott)

It's not boiling crab BUT that doesn't mean it's a bad thing. Not every place with sauces and seafood will be the same- restaurants should have different flavors to offer and as long as the seafood is fresh and sauce pairs perfectly- i'll be back!
author: Megan A.

description:
First time trying this place due to good reviews and my friends had gave it a shot, so I needed to come by and try it.  First off, the restaurant was pretty empty, so that tells you something already that the seafood is not being rotated enough for everything to be "fresh".   We got the hurricane and it was good.  

Pros: Great service, the servers will monitor to make sure water was filled.  The shrimp was good, fresh and tasty.  The oysters were also good.  

Cons: CRAWFISH - They were FROZEN!!!! and the server did NOT warn us that the crawfish are not fresh.  Unlike boiling crab, or any other crawfish place I've eaten, they will first alert you that the crawfish is frozen before serving it.  So okay... it was frozen, then they should slice the price down by half.  But that did not happen.  Luckily we only ordered 1 lb of crawfish.  The cajun fries could be better and the alligator sausages was not to die for.  The main course (crawfish) was a flop, however, shrimp and oysters were good.  

Will I come back?  Not really, because the crawfish really threw me off.  I hope they will tell people before serving them frozen, because if you are a seafood eater, you can most definitely tell from fresh or frozen.  And if it's frozen, please lower your price.
author: Alan L.

description:
My brother wanted to grab lunch and he specifically only wanted to eat crawfish (Cajun-styled seafood) - we first went to Rockin' Crawfish but they were closed and then he told me to Yelp if any Cajun-styled place was open (mind you it was only 2:30 pm on a weekday) and Yelp said that Swamp would be open at 3:00 pm, perfect (since everywhere else didn't open until 4:00 pm). 

Ordered (a lot of food): 
1/2 Dozen Oysters on the half shell
Deviled Wings
1 pound Shrimp in Garlic Butter
1 pound Mussels in Lemon Pepper
Sausages in the Shrimp in Garlic Butter
Garlic Noodles
& French Bread

..whew that's a lot of food for two people but it was all really really good! Before I say anything else, french bread dipped in the garlic butter sauce is heavenly, try it, you'll love it! Oh and you might think, wings in a seafood dominant restaurant? At least that was what I thought (my brother loves wings so he got them), but the breading on those wings were pretty darn good, a hint of spiciness! 

Okay, so I'm sitting here thinking if I should break down everything that we ordered but I decided that I am going to just compile it all in one word: yummy. Everything was pretty delicious and I am not sure if it's because the cooks had more time to prepare everything since we were literally the only people in the whole darn restaurant or it was just my lucky day.
author: Mona L.

description: We made a reservation for 13. Whole party arrived ten minutes early and they gave our table away. WTF!
author: Rose L.

description:
Good food, good price. friendly staff. Will definitely come back.

The clams are fat and delicious.

The garlic noodle has great texture but might taste a bit on the blend side. Mix it with the garlic butter sauce from the shellfish is yum.

Oysters are fresh and only $18 a dozen. Corn, sweet potato fries, you really can't go wrong here.
author: Jason W.

description:
Went here with my boyfriend and thoroughly enjoyed both the food and the experience. We ordered a 3lb bowl of crawfish and shrimp in the hurricane sauce and it was to die for. very delicious. I was a little nervous about ordering that much food, but it honestly wasn't that much given that it is shellfish after all. most of the weight is the shell. With that said, I finished the food and felt satisfied -- not stuffed, which was perfect. and that hurricane sauce was the bomb!! 

in addition to our boil, we also ordered a side of cajun fries with was delish as well. But I think what makes this place stand out was the great service. The waiter as well as the restaurant owner checked on us several times, and truly made us feel at home. 

Will definitely be back when I'm in the mood for some flavorful and spicy crawfish!
author: Jennifer O.

description:
SOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO GOOOD !

I have always wished boiling crab would have Mussels. Finally! There is swamp ! Compared of lots of other boiling crab knock offs; Swamp is doing it right. I ordered the garlic butter shrimp and mussels with a corn. All the knock off places would be so bland but not the Swamp ! Their service is also excellent ! the girl checked on us for at least 10 times !!!! 

5 Stars !!!!

This review is based on after coming back here many times.

Food here are way too inconsistent !! It always taste different every time i come back!  All my friends got so disgusted by this place, they strongly refused to come back ANYMORE!!! I had to treat my friend just to get her to think about coming back here. Anyways, we came back and the food tasted different again !!!!!!! Not only that, my shrimps were so overcooked today, they were so hard.....

My friend ordered Mild spicy, and they gave her super spicy............

Never got our fries...... and restaurant was empty....

I am crazy for seafood... thats why i was okay with this place but now...


I got no friends to ever come back here with and i think i would rather go elsewhere now......
author: Swifty L.

description:
Great restaurant! Fun, delicious seafood! 

Wonderful service -- waiter and waitresses are Great! Very helpful with menu items, suggestions and very attentive service!

Will be coming back to this restaurant many more times and bringing friends and co-workers.

The shrimp, calamari, crab and crawfish were great. Love their garlic noodles and bread.

Wish more Geary restaurants were this good about their food and service.
author: John G.

description: We come here every now and again , and always had a good meal we love the hurricane sauce for the crawfish . The garlic noodles are one of are favorites and the softshell crab,one thing sometimes they overcooked the  soft shell crab. But overall we have a good meal and the service there it's always very good .
author: Pat C.

description:
I got back from a trip that included Seattle, and Las Vegas. so i had a craving for a cajun place that was in the city.
the do not disapoint, everything is good. 

my only issue is their hours and the fact they don't deliver. but If I'm really in the mood for seafood I can just get on the 38 geary and go there.
author: Nicola A.

description:
Went to Swamp last night for a pre birthday dinner with about 7 people and we were seated right away. I noticed the owner was there and he is actually the owner of Perilla in the inner sunset as well! Such a nice man! He helped us out a lot. 

Food: The food was very flavorful! We had the garlic butter on some of the food and original Cajun on the rest! My favorite was by far the original Cajun with the medium heat was perfect! It's hard work for a lot of food and takes a while to get your tummy filled but it was well worth it by the time we finished. 

Service: There was a waitress servicing us last night and for the amount of people there were and the mess we made, she did amazing getting our food to the table in record time. She also didn't lose her cool under the stress of drunk, loud and very rude customers seated a few tables away from us. I must say very awesome service! 

To add to the great experience the owner gave our table free dessert for my birthday and sang to me. 
If you're looking for a good, messy time with some delicious food SWAMP is your place!
author: Shannon M.

description:
Scrumptious! The hush puppies are pretty good, the calamari is ok (kinda a small amount), and the cajun fries are delish, the alligator sausage kinda just tastes like sausage though.


The broths for boils are all good, I had the garlic butter + clams and the crawfish + the all in broth. The guy there recommended getting some french bread and dipping it in the broth (best idea ever).
author: Rohan D.

description:
Good food...decent price.  It's a nice casual atmosphere with a bar.   Some reviewers complained about the older gentleman but we found him to be funny and hospitable.  I appreciated his old school humor.   And as for those complaining about how it's not authentic New Orleans or Cajun food.... Well no $hit. They don't claim to be. It's even stated on yelp that:

From the business
"Swamp is a local Asian-inspired Cajun seafood restaurant in San Francisco, featuring fresh crawfish, crab, lobster, oyster and more with finger-licking house sauces. Enjoy 15% OFF..."

Besides what authentic Cajun restaurant has garlic noodles and steamed rice on their menu? That should have given you some idea...

Like I said good food and service.  Only complaint was our corn was mushy.  Would've been great if food was a bit cheaper but their price is normal for San Francisco so I can't really complain.
author: Derik D.

description:
I LOVE the Hurricane sauce, and the service is okie. 
You have to get the Clam chowder with the French bread.
The clam chowder is a little to thick, but trust me, you will love it!!!!!! 
There's real clam in it and it taste fantastic!!!!! 
The owner is very nice. Also they don't put the seafood in a plastic bag but a bowl! 
Thats a big bonus for me! 
Try the Hurricane sauce, you wont regret.  :D
I came here twice last week hahaha. 
Make sure check-in and get ur free fries!  3 to 6 pm daily happy hour 15% off ur entire bill!
author: Niko L.

description:
Swamp is delicious!

I've been here about 6 times and each time they never let us down. We order their 1 lb garlic butter shrimp with mild spice (delicious!). They're shrimp is always boiled to perfection and they're garlic noodles were good too! It's a fun experience (they give u the bib and bucket for the shells). I am definetely becoming a regular! :)
author: Gabriela L.

description:
Went here last week...very nice greeting by all servers/boss

The first thing I noticed was the boss was drinking wine at the bar..but serve people as well....but then he would cheer loudly for the game...but really just sitting there watching the game. I hope tips aren't divided evenly bc thats not fair for the servers that are actually working. 

Atmosphere: Stylish...a little more classier than the normal Cajun house...it is also more family friendly.

PROS
[+] Soft Bar - wine, beer on tap

[+] Friendly male server (for the day we went anyway)

[+] Happy Hour (even though we missed it)

[+] Check in on YELP, get free cajun fries

[+] Using bowls instead of bags, felt more clean..but the bag does steam the juices better.

CONS
[-] Calamari ($8)- too thick, hard to chew, sauce was too spicy

[-] Cajun Fries - super spicy for some reason...a lil too much spices

[-] Crawfish ($12/lb) - hurricane sauce, medium....When I bite off the head, it was BLACK..you can taste the bittnerness and how unfresh it is....I LOVVVEEEE eating crawfish but it just wasn't good. Sauce also didn't cover the bitterness...im pretty sure it was frozen...most places charges frozen seafood cheaper depending on the season. But I guess they just aren't honest about it.

[-] Shrimp ($12/lb) - It was either old, or left outside for too long. It had a smell to it. Like it's very old. We couldn't even eat it bc it just smells awful. It wasn't the sauce. It was the actual shrimp meat. You can just tell it wasn't fresh and it might have expired, or been left out too long.

[-] We ordered the clam chower, but server totally forgot it. 


Did I mention I had a stomachache during the night? I was sleeping and woke up with a terrible stomachache. I felt so sick! I almost wanted to go to the ER. It musta been the shrimp or the crawfish. ARGH...NEVER AGAIN!!!

Go to Rockin' Crawfish, or Boiling Crab instead!
author: Tammy F.

description:
Don't want to deal with the long wait and line at PPQ? Head to Swamp. I've been here a few times now, mainly for the dungeness crab and garlic noodles. I've tried a couple other things on the menu which were "okay", but the crab and noodles never disappoint. Besides, you should save all that room in your stomach for crab. The crabs are always fresh and meaty. Try garlic butter if you like a subtle flavor, and Hurricane if you like an explosion of various flavors in your mouth.

Service is good, and it's never crowded. Just discovered that if you come early enough during their "Happy Hour", you get 15% off your bill. Sweet deal.
author: Zell C.

description: I've practically tried every creole/cajun shrimp restaurant around the Peninsula, with the exception of Red Crawfish, and this is by far my favorite cajun shrimp style joint in San Francisco. I know the name doesn't sound appetizing, but don't let that stop you! It's tasty Hurricane flavor holds as a strong contender to Boiling Crab's Whole Sha-bang. Not only was their flavor great, but it was more of a soup and less oily compared to other shrimp spots. The only downside I can note was their small rice portion. I literally had to order 2 sides of rice. Lastly, don't forget to check in and receive your free order of Cajun Fries! They were cooked to perfection!
author: Denzell S.

description: This place was clean at first glance, which was a little surprising to me given the surrounding area. Very friendly service! Quick with refills too. Kid friendly. We ordered their dinner for 2 special for $59. Awesome deal!!! Clam chowder was not as thick as expected, but still tasty. The crab was to die for. We had the hurricane seasoning. We will be back!
author: Andrew H.

description: This place was extremely busy when my friends and I randomly came in to try. The pricing was a bit expensive. There were no half pound options. I feel like my mild was mixed up with my friend's medium. We didn't notice until after eating. The whole time I couldn't handle the heat, while I thought my friend was just used to eating spicy food. Tried hers, and hers wasn't spicy at all. My friend ordered clam chowder and it was so watery. The shrimp was very hot which was nice, but I've had better. The waiter was very very friendly and attended to us which was great. We checked in and got free fries
author: May M.

description:
YUMMY! My fave place in SF. 

Shrimp in Garlic Butter

Clams in Lemon Pepper

Crawfish in Hurricane-This I thought was ok only, but I am not a huge fan of Crawfish.

Mussels in Lemon Pepper-Clams are way better

Cajun fries were yummy and cripsy

Corn is a must

Garlic noodles were good

Raw Oysters-fresh

Good price, great flavors, good service. WIll be back.

I like that they serve in dishes and not in a plastic bag and they give you plates and forks to eat with.
author: Karen H.

description: Food and service are just OK. Oysters are not really fresh. It's not worth for the price they charged. But decor is nice. I usually go there to watch sports games.
author: James S.

description: Went there yesterday with my husband. Loved their lobster special. Service was great, I like how they gave us hot paper towels to wipe our hands after a delicious and messy dinner. Wish their Happy hour was extended till 7 pm. Will definitely return. Ambiance and service is much better than a crab place in Sunset or Daly city.
author: Nozima T.

description:
The Hurricane Habanero level spicy boil is not to be reckoned with. It's hotter than you think. Hotter than I thought, and hotter than my date. 

Service was awesome. Everyone is super friendly, attentive, and funny. Definitely a family feel. 
Decor/ ambiance won't astonish you, but thats why the food is good and the prices are reasonable. 
Cajun fries were delicious and the muscle hurricane boil was amazing... it hurt a little.

Oysters were fresh and I wanted 15,0000 of them.
author: Helen N.

description:
Great place for large groups. Lots to eat, great fried dishes, assortment of shellfish, and free to be loud!!! I wasn't expecting this place to be great, but it was pretty good.
 
* 1 dozen Kusshi on the half shell $18 (4 of 5) Fat and creamy raw oysters served with lemon, cocktail sauce, and horseradish. The oysters were fresh and very good size. Delicious for $18.
* Sweet Potato Fries $4.50 (5 of 5) Fabulous. Looked like long cork screws and they tasted so good. Crispy on the outside and creamy on the inside. It was a really really really really good yam fry. Yummy!
* Cajun Fries $3.50 or FREE with yelp check-in. (4.5 of 5) Pretty good and even better when it was free. The fries were good wedge sizes but surprising the Cajun flavoring was outstanding. The Cajun powder wasn't too salty and it had a good heat hint at the end. It was really really really good. But the yam fries taste just a little better. 
* Deviled Wings (6) $6 (3.5 of 5) Not too spicy even though they are called deviled wings. But they are super fat wings. 
* Grilled Alligator Sausage $6 (2.5 of 5) Very excited to taste this. It was one sausage sliced in half and grilled. It was a little fishy. But tasted better when we sprinkled lemon juice on top of it. Then it tasted like a better chicken sausage. This is definitely a pass when I go back a second time.
* Fried Calamari $8 (3 of 5) Not bad but not great.
* Fried Oysters $8 (5 of 5) Great batter and great size. The fried oysters were still moist and juicy in the middle. I would re-order and re-order. Yummy!
* Fried Fish Fillet $8 (3.5 of 5) Tasted like really good and crispy fish fillet (like McDonald's). Again great frying and great batter choice. 
* Garlic Noodle $7 (4.5 of 5) I think this is one of my preferred garlic noodles now. It was great noodle choice because it was soft and chewy. I really liked the portion and the overall taste and texture. If I can't eat Than Long's garlic noodle, this would be my next go to place.
* Garlic Butter Crab $30/each (4 of 5) Tasty. Very nice sauce. And exactly what it is named, garlic + butter. Tasted extra good when we poured the sauce over the garlic noodle. Delicious.
* Hurricane Shrimp and corn and sausage $12/lb + 0.75each + $2.50 (6 pieces) (4.5 of 5) Hurricane is supposedly a mix of all flavors. I liked it, especially with rice or the French Bread. It was pretty good.  
* Soda $2.50 free refill
* Pitcher of Beer $16

This place was great for our group of ten. They were nice and accommodating. All the items very fairly tasty. Most of the frying dishes were yummy and great with the soda/beer. The seafood bowls were also very tasty too.
author: Janice T.

description:
+ Great, spicy, flavorful shrimp/crawfish.
+ served in bowls. (Not in a plastic bag like other  similar places)
+ fast attentive service
 
Stopped by on a Saturday night, thought we'd give this new place a try. The  food was so good- we tried 1/2 lb of crawfish and shrimp, 1lb of crab legs, corn n Cajun fries. The shrimps were huge and the run off broth was perfect with bread. Definitely coming back. Points for the great service, owner is super cool, Makes recommendations and is a funny guy.
author: Miguel C.

description: Don't get me wrong! Food was not bad but the service was very bad n that's why I gave this 1 star. It was last Saturday n I was driving so I had my daughter call the restaurant n asked if I could use my Groupon today for lunch n the girl who picked up said "yes" so we drove there. Upon ordering I told the girl I'll be using my Groupon n she said "ok". By the time I asked her for the bill she came over n directed me to press "redeemed on my phone then all of a sudden this older male staff just yelled out that they don't accept Groupon during the weekend. I told him I called n was told I could then he asked when did I called n I said an hour ago. The guy was rude n unreasonable. If he's one of the owners I have nothing to say but if he's just a staff, I hope he gets some sort of customer service training. Now my Groupon certificate is marked "redeemed" as directed by staff n they didn't honor the $25 so I had to pay full bill amount. I know there's a miscommunication issue between the staffs but me as the customer I did nothing wrong. I personally think this was an internal mistake n the restaurant should take the blame n honored my Groupon. Very disappointed!
author: May L.

description: After finding out about this place, I don't have the need to drive all the way down to San Jose for Boiling Crab or Kickin Crab. This place is just as good. Although it is slightly more expensive, I would still go here because it saves the drive to SJ. The owner of the place is very nice and friendly! There's happy hour for the shrimp where you get 15% off but I can't remember the times (I'll edit this later once I find out). I get the spiciest shrimp and it's pretty damn good! Definitely a place to check out!
author: Keng G.

description:
I have tried almost every crawfish restaurant in the city and keep coming back to this one.  I admit I was a bit skeptical at first but an glad I decided to give this place a shot.  Kind of does help that my son always wants to eat crawfish.  I came in again for dinner last night and once again was not disappointed.  I have tried a lot of the items here but their garlic butter crab is my all time favorite.  It was so good that I ordered 3 of them last night but if your getting up in your age like me...ask for mild...has a kick to it.  The garlic noodles also went very well with the crab.  My sister always orders the fried oysters and the alligator sausage is very good.  The kids like the hurricane flavor of the crawfish....pretty tasty since its a mixture of all their flavors. 

Oh yea don't forget to check in on yelp for your free order of cajun fries! LOL you can throw the fries in the garlic butter sauce after you are done with the crab but don't come looking for me if your doctor tells you that you have elevated cholesterol!
author: Allison T.

description:
I think they've taken the earlier critiques to heart and worked very quickly to fix everything. I went with another six people from SF Foodies Meetup.

Charlie, the chef-owner and everyone else  guaranteed we had a great meal tonight. The service staff seem to have already hit their stride. Once orders were taken, drinks were served and then, our several shared appetizers quickly followed. This transplanted Southerner loved the crispy hushpuppies with toothsome whole kernels of corn served with honey butter. The soft-shell crab was perfectly cooked. Loved the alligator sausage.

Entrees are perfectly cooked a la minute. I had the shrimp in garlic butter sauce with habanero spice. Definitely spicy! The warm French bread toasts were perfect for soaking up the sauce. Got to taste the gumbo. I would've gone in for another spoonful, but  didn't want to be rude. Our table ordered a wide range of entrees and everyone was really happy.

Comparing to similar restaurants in the Bay Area, Swamp came out on top. We all agreed we'd definitely be going back for more!
author: Lydia S.

description:
Love this place!! I went here for my birthday with a girlfriend of mine
I've tried a couple of other places, the Cajun House in SF and Claws in Garden Grove, CA

Comment:
I noticed the onions are sautéed with some type vinegar my guess would be, cider or sherry vinegar so there is a hint of sweetness but doesn't compare to the Christmas cookie after taste I got from Cajun house.

Atmosphere: Stylish and open good for large groups, nice bar area.

The staff:
The person who took our order I think was the manager. He was so nice and friendly, he made me feel right at home and was helpful and funny when I asked about the Habanero sauce.
The other staff members come by and clear out your shells often and refill your drinks promptly, they too, were nice and light hearted.

The food:
The first thing I noticed, was they don't serve the food in the large clear plastic bag most places use. Instead they bring out piping hot shellfish in large shiny white bowls that really make the beautiful colors of the sauce stand out, not to mention you don't get sauce all over your wrists and forearms when the food starts running low.

The calamari, was just good not too fishy but nothing great

Garlic noodles, were great soft and chewy and go great with the sauce from the shellfish

2Lbs of hurricane clams with potato and corn, wonderful again except for that hint of sweetness I was getting but again there were other elements of flavor other then garlic so it wasn't bothersome.
The clams were fresh, fat and juicy, the corn soaks up all that wonderful sauce and keeps heat so beware when you first bite in! The potatoes are great when cut up and also soak up the sauce.

1Lb of King crab with the habanero sauce, were good, I didn't have many intact legs and got a lot "knuckles" instead and no claws so there wasn't as much meat as I usually expect from King crab. The sauce was hot and tasty it gets hotter as you eat it so going back and fourth between sauces is recommended. Honestly I like mixing the medium hurricane with the habanero!
I will return
author: Isabel Z.

description: I like coming here! Friendly staff, yummy food, and free fries upon Yelp check-in. Make sure you get the Curry Coconut sauce, the Hurricane is alright. I like how they differentiate themselves with the curry sauce, it definitely goes with the shrimp and clams. Pricing is fair, I don't mind it. One combo is enough for two people!
author: Natalie W.

description:
Another new cajun style joint in the City? I'm not mad at that

This spot is definitely family owned and I always respect that. They greet you nicely here as you walk in and they make good suggestions on what to order if it's your first time here. 

I believe the owner was the one who seated us and kind of gave us a 2 second overview of their menu before we dove into it

We ended up ordering:
1 IB of shrimp (hurricane / mild)
2 corn
1 side of bread
1 order of fried fish
1 order of cajun fries (comp'd w/ yelp check in)
1 order of gumbo w/ rice

Overall, i have to say my favorite part was the shrimp. The juices and sauce it came with in the bowl was PERFECT (not too watery and not too saucey), just the right texture. 
It wasn't too spicy for mild which was also perfect. 

The gumbo wasn't bad, but I've had some better gumbo in my days of having cajun food. The fries were a nice add since it was a comp'd w/ the yelp check in. 

The fish was MEH, pretty bland and the pieces were really small. I think they would be better w/ some of the cajun seasoning they use on the cajun fries (IMO)

Lastly, everything total was well worth it. I'd be back again the next time I want some cajun!
author: Kenny L.

description:
This place is the best new spot in Inner Richmond! It's akin Boiling Crab but with more reasonable prices. You can be sure to get your cajun fix here. From the sublime gumbo to the crawfish w/ four options of heat and four different sauces. That's 16 different combos which mean endless time and cholesterol for you to sample all the insane possibilities. You can also include corn, potatoes and/or sausage in w/ your order of seafood. I also would recommend getting shrimp and clams as well. You can't really go wrong. 

My fave is the fried fish and the grilled alligator sausage. But for seafood, I go with the Shrimp and clams in their garlic butter sauce with a medium heat. 

If you enjoy seafood, this is a good place to start.
author: Terry Y.

description:
Shrimp & Mussels in Hurricane boil: 4/5
Shrimp and mussels tasted good to me. I don't really know what "fresh" tastes like, but they weren't fishy and the shrimp were quite plump. The Hurricane boil was also pretty tasty. We got mild and it was probably between a mild and a medium. Also had some sausage and corn in there. Flavors mixed well with those two. The toasted bread we got on the side was delicious in the boil.

King Crab Legs in Garlic Butter boil: 5/5
They're pre-cut into smaller sizes and pre-cut from end to end for easy opening. Crab was plump and tender. Garlic Butter boil was awesome. I'd have to say better than the Hurricane boil. Wish we had the corn in the Garlic Butter boil. Pick out some crab meat, put it on the toasted bread, spoon over some Garlic Butter boil... and that is a winning combo! Unfortunately, King Crab is quite pokey! So just be careful with your fingers when trying to pry open the shells.

Other: 4/5
We had a giant bug near the window. Should have known beforehand that bugs are always by the windows. They were nice enough to move us over to another table without hassle. FREE cajun fries when you check in. They're ok. Free is good, but I wouldn't purchase them.

I like that the food comes in bowls rather than bags. Makes less of a mess and dipping things into the boils is a lot easier.

I'd come back here again. Boiling crab is too far even though I like their food too.
author: Timothy L.

description:
Absolutely delicious! The service was phenomenal and the restaurant was clean and very comfortable. It also looks like a nice place to come (as an alternative to sports bars), to watch baseball once the season starts. 

No more long times for me ever again at the Boiling Crab in San Jose. Swamp is the new place for me!
author: Gloria Z.

description:
Not comparable to BC at all. The taste was very different and it just wasn't as garlic-y enough for me. I got the garlic noodles and it felt a really weird. It still tasted very flour-y and dough-like so I decided to mix some of their sauce with my noodles so it ended up tasting a lot better. If you have a different choice of going somewhere else, I would recommend somewhere else even if you're craving some BC food. 
Also, we came on the weekend that the Bay Bridge was closing so we were rushing to get to the bridge at 7pm. Around 6:15, I kept calling the waitress for our check, at least 3 times and she said ok but she didn't bring our check out until 6:30. She was standing there the whole time and doing nothing.
author: Polly L.

description:
I went to Swamp for a friend's Birthday this past Saturday 3.16.2013. This place reminds me of Boiling Crab minus the long wait and the plastic bags they serve the seafood in. I went with a group totaling 13 people. 

To start things off, the owners and servers were extremely friendly. They had a few beers on Tap I had the Hennepin which was good. There was a yelp check-in offer where you receive an order of Cajun fries when you check-in. About 4 of us took advantage of it and Swamp accomodated the offer. The Cajun fries were good and had spice.

A few of us grouped together and ordered a few things. We ordered Crab, Shrimp, Gumbo, Etoufee & Aligator Sausage. ALL DISHES WERE EXCELLENT! A few of us in the group preferred mild seasoning and their mild was actually pretty spicy. Although it was spicy, it was still good! On paper the Alligator sausage sounds exotic, but tasted like a regular sausage. They could have easily served us regular sausage and said that it was Alligator.

Overall, I would definitely go back for the food. I would also definitely go back for the extremely friendly and funny staff & owner.
author: Richard B. F.

description:
We found this place by chance while walking down Geary.  We didn't know what to expect- just happy they had both the Sharks and Warriors games on TV.  =]  

The service was great.  The Manager sat us and got us laughing.  They wait staff were always there to fill our glasses or to clean out our debris bowls.

But the BEST part was the food.  Those with me love good seafood and this place does not dissappoint!  Personally, I do not eat seafood and was concerned I wouldn't get anything satisfying..... but their Garlic Noodles with a side of sausage was perfect!

We've already been back again within a week and will visit again soon.

Thanks SWAMP!
author: Michael D.

description: Loved this place. Very attentive service and great food. The cajun catfish was melt in your mouth good. They even have a happy hour on a Saturday. It's been a year since we've had great southern seafood and I was happy  that we found this place.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Hurricane sauce was really good w/ the shrimp. Everyone reviewed the alligator sausages, so I had to try it. It kind of tasted like regular pork sausage, but slightly different. It was a little more tender, but the taste and texture was mostly like pork sausage. We got free cajun fries by checking in on Yelp, which is a cool bonus. The fries were pretty good. They were a little spicy, but not too spicy. I also had the clam chowder and garlic fries. Next time, I'd probably just go w/ just their specialty: any of the seafood w/ the hurricane sauce.

The service was really good. Our server made sure we had everything we needed and was very friendly. He also had good and detailed suggestions about the menu.

I'd be glad to go back to this place.
author: Vincent L.

description: Food was great, service was awesome, & prices are even better! Never change plz, i just found my new spot!
author: Andrea G.

description: First off, the service here is freaking awesome. It's definitely not boiling crab, but it's not packed either. Alligator sausages and hush puppies to start. I'd recommend both, especially the hush puppies which taste like fried cornbread goodness. The garlic noodles are a good side, but they were right when they said we should get some french bread to dip into our sauces (mild hurricane with crawfish, shrimp, clams, and crab legs). The crab legs aren't a great deal, and the crawfish aren't very large, but man was everything spicy. Altogether, I'd say that this place has pretty decent portion sizes for the price, and you get also get free cajun fries for checking in on Yelp. The cajun fries are pretty popping too.
author: Danny C.

description: Owner and staff are wonderful people, food is beyond words. Make sure you get the special hurricane sauce. It's the bomb!
author: Flavia C.

description:
Highlights
- I came with a group of 6 on a week night after a Giants game and there was no wait.
- Bar area and tables, take your pick and good for large groups. 
- Includes TVs so you can definitely catch a game here as well as order beer and wine. 
- The perfect cajun seafood fix spot in SF. Not in the ghetto, clean, and close by.
- Oysters: Tasted fresh, but nothing special. 
- Grilled Alligator Sausage: I was hesitant at first, but it was pretty delicious and came with a side of coleslaw. Tasted like perfectly seasoned regular sausage. 
- Cajun Fries: A MUST. Free with the YELP check-in offer. A ton of flavor packed in these perfectly fried potatoes. 
- Shrimp in Hurricane Sauce: Hurricane is a mixture of all their sauce offerings: Cajun, garlic butter, lemon pepper. Mild was good for me, since I'm a whimp when it comes to spicy things but Medium was more flavorful compared to the group. So good with their garlic noodles!

Improvements
- Dungeness crab in garlic butter: recommended by the waiter. Nothing special here. I would rather order another lb of the hurricane shrimp instead of this one. 
- Clams in hurricane sauce: I was never a fan of clams, so am my personal preference I would skip this one next time. If you love clams, this one is for you.  

Tip
- Parking can be difficult especially during lunch, dinner, and weekends.
author: Tracy T.

description:
First timer. Alligator sausage is bomb. Garlic noodles are pretty good. Hurricane sauce is no boiling crab shebang but better than the other imitations out here. Will definitely come back.
Service gives it 5 stars. The old Chinese guy was very welcoming and very hospitable.
author: Fran B.

description: To start, I ordered the king crab legs with the garlic butter flavor. They brought me a bowl of shrimp so I had to wait longer for my order, after already waiting on about a 15 top table that ordered prior to us. The way they served the crab legs made it extremely difficult and aggravating to eat. They cut the legs down the shell and off of the joints of the crab. Typically one would use this breaking point to remove the clear plasticy part that comes out of the meat but this was nearly impossible to do with how slippery the meal was and how it was cut. My husband enjoyed his crawfish. After the waitress got my order wrong she didn't look twice at our table again and we were finished off with a new waitress. Shabby service, shabby food.
author: Ashley F.

description:
DELICIOUS!!!!!!!!!!

the spicy hurricane sauce is amazing.
I'm not big on craw-fish/crab so i can only judge the shrimp and all i can say is i will keep coming back.

ask for gloves before you dig in :)
author: Larisa V.

description:
I only go to cajun places for the shrimp and this review is only for that.  

Maybe I should give the other dishes a chance but my justification for ordering a pound of the spiciest shrimp at an establishment like this is 
 1. to test the flavor 2. to test the freshness of their seafood 3. its easier than cracking crawfish shells

I ordered the special sauce at the spiciest and normally my lips swell up, no kidding.  I usually prefer to go out of the city for my cajun shrimp fix so I don't bump into familiar faces.  Was excited with the good reviews and the proximity it was from my house.  

Compare this with Crawstation, Cajun house, Rockin' Crawfish, Boiling Crab, Red Crawfish and Crawdaddy - summary would be:
Not spicy at all 
No flavor to the sauce, I think the house sauce is a combination of lemon and garlic but I could not taste either 
No lemon/salt and pepper mix - maybe it isn't their style but like that component 
I believe it's a couple dollars more per pound here than the neighbors. 

Also there were some flies flying around everywhere.  I can't remember when the last time was when I have seen that at a restaurant.  

One star for the cute waiters? :)
author: Leslie L.

description: I went to swamp today, and wow, I left super happy. I can't say I'm a Cajun food expert, but I've had my fair share of Cajun food in the past.  We ordered the gumbo, the Cajun shrimp appetizer, the soft shell crab appetizer, the  garlic noodles, the green beans, and the crawfish and clams in the garlic butter sauce.  The gumbo was just alright, not amazing, but still good.  but everything else was fabulous.  We love garlic, and the garlic noodles and the garlic butter sauce was sublime.  The flavor were strong but not overdone.  The soft shell crab and shrimp were fried perfectly, soft yet crispy.  The seafood was fresh.    Great service too.  When I left, my only thought was how good the food was when am I going to have a chance to come back.
author: Courtney L.

description:
12/19/12 Update:  Ok, i couldn't just let that first experience early on dictate my future eating experiences since I tend to frequent lots of restaurants in the Richmond District.  Exactly one month later I dragged a friend with me to give Swamp another try.  They've read the reviews and have definitely done some fixes.  The restaurant was nice and toasty upon entering and the staff was very attentive throughout the meal and that's with at least 7 other tables they were waiting on, also the hurricane boil for our crab was less saltier and more flavorful.  The shrimp is still my favorite as i can tear through 1 pound quick!  This 2nd return visit replaces my 1st so-so visit so there will likely be a 3rd, 4th, 5th, etc....

On 11/19/12, we ended up here after the owner/manager of Cajun SF stole our parking and we decided to ditch that place for this one but that's another story.  So here is the review for Swamp:

I know people have mentioned it's like the Boiling Crab type of places.  In overall concept it is except for one thing - food DOES NOT come in a bag!  It comes in a bowl and you better eat it fast because compared to coming out in a bag, it will cool down faster than you can eat it!  By the time you reach the last few pieces in your bowl you will be lucky if the sauce temp is luke warm.  Now what did we order?  1lb shrimp (Garlic Butter - Medium), Garlic Noodles and 1 crab (hurricane style - medium).  Overall, it's ok, nothing spectacular, perhaps i am simply used to the crab in the bag thing and flavoring so that it's no longer a novelty to me.  Not to mention they're cropping up more and more.  Anyone notice the old Cable Car Pizza/Hookah Lounge is now going to be something called Rockin' Crawfish?   

The food is ok, the crab wasn't the meatiest and the hurricane flavoring was too salty for my taste.  But the shrimp were pretty meaty and with spicy garlic butter pretty yummy but then I'm not surprised that they do garlic butter well.  After all the people running this place are related to the folks a few blocks away at PPQ!  Who...if you can keep following me....ran/run Perilla (also on Irving) which was replaced by Swamp!  

Service?  They're working out the kinks.  Like all new restaurants, they'll get it down.  They were attentive but tentative and tried to be helpful.  

A the end of the meal?  A bill total of $80, including tip, for two people, had me expecting a little more as far as food quality and left me feeling like I overpaid big time!  Of course had we not ordered the crab and just ordered another pound of shrimp, the bill would have been a lot less but then where is the fun in that?  Must have crab!

PS - If you go to my post about the old Perilla that was replaced by Swamp, I have a mention about the waiter who does not write orders down.  He's still here at this place!
author: Amorette K.

description: I haven't tried other shrimp boil places so I can't make comparisons. Even so, I had a pretty good experience at Swamp. I had shrimp in mild spicy garlic butter with potato and corn. By the end I was completely full and satisfied. The flavor was perfect. It's a great place to bring a group of friends who don't mind getting dirty. Anyways, I've been craving it ever since, yum. I will definitely be back.
author: Valerie Z.

description: Garlic noodles were very good. Buttery and garlicky. One order is enough for two. We ordered clam chowder, which I would probably skip next time and the main entree of crab- their holiday special. The crab was fried in garlic, green onion and spices. Husband enjoyed it but I was too full from the garlic noodles. You must try the garlic noodles. I still prefer Than Long or Crustacean when it comes to crab. This place however, cost less to dine than those places. My sister also had been here and she recommends their buttered lemony shrimp. Overall, I'm happy I tried this place. I would probably come and try their other things on the menu.. calamari, mussels etc.
author: J C.

description: Tried the alligator sausage. It was okay. I also had their watermelon tea.. That was gross. Their shrimp boil with the curry was interesting. I wouldn't go again.
author: Michelle S.

description:
It was our first time, so we weren't sure what to expect on a Friday night. There were probably 4 or 5 people there at the most. We were immediately seated and were expecting a menu right after. We waited for about 2-3 minutes just for a menu. Crazy. It wasn't even busy. We ordered the alligator sausage, 1lb of mussels in the spicy habenero hurricane sauce with corn and sausages, 1lb of shrimp in a medium garlic and butter sauce and sausages. We also got some free cajun fries thanks to the yelp check-in offer.

Cajun fries first and they looked like regular fries I could get at Burger King, but with some spices on them. The alligator sausage came after and it was grilled. The taste was badically like eating chicken. Nothing special. Our shrimp and mussels finally came out, and to my dumbness, went straight for the shrimp's head and it burned my tongue. Dumb move, i know. I thought the spicy habenero hurricane sauce would've killed me but it didn't. It seemed like it was just a mild sauce. But on the other hand, the corn that was in the hurricane sauce was definitely the spicy one. Weird. The shrimp in the garlic butter had to be my favorite. How I ate them was that I would peel the shrimps first, then pur them back into the garlic butter sauce and let them sit there for a minute or two to have a coat of the sauce. It's the same as dipping the shrimp, I know. But people have different techniques.

Overall, I's say it was pretty good. It was just the service in the beginning that got to me. But after that, they were pretty tentative. Maybe I'll come back. But I'd like to try other places similar to this one, too.
author: Sylvia b.

description:
1 lb Shrimp in Garlic Butter. Med spice: A - Nice and spicy, just how I like it. Shrimp was pretty big, which meant there weren't as much shrimp, but enough to fill me up.

Cajun Fries: B - Crunchy and spicy, a little too spicy.. all of the spices were piled on a couple of fries.

1/2 Dozen Oysters: C - These oysters were tiny!!! tasted good with ponzu sauce and horseradish, but not worth the price.
author: Gary W.

description:
Def not as good as BC but the service is great.  I love the alligator sausage (?), that was amazing!  We ordered shrimps, clams, mussels in mild hurricane and garlic butter sauce; both were meh.  Perhaps I should have gotten medium spicy.

Parking:  there is a paid parking lot near Wells Fargo around the corner.  You have to pay meters up to 12A so bring your coins!

Service: The service was great.  Our waiter was friendly and speedy.

Overall, I will come back if I don't wanna drive to BC.
author: K L.

description:
This new cajun place popped up  in the city, so..of course..I had to try it out. My friends laugh at me because of this ridiculous obsession, but I'm pretty determined to find a local fave place outside of San Jose.

I'd come back if I was in the area, but probably wouldn't go out of my way. Nice, friendly service. Clean. Weird/quirky alligator head thing in the doorway when you walk in. Food was good. Got lemon pepper shrimp and hurricane shrimp. Asked for the spicy habanero, but seemed a little mild (for me). Sauce was still good though. Also, tried out fries and gumbo. Both were good, but not really memorable.
author: Neeners H.

description:
I gotta say, this is my favorite place to goto for Cajun seafood. Forget boiling crab thats 40 minutes away and 1.5+hr wait. Swamp has the best sauces, thick, flavorful, and the right amount of spiciness, I usually get the hurricane. I have ordered the crab, clams, mussels, shrimp, and they were all good. Their garlic noodles were the best I ever had even better than thanh long and I usually order one just for myself(It goes great with their sauces). They have the $49 set menu that gives you a fresh crab(not frozen), clam chowder, cole slaw, and beignets(perfect sweetness, light, fluffy. There are TV's around to watch your favorite sports teams, good selection of beers on tap at the bar and pitchers to go along with it, the place seats around 40+ people. If you check-in on yelp you get free cajun fries which is a good starter while you decide what you want to order. Bill the manager here is the man, I've come 5-6 times and he knows me, he hooked it up on my birthday meal here and usually throws in some beignets for me and my friends on a regular. I've suggested to Bill to make their sauces thicker and they have since made that a regular thing, they added more ingredients to thicken the sauce and give it more flavor. There's really no other Cajun establishment that competes with the flavors of this place in the city in my opinion, red crawfish is good but I like this place more. I will continue to be a loyal customer to this place. Thanks Bill!

P.S. There is a 15% off your bill happy hour from 3-6pm everyday
author: Mike C.

description: Not as good as kickin crab or Ray's crab shack.  The sauce at swamp wasn't too tasty.  The only good thing is they serve crawfish beignet.  Ordered a crab but had no taste.  Service is so so.
author: Pasha C.

description: They get a one extra star because the oysters were good.  However, the crawfish was terrible.  Very small - about 1 inch.  Some of them did not have their tails curled, so I was not sure if they were alive before they got boiled.  When you would open them, they were kind of liquidy and gooey.    I am not sure if they were out of season, but they should have told me to order something else.  Not a pleasant experience.
author: Pasha G.

description: All I can say is, BEST FOOD EVERRRRRRRR! Their food is inexpensive and extremely delicious. Also, the facility is very clean and the owner is so friendly, always makes sure to check on you multiple times (but not in an annoying way). Have been here several times and have never been disappointed. Must go!
author: Gabrielle Z.

description: I must've came in the wrong hour. 3pm restaurant is empty so we get seated right away. The short old man is extremely mean! Every question I asked, he replied with an attitude and short answer as if I should've known the answer to my own question! But I checked in on Yelp and got the free cajun fries. The yelp offer will say offer valid until 12-31-2014 so I asked him if it was still valid after I checked in and he said something and walked away. But we got the fries and 3-6pm is happy hour so we got 15% off the tab. Don't ask the old man about happy hour either, he won't be happy to answer. Besides the service, the hurricane sauce is very good. It has a more liquid consistency than other major crawfish joints. But definitely very flavorful. I will come back for the food. The shrimp was huge and cooked well.
author: Guen S.

description:
Sadly disappointed on Fat Tuesday! We stopped in around four to have cajun food. 
No cajun music just elevator music. Owners are vietnamese and HAVE NO SOUL!
We ordered the Alligator sausage. No way to tell if it was alligator or pork or turkey or chicken or tofu. Very mild no spice. It needed a sauce. We asked the server and she said no sauce. I noticed on the menu there was a remoulade sauce. We ordered a serving of it. Helped somewhat. The coleslaw was amazing.
We ordered the crawfish beignet. Lightly gummy but good flavor. Needed spice. We requested tabasco and a serving of the white sauce from the coleslaw. Helped.
We ordered the soft shell crab. Very crispy but the body hadn't been cleaned well and was strong tasting. It came vietnamese style with pepper and lime. Overall good.
I ordered the Deviled Chicken wings. They were not spicy and came with a ranch style sauce. As I remembered it there was no sauce.
Husband ordered the fried shrimp sandwich with added coleslaw. Love the coleslaw! The sandwich was large and filling. BUT NOT SPICY!
We ordered a pitcher of anchor steam. She never brought water or additional napkins. 
Total bill was $55.96. I DID NOT TIP. I WOULD NEVER RETURN!!
author: Carol m.

description: I like the hurricane sauce. The coconut curry adds a little bit of creaminess and compliments well with the seafood. I ordered the habanero spicy but wasn't spicy enough to break a sweat. I do have high tolerance, but was expecting something more. Heated moist towelette at the end is always a nice touch.
author: Sheng S.

description:
I have been here twice now and have tried lobster, clams, crab, alaskan king crab, shrimp, mussels, fried oysters, alligator sausage, garlic noodles and grilled asparagus.  

The first time, we came the clams were not very fresh, and we found a lot of them closed.   The Alaskan king crabs taste frozen.  The lobster, noodles, and mussels were really good.  I liked the garlic butter better.  The hurricane was too spicy and takes away vs enhances flavor.  

Second time around, the mussels and shrimp were very unfresh.  I was surprised the mussels actually opened they were so smelly.   The crab was good, but not saucy enough.  They were very stingy that night with the sauce.  The fried oysters were fresh and tasty.  I agreed with another reviewer, the alligator sausage tastes just like any other pork sausage and not very special.
