Clever of them to cut in half and put grill marks and cut them across so to present differently from their other sausage.  

I'm thinking I might try another seafood broil place.  There seems to be so many sprouting out here in the Richmond.
author: Regi K.

description:
The service was good and food came out quickly. Garlic crab was good and so were the garlic  noodles.  Crawfish beignets had good filling but the batter was a bit heavy. Oysters on the half shell nice and fresh.
Overall worth going.
author: Kim b.

description:
Brought my family here for mother's day and had a very pleasant experience.

If you've had Boiling Crab, Swamp is a totally different experience:

The seafood are fresh and cooked in a small batch style. 
Each of the flavors are much more distinct from one another. They use a different method of generating the spiciness than the red spicy paste/oil Boiling Crab uses that made everything taste the same. 
The Garlic Butter is my favorite. Rich and creamy.
Oysters are fresh.
Garlic noodle is good, but I can do without.
The Hennepin Farmhouse Saison that they serve goes really well with the seafood.

Plus the owner is really nice and friendly. He goes around and greet every table, making sure everything is alright. 

I would definitely go back. It's a little pricier than Boil Crab, but I think it's worth the quality, not having to make the drive down to SJ or wait an hour for tables.
author: Theo T.

description:
Super greasy!  Very overpriced.  Eight bucks for some greasy spaghetti noodles.  The crab was tasty and very tender, but everything else was very very bleh.  The prixe fixe menu is a rip-off.  Just get some crab and a side of corn or cole slaw.  It will save you $30.  

The service was also sub-par.  No substitutions on the prixe fixe (even though I was asking for an identically priced dish), and VERY slow to get you the check.  I felt trapped in the swamp waiting for the waiter to stop shmoozing with a friend of his, and I could feel the butter coursing through my veins.  I need a shower after this place.
author: Jonathan S.

description: Great Service and Great Food. I can't ask for anything else. I love how everything is served in bowls. The flavor is different, I feel like they have a nice basil cream or something in there, and I think that's why I love it so much. Their pieces of shrimp are huge, and never overcooked. So I never have to deal with the skin stuck to the meat. My boyfriend and I always get 1 pound of shrimp each, and garlic noodles to share. Combine it all together, and the sauce with the noodles is magical. Definitely my go-to Cajun food spot in the city.
author: Rae Dawne G.

description: Decent place for seafood and it's also fresh. Had the oysters on the half shell, and their clams, mussels and crab in their hurricane (mixed) sauce and garlic butter sauce. The hurricane sauce was alright. Mild is still a bit spicy. Their garlic butter sauce is a little thicker and is good but not as good as some other places. The garlic noodles were good. And the end of your meal you get a wet-napkin to wipe down your hands.
author: Ali F.

description:
Free Cajun Fries when you check-in! 

Got the Hurricane sauce shrimp and Hurricane sauce King Crab Legs (Swamp's take of Boiling Crab's Whole Shabang Sauce)

I wanted the shrimp but was most disappointed in the shrimp, sadly.  The shrimp was fresh (shrimp head was so good!) but did not have enough of that hurricane sauce flavor blended in.  It was bland.

The King Crab Legs, oh my god, I'd come back for this for sure.  I'm not even a fan of crabs.  Oddly, the same hurricane sauce for the crab was extremely flavorful compared to the hurricane sauce for the shrimp.  Why is that? The crab leg shells are already cut up and sliced for you, and was soft enough to rip apart with your hands.  This made it easier to just pick out the crab meat (and also the reason why the flavor seeped in so well compared to the shrimp). And I love that it still has some of that crab gunk in there (don't know what its called, but it's the only thing I'd eat from the crab head)

It's good if you don't want to go all the way to SJ for Boiling Crab!

Gimme those king crab legs!!
author: Isabel L.

description:
I came here on a weds around 6:30 for dinner and got seated right away.

I ordered the crab with lemon pepper sauce mild spice was pretty good
alligator sausage was good
my friend had the deep fried oysters it looked good
and lobster with garlic butter, I think he liked it
grilled asparagus was done just right :)
garlic noodles was good too

Service was on top of their game and they refill your sodas AWESOME

I would definitely come here again, it was kinda dead I think they need more marketing.

I would try the clams next time.
author: DOM d.

description: Been here 4 times, 2 of them was treating out-of-town visitors (from China), and both times they were super impressed and loved this place very much. Their clam and mussle size is a bit unpredictable, depending on their shopping... Their garlic noodle is also great, especially when you mix it with the sauce in seafood. The choice of the crabs here could be better, though.
author: Tian W.

description: If you're ever craving Boiling Crab, but don't want to make the drive all the way to San Jose then this is the place to be. Their cajun fries are great (also free with check-in) and their shrimp is delicioso. Minus one star because the customer service is a little shotty with the elder gentleman who sometimes makes you feel in trouble with the way he barks at you for your order. Besides that there is nothing to complain about and I always leave satisfied.
author: Puka N.

description:
I have been here over 10 times and always enjoyed coming here for the amazing garlic butter sauce that they have here, but the last time we came here not only did it take 1 hour for the food to get to our table but at the very beginning it took them 15 min just to come over and get our order. Okay they are busy I understand. But ticked me off the most is how our dinner ended. My bf asked for a to go cup for a soda refill ( we had no problem with this the other times we have been here) the waitress told the older guy there to get that since he was working the bar. Suddenly not only did he give the poor girl a lecture saying that they don't do that but he came over to our table to give us a lecture on how can he make money if he gave to go cups and free refills are only in house. UMMM what? We just spend over $80 on your damn food and a refill that costs you maybe 50 cents is a problem and you are giving us a lecture about it? What is the difference if we stayed the extra 5 minutest to drink out of the glass and not to go? Completely unnecessary and uncalled for lecture to your customers. What would you rather have? Spend 50 cents of one refill of lose $80 because we are not coming back here ever again? MIND YOU WE DIDNT SAY ANYTHING WHEN THE FOOD CAME AN HOUR AFTER WE ORDERED AND WALKED OUT!

HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!
Go to Red Crawfish that on 10th ave they actually care about customer service and have great environment.
author: Kseniya S.

description: Excellent service. Fast order. Come in at 12:00pm . They are open. There hurricane sauce is amazing. If you a crawfish lover. You got to go here.
author: Harry L.

description: Seafood is ok but service is terrible. I am not sure if I can trust yelp anymore, specially with the one with free dish while you check in yelp. It is good to have free dish but have to be fair about the review. No credit card under some amount. Went there is only for Groupon deal. Won't go again.there are a lot of similar seafood restaurants in bay area.
author: TY Y.

description: This place was delicious! We had the dinner for 2 which included lobster, clam chowder (awesome!) cole slaw and  their garlic noodles were phenomenal! The hush puppies and calamari as appetizers were all that! Highly recommend!
author: Renee M.

description:
My first time here was totally yummy.  The oysters were fresh, the crab was a decent size and the shrimp were huge.  We had the crab & shrimp in the butter & garlic sauce and it was definitely finger licking good.  We also had the garlic noodles, which was good but tasted even better if you pour some of the butter & garlic sauce over it.  
We finished off our meal with their beignets.  I was hesitant to order it because no one makes it like Cafe du Monde.  The owner swore that it tasted just as good, so i had to try it.  The end result was it was good, close to Cafe du Monde's version but not 100%.  The downfall on that is the beignets could be a little lighter.  Overall my experience here was so good that i ended up coming back a week later and brought 4 other people with me to try it.  Each and every one of them loved it.  
Oh and I have to mention that our server was nice but the service in the kitchen is a bit slow.
author: Rose C.

description:
I came here with my daughter last week. We tried garlic butter clams and shrimp. My daughter liked the garlic noodles. The table next to us ordered the peppercorn crab. My daughter wanted to try it but since we ordered one pound each of the clams and shrimp so I told her next time we will try. I went online to their website and wanted to know what the dish called. On the website, daily special they have lobster and crab @ $35.00 each. So I called and ordered for pickup. When I there to pickup, the older gentleman charged me $38.00 !! I asked him about the price on the website. He said that's not true. I open the page on my phone and showed him. He didn't even look at my phone and said to me. Don't come back if you like the price. We don't even take phone order or take out, I do you a favor to let you take out. You should not complain. Wow, on the website does not mention about NO TAKE OUT or  DON'T TAKE PHONE ORDERS! I told him it's not about $3.00 charge over the crab. it's about his attitude when he talked to me. I wanted to cancel the order, he said not because the kitchen already cooked the crab. 

Message to the owner. Take down your website if it's not yours. Please train your employees to have a better attitude. Please stop speaking Cantonese bad mouth about your own customers. Thank you.
author: Miyako T.

description: Awesome restaurant! Tasty food - we ordered the hurricane shrimp, garlic butter crab, garlic noodles, clams and raw oysters. Love all of it! All were cooked very nicely, not over cooked. When I eat here it feels more home-y than other restaurants. When I come here I actually feel like I'm having a family dinner rather than being rushed out. This isn't boiling crab so PUH-LEASE don't complain it doesn't taste like it!!! The server (he told us his name is Bill but I don't know if that's his real name) is such a jokester and really made his best efforts in serving us. He makes the trip out here extra fun! The last time we went he brought out a birthday beignet for my mom enough for the whole party to share - bonus points for that. Went twice for birthdays in a month. Love that they offer free fries when you check-in on Yelp. That's how you incentivize a loyal customer base!
author: Trina D.

description: First time eating here. Parking tends to be a challenge in this area. My friends & I stopped by on a Friday night. I was expecting it to be crowded but it wasn't. The service was excellent. The guy that helped us I think was the owner. Nice guy and gave up recommendations. Everything he recommended we ordered. It was all delicious!
author: Jade M.

description: Loved this place! My good friend was craving Boiling Crab, but we didn't have the time or the patience to drive down to San Jose.  In lieu of a day trip, we thought we'd try out this local joint.  It was a wonderful experience - the staff were good-natured, had an excellent sense of humor, and prompt in their service.  Food was quite good.  We played it safe and each got a pound of shrimp: one pound of lemon pepper, and one pound of the Hurricane original flavor.  Both shrimps were absolutely delicious.  They were so fresh that we nearly burnt our fingers, and I was actually quite pleased that they were not served to us in a bag.  I hate having to reach into a nasty, oily plastic bag to get my arms dirty.  We also got a side of green beans, which was flavorful, and we happily chomped on in-between bites of shrimp. For the amount of food we got, the price was relatively reasonable.  I will certainly be back!
author: Jennifer Hom C.

description: The hurricane sauce... Oh. My. Gosh. Spicy, garlicy.... Very Fresh fish, good service, and for the price you get a ton of food. Definitely a must go if you're in the Richmond!
author: Haley P.

description: We've been here three times and it's been very consistent. First time, I ordered shrimp with hurricane sauce, added sausage and corn on the Cobb. It was so spicy I couldn't enjoy it, just felt burning spice all over my lips and throat. However, the Cajun fries and the French bread dipped in the sauce were delicious. Second and third times coming here I ordered shrimp with garlic butter sauce, no spice. It was the best!! It actually reminded me of Giovanni's shrimp truck in Oahu. All shrimp is served head on, she'll on so as you can imagine it's super messy ( which is why you get a bib and wet naps.) the garlic butter sauce is delicious. On our last time coming here we tried the chicken wing and hush puppy appetizers, which I didn't care for. The Asian man working here was very entertaining and made is laugh the whole time. They serve beer and wine ++.  Checked in here with Yelp and got a free order of yummy Cajun fries!! Parking is a challenge in this neighborhood- be prepared.
author: Cyn L.

description: Love this little gem !  They have a great happy hour from 2-6pm! $1 oysters which my friend loved! Very fresh ! When you check- in on Yelp you get free complimentary Cajun fries for dine- in only! I ordered their watermelon iced tea which was also blended perfectly with fresh watermelon. I drank it too fast because it was so good! We also ordered 1 lb. of shrimp with their signature hurricane sauce with medium spice and added additional corn and hot links in there, let me tell you, AMAZING! You gotta suck the juices from the shrimp head , and after peeling dip it back into the sauce for the best flavor! Lastly ordered 1 lb. of the king crab legs for $29. Not too bad. We had to get the garlic butter sauce for the crab of course! No mistakes here! It was to die for! They perfectly pre- cut the crab legs for you but also bring you some shell crackers just in case you need them! Again, once you take the meat out, dip it back into that sauce! You will not regret it! I will definitely be coming back here. Their groupon is definitely worth it as well! $15 for $25 worth for 2 people!
author: Karyn H.

description: An aptly named restaurant, Swamp is possibly the worst restaurant which my wife and I have ever visited in San Francisco. The food here was absolutely atrocious. I don't usually complain but reluctantly told the waitress that I couldn't stomach my crawfish after she noticed that I'd only eaten a couple of bites. The manager stopped by and rudely informed me that I simply didn't understand Cajun food. Little did he know that I've been to New Orleans several times and used to live in Pensacola and San Antonio, two other southern cities which have excellent Cajun food. We had a couple other side dishes and everything was awful. It seems like a tourist spot which falsely boasts Cajun food even though there didn't appear to be any Cajun chef. The cheap, Fisherman's-wharf-esque menu alone should serve as a caveat to the serious diner. Don't let the 4 stars fool you - Yelp uncharacteristically failed us this time. Avoid!!
author: Viajero P.

description: Great! Awesome service. Excellent food. Cajun Crawfish, Crab, Lobster, Calamari, Oysters - had them all, and they were excellent. Many great times here with my girlfriend. High recommended! WE LOVE SWAMP.
author: Nate W.

description: The selling point of Swamp is their Hurricane sauce. So incredibly tasty that it induces salivation. Unfortunately that's all Swamp has got going for it. The price is steep even for SF prices - $14/lb of shrimp? I think their 2-choice shellfish combo is a nice option for some variety. The spiciness difference between the mild and medium was pretty negligible so go ahead and spice it up to your hearts content. The shrimp and mussels tasted fresh so I can't complain. Cat fish fillets didn't taste like catfish, just deep fried fish; wouldn't recommend it. Hush puppies, cajun, and sweet potato fries were all decent and work great as appetizers to share with your table as you wait for your food.
author: Ryan L.

description: Great please if you like Creole style cooking. The Gumbo, Shrimp bucket, & Beignets are recommended!
author: Amnon R.

description: This was the worst place for clam chowder I've been to.  A zero star if I could give it. Ordered New England clam chowder and it was so watery and so flavorless.  Ugh!!! Tasted like a bowl of water with some skim milk in it.  Oh there were 2 bay leaves floating around in it, and still no flavor.  Ordered the happy hour sweet potato yams and asked for ranch.  They brought out a small blob of something that looks like mayonnaise.  I didn't taste it but my hubby was brave enough to dip his fried yam in it and moved on with his ketchup.  So (sigh!), it was the worst Mother's Day lunch I ever had.  My only consolation  is that my sons soccer team won earlier today.  Looking forward to dinner now.  Hopefully dinner will help wipe away what bad lunch memory I had at this place today.  I guess it won't be hard.
author: Michelle L.

description: Hate the name but love the garlic noodles. What a horrible name for a place. But if you don't want to go all the way to perilla get the garlic noodles here. And 15% Off during happy hour(s) 3pm to 6pm. Oh yeah um seafood. They serve that too.
author: Augusto M.

description: it's so hard to find a Cajun place that has good sauce and good shrimp. I finally found swamp and it lives up to my standards. sometimes the shrimp is over cooked and sometimes the sauce is nasty but swamp had them both perfectly. the Cajun fries are also great
author: Robert L.

description: Wonderful food, the best Cajun I have had. We had the shrimp and crawfish with hurricane sauce , BOMB.COM With garlic noodles. If I wasn't so full, we were about to order more. The service was fantastic. Will definitely be returning.
author: Marissa J.

description:
We celebrate a friend's birthday here. There were 10 of us.  In my opinion, Swamp is way better than The Boiling Crab and much closer.  They have their own sauce, "hurricane" which is the bomb.  

The best part was, once the waiter heard it was our friend's birthday, he bought over a huge bottle sake to table and took a sake shot with us. They even have karoake which the owner sang with us!  We had a great time and will come back again.
author: Roadrunner G.

description: Too bad I cannot rate this place with a "skull". This place suck! Super expensive, super bad service and the food is really really really bad. Avoid this place at all cost! I love all the cajun restaurant like boiling crab, kicking crab, etc. this place is at the bottom of the chain. I dont know why this place is highly rated.
author: Kris T.

description: This place is soooo yummy! Really friendly staff and really good food, talk about a win-win. I've only had the crab legs, shrimp and crawfish so far but they are all really good. The garlic noodles are FANTASTIC. You will not be disappointed. I will continue to go back and try more!
author: Gabriela A.

description: Went here yesterday on Saturday March 19 around like 1:40pm. It wasn't busy at all there were about 3 other tables occupied 2 tables with just 2 people and 1 table with 3 people. What I don't understand is the service. It took them 15 minutes to serve us and then another 15 minutes for the fries to come out and then another 15 minutes for them to take our actual order. We ordered another batch of fries and it took 30 minutes for that to come out but with me telling the server that I am still waiting on my fries. It took 45 minutes over all for the actual food to come out while other people that just started coming in got served fast. I've been here a couple times already and it seems like they judge you on how you look if they think you won't be ordering that much because I came in with my niece and they took forever. My other sisters came and we ordered more but this is ridiculous they literally ignored us and took forever with the food! It wasn't even busy. I got the garlic noodle with crawfish and the crawfish was completely dry I think I'll just stick to the plain garlic noodle. Food is good just the service was horrible. Very rude to me and my family. Our bill came out to be almost $200 while the other people that just came went there for happy hour but they had good service while we had none. Don't think me and my family will be going back here for awhile. We even asked for a lobster to go before we finished and it took them 50 minutes! I bet if we didn't even say anything about us waiting for our to go we wouldn't even have gotten it. It's like the stuff we ordered they didn't even write it down and send it to the kitchen!
author: Mary G.

description: Big fan of the shrimp here.  Got a pound of shrimp with the butter sauce and added corn & potatoes...so tasty.  And of course you must order the garlic noodles here, so tasty
author: Dilly M.

description:
The first time I wanted to try Swamp, I was very excited. Found parking right in front and paid for meter. Walked to the door to find out they were closed. CLOSED ON TUESDAYS?! What is this. Went back home to my cravings unsatisfied. A few weeks later I went back on a Thursday. They just opened so my friend and I were seated quickly. 

The first thing we ordered was the cajun fries that we got for free. If you checked in, you get free fries. But anyways, the fries were great. Light, crisp, and just enough seasoning. We also ordered the grilled alligator sausage as an appetizer. It was ok. Not something I would order again, but at least I can say I tried it. And for the main, I ordered a pound of Hurricane Shrimp. Very delicious! Wasn't expecting their sauce to taste so good.

Friendly service. Our waiter was patient and gave good suggestions. I believe the owner was there as well. Checking up with every table and making sure our food was good. 

And to my surprise the bill was cheaper than I had expected. Turns out we came during happy hour, which took of 15%.  Despite swamp being closed on Tuesdays I still give it five stars. Clean restaurant, friendly service, and awesome food. Can't wait to go back.
author: Sheryll V.

description: Their friendly service and comforting food always puts a smile on my face and tummy!!!
author: Pong P.

description: Phenomenal shrimp boil. I've had this type of meal many times around the city and surrounding environs and this is by far the best experience I've had. The owner (I think) was walking around joking with guests and the staff was extremely helpful. Dopest boil in the city.
author: Alexander M.

description:
came on a sat. night. 5 min wait, which is good, but parking was hard to find in the area. 

Ordered 1 lb shrimp, and 1 lb of combo.
shrimp was good and fresh, tasty, not too salty.
1 lb of combo for clam and mussel was less than we expected in quantity, maybe the shells were heavier than we think. But it was not bad for the taste.

Overall taste are within my expectation, but my gf loves it. 

It would be a 4 stars if more clam and mussel for the combo.
author: Eat-Around T.

description: if you're a fan of boiling crab, Swamp does not even come close. came here a couple months ago with some co-workers for dinner & since I'd been having HUGE cravings for boiling crab, I was very excited to try a place close by & according the yelp ratings, comparable to boiling crab. I ordered 1lb of shrimp in the hurricane sauce at a medium spice level along with some Cajun fries. The shrimp was soft & over cooked and the sauce had no spice whatsoever. the fries were mediocre but also, no spice. Honestly, I would not come here again & would much rather make the drive down to sj to satisfy my cravings cuz I was left disappointed after my meal at Swamp.
author: melanie c.

description:
Everything was pretty tasty and well seasoned.
Hurricane boil!!! Get it!!! It's a mixture of all of their other flavors (lemon pepper, garlic butter, and original cajun)...such a great idea! Shrimp and clams were cooked perfectly! We got medium spicy, but it really could be considered mild, so if you like spicy get the spicy habanero AND extra tobasco! 
Hush puppies were fried well and not too oily. They came with an amazing honey butter too!! Garlic noodles were phenomenal!!
Portions were small on the side dishes and appetizers, but still worth getting! 
Service was above average, but it was the grand opening...
I was charged twice for soda even after I asked about refills, so beware! 
They don't give enough napkins (but they will gladly give you more upon request) at the table and don't leave a bowl for shells... Just some small kinks to work out!
author: Jessyca M.

description: Tried this place at 3 in the afternoon and it was so quiet and relaxing.   Had the crawfish garlic noodle with cole slaw and free Cajon fries with Yelp check-in.    Super good.
author: James W.

description: Best place in the city for the occasional indulgence. Simple ambience, nothing fancy but food is great. Our favorites are the hurricane boil with crawfish and garlic noodles!
author: Chandrika G.

description: I really enjoyed my experience at Swamp. Food was good, the price was very satisfactory, and the service was very welcoming. I definitely recommend trying their garlic noodles, alligator sausage, and fried oysters. Their starters are very good.
author: Sonlay V.

description: Butter-garlic sauce @ medium hot was perfect! Alligator sausages were amazing. Service was excellent.
author: Neil B.

description:
heard about this place from a coworker.so instead of going a little bit far like boiling crab...well why not try out this place and see what it has to offer.
we went here to celebrate my bday.it was thursday dinner and there was no line and there were only few customers eating at that time.

So when we went in.(i'm guessing he is the owner) a guy welcome us and ask if we were the one who called for reservations cos he said they reserve the same number of people.and were like no that wasnt us,but he kept insisting it that it kind a felt weird.hahaha
so he was friendly and jokes around so much but it feels awkward and weird.but anyways...
so we ordered almost everything 
Crab-hurricane
Shrimp-hurricane
Shrimp-garlic butter
Clams &mussels -hurricane
Lobster-garlic butter
And the garlic noodle so tasty and good yummy.
They serve everything on plates which is ok.lets save the earth and stop using plastics.lol and besides the taste of the food is what matters not where they put it.

-1star cos of the service.we have to ask for everything we need.we have to ask for some several things from them before they give it. 1example lemon or lime
author: Enah N.

description: Boiling Crab eat yer heart out!  Skip the line and the drive and get yourself to Swamp.  Good grub without the fanfare.  I got a pound of shrimp in hurricane sauce.  Err on the side of caution with the spice level.  Mild was plenty spicy for me.  And this is coming from someone who has eaten wasabi in chunks and taken shots of Sriracha (don't ask why.).  The shrimp was succulent and had that beautiful snap with each bite.  YUM!
author: James R.

description: Came back because creole hurricane sauce was calling my name and it was gorgeous! The owners and everyone else who works here are incredibly sweet. I am always happy to pay their restaurant a visit. Highly highly recommend!!!
author: Linh S.

description: Swamp was a great spot for my first ever crayfish adventure.  Hot tip - check in on Yelp and get a free order of Cajun fries.  They're yummy and spicy, get a cold one to go with the spice.  My table split an order of the alligator sausage because, why not - it's alligator sausage!  It was tasty, kind of a small order but enough that each of the four of use could get a few bites.  For dinner I split an order of the garlic butter crayfish with a side of garlic noodles.  We ordered mild for the sauce and it had quite a kick, plenty enough of a kick for me that's for sure.  Definitely order a side of french bread to sop up all of the delicious sauce at the bottom of the bowl.  The crayfish took some work to eat, but I donned my plastic bib and dug in.  Delicious.  And the garlic noodles on the side were a nice accompaniment.  I left full and happy.
author: Elizabeth W.

description: Amazing food and great great price! A lot better than PPQ. People are great too. Just love the place.
author: Dani N.

description:
great service and really enjoyed the hurricane sauce here. 

however on the night that we went, i had a bad oyster and a lot of the shrimp was stuck to the shell

i would give it another try though since it is one of the better cajun places around the SF area. just hope for fresher seafood next time!
author: Katherine C.

description: Warm napkins. Tasty sauces. Friendly staff. Proactively refill my drink when it's still half full. Food was served in bowls not bags. They checked with us if their food is good or not. Seafood quality is very fresh, definitely not previously frozen.
author: Helen C.

description: Food was ok but the service really need some improvement. Make sure you dress up and order their crab if you expect better service. My boyfriend and I ordered an alligator sausage, 2 sodas ( they forgot to serve and did not apologize when asked for it), Cajun fries, a gumbo with rice and a pound of shrimp, and apparently that was not enough for their attentions, even though they were not busy.
author: Maggie L.

description: You should definitely try it at least once. A variety of options, the sauce is great, and I promise you wouldn't be disappointed. The service is excellent, and they are very friendly and nice. They even have alligator sausage, but I didn't know whether it's halal to eat it or not !!
author: Amr E.

description:
It was our first time here and it was great. The service was definitely great and so was the food. I'm tired of not being able to find parking at either craw station and cajun house, and no way in hell am I driving all the way to san jose for boiling crab (its not worth the gas we spend). I read the reviews before we went and I can tell they took their reviews seriously because the issues other yelpers were complaining about were not present in our dinner. We will definitely be back!

Those who wrote previous reviews, give this place another try. They're still generally new but they definitely made some changes and took your reviews to heart.
author: Katie O.

description: Great food and cool owner. Be sure to check in to get your free cajun fries :)
author: Matt A.

description:
Ladies an gentleman, can we have a round of applause for the best Louisiana shrimp and crawfish restaurant in San Francisco! Whooo! As a fan of the fabled Boiling Crab, we've gone to several restaurants in the city of mediocre sauce or seafood. We have drove pass Swamp several times and I have been curious to try it. Upon arrival at the restaurant, I was quite surprised that it was not the typical generic boiling crab decorations with the wooden pillars and fish nets. Instead, there was a stand with an assortment of seafood laid out for decoration near the entrance, Marci gras mask and beads amidst red walls. In the back of the restaurant, there is  a mini bar.  

We ordered the kusshi/washington oysters for $18 and those were fresh and briny. 
  
There were four flavors : original cajun, garlic butter, lemon butter, and hurricane (the combination of everything) in either no spice, mild, medium, and spicy habanero. My rule of thumb is to always choose the second to spiciest as I usually can take most spices. Next, we choose however much pound of seafood amongst shrimp, mussels, clams, crawfish, and so on. Crawfishes and shrimps are about 12 dollars a pound. I ordered a pound of medium crawfish in the hurricane flavor with a corn thrown in. If you check-in, you get a free side of cajun fries. They were pretty fresh and crispy fries. Once the order came, the crawfishes were very fresh and succulent. Sizes range from small to medium. I would not suggest getting the corn. It was a sweet corn that was not absorbing the sauce what so ever. The sauce itself was pretty spicy as I was continuously reaching for my cup of water. The consistency of the sauce was thin compared to boiling crab, but sweet which reminded me of chinese curry. I suggest ordering a side of baquette. The baquette is also fresh and perfect for dipping. Yum! I have not been this satisfied with my Louisiana crawfish craving in a long time.  
 
The service was great! Our waiter made us feel comfortable with asking him for condiments and such. He was extremely nice.  

I am sold, I am coming back pretty soon!
author: Becky Q.

description: Hurricane ftw! favorite spot in SF for boils, the seafood is always consistent and fresh, also the owner is super cool.
author: Will L.

description: not too shabby, had the hurricane spicy crawdads and clams with garlic noodles. a little more salty for me and it would of  been great. crawdads were huge. the garlic noodles were kind of bland but then again i love everything extra flavorful and salty. service was okay, nothing oustanding. art frames looks like windows, kinda cool!!!
author: Theresa M.

description: Had some reservations about coming here. I mean come on ''swamp'' the food might be ''crap'' But I'm happy to say that the food was pretty good. Unlike Rocking Crawfish this place is low key. Staff is friendly and some days can get pretty crowed. If you're able to find parking come by.
author: Spooky B.

description: Super friendly staff which is why I gave them 3 stars. But my oysters were like rubber and the sausage was basically a hot dog. The hurricane sauce was tasty but a little too sweet for my liking. Would have preferred a spicy broth.
author: William B.

description: Service was great, but food wasn't anything special. I'd only recommend if you don't feel like waiting for boiling crab.
author: Tim L.

description: I love this place. Consistently tasty boils--get the hurricane boil with a pound of shrimp, some potatoes, and corn to get the most bang for your buck. They also make good garlic noodles and have a decent fixed-price option for two people with a Dungeness crab ($49). Decent place for beer, not wine. The fries are meh. Service is decent, and they can accommodate large groups easily.
author: Rachel M.

description: Love love love swamp. I swear I've been coming here at least once a week. The oysters and clams are so fresh and delicious, I always end up ordering another dozen. I usually get the lobster, clams, and shrimp with the garlic butter sauce which is the best I've ever tasted. For appetizers try the chicken wings garlic noodles and fried oysters. Yum. And you can't forget the service!.. Quick and friendly especially the waiter with a great attitude and big smile that always takes good care of  us. Can't go wrong  Definitely a spot worth checkin out
author: Shannon P.

description: I went here for dinner with my family last night and it was the best shrimp I've had in the Bay Area.  I've gone to Cajun House and Shaking Crab, but Swamp blows them out of the water.  The food was not greasy or oily, in comparison to other Cajun/Creole restaurants in/around the city.  The staff was very friendly.  The restaurant is very clean.  I definitely have to come back again, especially for their beignets.  Swamp is my new favorite shrimp place.
author: Michelle D.

description: Went there to see what the hype was about since my cousins are regulars there. Their sauce was consistent. Not too thick nor too saucy. Had a good amount of flavor to it (got the whole sauce combo). Got a pound of crawfish and a corn. Thought it came in a bag, but it came in bowls instead. The bowls kept it super hot. Kinda sucks to burn your fingers while trying to peel the tail. Their spicy habanero has a good kick to it. Good service.
author: Stacey S.

description: This place is really inconsistent with the quality of the seafood.  On a few occasions, the shrimp tasted old, and the meat was mushy.  Aside from that, the sauce is pretty good but it still doesn't compare to Boiling Crab.
author: Tina L.

description: I was a little skeptical about this place at first but love seafood so I decided to check it out anyways. I left so satisfied. Everything was absolutely delicious..very spicy but far exceeded my expectations. We got the crab so our meal ended up being very pricy but well worth it in my opinion. The service was great as well. Everyone was very personable. All and all I am so glad to have found a little gem like this in my neighborhood.
author: Erin A.

description: The Prix-Fixe Dinner for 2 is now $59.00. We ordered the crab with garlic butter sauce and they also have the option for lobster. The service is good too. The place is not too crowded so we did not have to wait to be seated but parking is kind of hard to find.
author: Connie H.

description:
Randomly found Swamp while walking down Geary.  Staff is amazing, prices are good (for fresh seafood) and the food is DELICIOUS. 

This has become one of our go-to places :)
author: Meg R.

description:
Lousy food. Rude employees. Everything we ordered had the same bland taste. Not representative of real Cajun food at all. Every time the older man who works there came to our table he would tell us how good our food was. Um, no, it isn't that good and we'll decide for ourselves thank you. Also, we were having a few drinks (it was the weekend) and when our waitress brought over one of the beers she commented in a snarky tone something to the effect of "I hope you're walking home, not driving". WTF? We told her we were walking home (not that it's any of her business). I could see it if we were acting really intoxicated but we weren't! She better never go to New Orleans if she was shocked by our 2-3 drinks each alcohol consumption. You'd think she'd be happy we were running up the tab. 

End result: We did not feel comfortable there and the food is bleh.  No way I'll ever go back.
author: Mindy H.

description: I came on a Sunday, a little after 6pm, with 2 other friends. At first, I was afraid that there would be a wait since it was a weekend. But when my friends and I arrived, there were quite a few tables and booths available, so we were seated right away. We ordered oysters, shrimp, crab legs, rice, garlic noodles, and sweet potatoe fries. The service was quick, we got our whole order at the same time. It was great that that the shrimp and crab legs came in bowls rather than in plastic bags. And the best part was that the crab legs were already split in the middle, making it easier to break open and get the whole crab meat. I'm so bad at cracking those things open, so this was SUPER convenient for me. That alone would make me come back. The total came out to around $100, which wasn't bad to me. Considering all the food we got. I've went to other places where I barely got a thing that was satisfying, and it cost a lot more. So overall 4 stars.
author: Josephine C.

description: Very warm and casual place. The prices are very reasonable. If you like and can eat craw-fish without losing a finger, you should definitely checkout this place!
author: Mimi S.

description: I tried this place because my friends told me about it. Came here on father's day to take the baby daddy out. We enjoyed the dinner. The young waiter & waitress were nice, they did their job right. We ordered 2 lbs of shrimp with the hurricane flavor. The flavoring was less oily than boiling crab, and your food is served in a bowl instead of a bag. Shrimp tasted fresh and not over cooked. The garlic noodles & cajun fries were good too. I think we'll be coming back here if we're ever craving seafood and in the area.
author: Sara L.

description:
Came here for dinner since the city seems to have a new Cajun place... I came with a friend... not expecting much since the city doesn't have much to offer compared to places in San Jose. BUT OMG! It may not be as good as boiling crab or other places, but it's definitely, in my opinion, the best place so far in San Francisco. Assuming that everything stays the same and the seafood stays fresh, then I won't have to be making my long journeys to San Jose anymore... or as much at least! And guess what!??!! They offer UNLIMITED soda refills!!!! Unlike other Cajun places in the city, they give you just can soda which you have to pay for each one. Being a soda lover myself, I love that it's free refills here!

Okay, onto the food! Ordered 1lb of crawfish, mild hurricane. Nice little kick but very flavorful. Some of the crawfish were tiny though, while some was average sized. I guess it's not their fault, they should consider another vendor of crawfish though. Ordered 2lbs of shrimp, mild hurricane again. Again, very flavorful. Eat it fast because near the end, I guess we let the shrimp soak too long in the sauce (which is pretty hot) so it overcooked the shrimp... so it became chewy in the end. The only sad thing was that they didn't give limes and salt/pepper for you to squeeze and dip into. I'm not sure if it's going to be like that forever or if it's just now... but I hope they consider offering that. Cajun fries was free with checkin on yelp, so woot woot (free.... they just know how to draw me in). Nice and hot, and tasty. The only thing I didn't care too much for during the meal was the garlic noodles. The noodles were like they left it out too long so they all were stuck to each other... also needed more of that garlic flavor or whatever they need to make it taste like garlic noodles. 

Service was excellent, always brought us more napkins, checked on us a few times, and the guy kept refilling my water without me having to ask (then again, it wasn't too busy... so I don't know how they would do if it were busy though). Place is pretty clean and the restrooms seem pretty well maintained. Oh, and they don't serve their food out of plastic bags! At first it didn't seem the same... but I guess it's better since you don't know what kind of chemicals may be leeching from the plastic into your food! Overall, I'm happy that there is finally ONE good Cajun place in San Francisco! Hopefully they keep doing what they're doing cause I'll keep coming back if they do!
author: Johnson S.

description: Not a long wait, we were seated almost immediately. We ordered shrimp, clams, raw oysters, crab and garlic noodles..Delicious! All the seafood was fresh and the hurricane sauce is so good! I will definitely be going back.
author: Kristin M.

description: Went with my family to try a new Cajun place in sf. Honestly the food was just ok. I got a pound of shrimp with the third level of spiciness. It wasn't spicy at all, the flavor was good but the level of heat was minimal almost none. Which was pretty disappointing.  The oysters, Cajun fries, sweet potato fries were good. And the servers were nice and attentive. Maybe I'm use to the places in SJ but I wish I could've found one close to them in the city. All in all this place was eh
author: K C.

description: Swamp is a great addition to the Richmond district bringing very tasteful Louisiana style cajun food. I can't be one to say whether it's traditional or not, but we did bring my brother-in-law who was born and raised on the outskirts of Battonrouge and he had nothing but high praises regarding flavor and variety of options of cooking the dishes so that must say something. Anyways, you can't go wrong trying anything from the appetizer selection such as the hush puppies to alligator sausage to the main specialty of crab, mussels or oysters. It was all great. But whatever you get, you must order the garlic noodles to accompany it. It is a definite must have. Ambience is great with tv screens and the noise level being at a medium. Finally, is the service. Top notch waitresses and waiter giving their undivided attention to the clientele to make sure everyone is happy. Most specifically, Bill. Quite the gentleman introducing himself and interacting with everyone on a personal level, brings that already great experience at Swamp, to a fun and special level. Definitely Bill is what makes Swamp stand out from the rest!
author: Jas P.

description: The food was good and the service was great. It's not somewhere I'd go out of my way to eat at, but if someone wanted to go, I'd be perfectly fine with it.
author: Emily K.

description:
This is our second time to this restaurant and this place rocks!!!  Nothing fancy, but the food is excellent and the service is great!!!  

We started the meal with the Calamari appetizer.  They were yummy!!  My gf saw the Yelp ad about getting the free Cajun Fries.  Those were very good!!!

Ordered the Hurricane mild sauce shrimp and King Crab Legs with Butter Garlic Sauce.  Added a couple of corns in with the crab legs.  If you like spicy shrimp, you will like the Hurricane sauce, has a pretty good kick!!  King Crab Legs with the Butter Garlic Sauce was delicious!!!!  So was the corn drenched in the Butter Garlic Sauce!!!

We also ordered a side of the Garlic Noodles.  These noodles are to die for!!!

Everything was excellent!!!  Can't wait to hit this place again soon!!
author: Guy A.

description: I got the pound of shrimp with corn and sausages as well as the garlic noodles. The noodles were amazing! The shrimp on the other hand didn't seem that fresh when I was eating it. The cajun fries were pretty good too. However as the night went on I noticed that there was really only one waitress that was actually doing her job. Wish I could have just tipped that one person. Overall pretty good though!
author: Ada W.

description: Fantastic establishment with a pretty wicked name! Swamp earned their 5 stars for the excellent service and knowledge of their menu. My friend and I shared the king crab legs with garlic butter, and crawfish with medium level hurricane sauce with a side of garlic noodles... All I gotta say is gosh damn! I found my new favorite Cajun spot! Definitely won't keep it a secret because these guys deserve to be known
author: Jay B.

description:
LOVE, LOVE, LOVEEEE THIS PLACE! I seriously cannot say enough good things about this place. First and foremost, the service is great. I don't know his name, but I think he is the owner (the older Asian gentlemen). He always greets us and continuously checks up on us throughout our meal to make sure that everything is perfect. Bonus points because I feel like his concern for us is genuine. The food itself is great too! Make sure you go when crawfish are in season though. GARLIC NOODLES ARE A MUUUUUUST!! More bonus points because you can get free cajun fries just for checking in here! The best part about this place though? They actually have non-spicy sauces for those of us that are babies and can't handle spiceness. But for those of you that love spicy, they have that too! Overall, I can't get enough of this place, and I can't wait for crawfish season to come back in so I can come in regularly :)

OH and one more bonus point for convient location plus never struggling to find parking

OH OH and one more bonus point for never having to wait at all to get seated!
author: Marlene C.

description: I enjoyed the crawfishes and shrimps. The sauce is so amazing, the workers are right when they told us to dip bread into the sauce. They provide us with real silverware as eating utensils, unlike many places I have gone to that gave me a roll of napkin and paper plate. I will be coming back for more.
author: davee c.

description:
This place has an amazing sauce for the shrimp.  I get the hurricane sauce with spicy habanero.  My husband goes with the medium which is good for people who like spicy but not tooooo spicy.    Get the french bread so you can dunk it in the sauce.   Sometimes I ask for the corn just so I can get more sauce.  :)

I'm surprised this place isn't more packed.    It's the closest thing I can get to Boiling Crab (down in South Bay) without the long lines and 50 minute drive! :)   The prices are pretty good too.   

Their major flaw though is their slow service.  The owner is really nice and friendly as is the staff, BUT they can be pretty slow sometimes.   Otherwise, they are great!
author: JR Kaz K.

description:
Good beers on tap ; Hennepin, Sierra Nevada, Blue moon to name a few.

Crawfish, shrimp, clams, etc.  offered in a variety of different sauces - from butter/garlic to the spicy Hurricane.  Awesome garlic noodles - we usually order two or three servings.

Great service!
author: Ed L.

description: My number one place to go to! I always order pick up and swamp is always on point. Thank u!
author: Sara F.

description: Kinda miss Perilla being right here, but Swamp was pretty good. Not a huge fan of crawfish but I love me some crab and shrimp. Went here for my mom's boyfriend's birthday last month, even brought a cake that the guy happily cut and served for us. I tried alligator sausage which was a highlight, just to say I've had it, but it was like any other sausage taste-wise. Crab was delicious although the legs were on the skinnier side. Shrimp was great - big and juicy. Had a couple Blue Moons (I wish they had a full bar). Service was good - fair prices for seafood. I think they have a Happy Hour too but we came a bit later. Nice to have a place like this in the neighborhood.
author: Lauren Q.

description: I will be back! The gator sausage was great, the garlic noodles were tasty, and the shrimp tasted very fresh.
author: Nick R.

description:
Must haves: Alligator sausage and shrimp boil (lemon-pepper and hurricane flavors are the best)

Unless you really love crawfish, I'd stick with the shrimp boil since there's way more meat in the shrimp.

Add a side order of your favorite starch (mine was the french bread) and you're all set.
author: Kai C.

description:
pros:  people would like the taste of the sauce, the shrimp is big, the service was good and attentive, and the place is clean. 

other than that, i was really disappointed by this place. i'm not expecting boiling crab, nothing can be the same ive realized, but the PORTIONS were so small. 

1 lb of shrimp: the shrimp were big, but it really did not fit 1 lb, maybe 3/4 of a lb

my friend paid $1 for potatoes, and only half a small potato came. that is ridiculous. at least be generous with your sides

the cajun fries are tasty, but i wouldnt call it cajun. it's more like thicker softer fries wtih salt and pepper and some spices, but not what you think is "cajun." plus the portions were half of boiling crab's fries. 

this would be a nice place for richer folks to enjoy some seafood in some fancy sauce bowl, but for the rest of us who want to get our moneys worth with some good food, it is definitely not worth it.
author: Emily M.

description: Yummy! Delicious and flavorful. Just be careful that all marinades are extremely spicy. We got the mild and it was still pretty hot! Customer service was great as well. Will be back.
author: Mary B.

description:
This review is not so much for the food but the terrible dining experience had by both me and my girlfriend. Food was the last thing on our mind when the musician sexually harasses your girlfriend before the entrees even come out! And I mean not just making a couple jokes he was making extremely crude comments "your pu$$y is going to tear it up!"  within earshot of 5 year old kids. Luckily the guy had no voice and so his voice hardly carried at all.  I mentioned this to the waiter, letting him that his musician was a lawsuit waiting to happen.. His response was to laugh it off and comment that it was the guy's first night and he was crazy. The waiter went on to say that "the musician probably would not be invited back."  After all that we put up with he didn't give even offer us a comped dessert or anything he just brought up the check and said see you next time. Sorry buddy there won't be a next time!

FYI: The soda machine was flat and the portions were small.
author: Sasha A.

description: I love it! The oysters were wonderful! And they're half price during happy hour! Also loved the pro'boy sandwich! Will come back when I visit the city again!!
author: Vanessa D.

description:
three words. garlic butter sauce. sooooooooooo good. 

i love this place. the only sauce i wasn't a fan of was the lemon pepper. it was purely lemon and lacked any other type of flavor. other than that, everything was fantastic. very fresh. 

awesome customer service as well. 

ps don't forget to suck on those shrimp heads. YA'LL DON'T KNOW WHAT YOU'RE MISSING OUT ON.
author: Alyssa L.

description:
Swamp was a new Cajun seafood place that tried to follow the likes of Boiling Crab so I gave it a try. They gave us a bib and covered the tables with paper, so I didn't mind getting a little messy.
We ordered a dungeness crab, a pound of shrimp, a pound of crawfish, cajun fries, garlic noodles, corn, the alligator sausages and a dozen oysters. To start, the oysters were so-so but the cajun fries were perfectly seasoned. The garlic noodles were decent but not spectacular. I was excited to try the alligator sausages. They were delicious but did not taste any different than a well-made pork sausage.
Now to the seafood. The dungeness crab was probably about 2 lbs and tasted very fresh. It might have been my favorite part of the meal. The shrimp were big and tasted pretty fresh as well. We ordered the crawfish because that was what they were known for. That was a disappointment, however. The crawfish were definitely NOT FRESH and were very small. There was barely much to eat after taking the head and shell off. In half of the crawfish I ate, the meat was falling apart and not chewy, telltale signs that they have been sitting around in the back for a while.
I will only come back for the dungeness crab and the shrimp, but I think there are better options in the Bay Area. FYI a Rockin Crawfish location just opened in this area.
author: Alfred L.

description: Swamp was a lot of fun and the food was delicious!  If you're looking to get down and dirty with fresh seafood, this is a must.
author: Adrian K.

description: Food is great but they consistently screw up our order and are rude about it.
author: Diane R.

description: Good alligator sausage! Yum. The shrimp and lobster are also delicious. Prepare to get messy.
author: Ashley F.

description: At Swamp, I had the opportunity and the honor to try the fried oysters and fried calamari. The fried oyster had a light and crispy texture and was excellently complimented by the hot, but not too hot, cocktail sauce which is made in house (I was even given the recipe by the gentleman who makes it). The fried calamari came in the same light, crunchy batter, but still maintained the slightly chewy quality of well done fried calamari. The staff was extremely courteous with which I shared quite a few laughs. My meal was paired with Blue Moon beer which was seved properly with a slice of orange.
author: Christopher A.

description: Crawfish and muscles and oyster and alligator and ooooooh man, the garlic noodles. Btw, this is coming from a person who doesn't usually eat/like seafood. That says something.
author: Shannon C.

description: It's great having a place like this within walking distance. Molto bene.
author: Tony P.

description: This place was really good. Upon entering, we were greeted a couple seconds late by what seems to be one of the owners? Super nice and friendly. He found out it was our first time and welcomed us. I found that to be really good customer service for some reason.. Anyways, we received our shrimp and clams in the Cajun sauce in medium. The portions were huge and the sauce was so good that I would drink it. The oysters were also very fresh but it was a little on the pricey side. We received free Cajun fries since we used the yelp check in. They forgot about it but they quickly gave it to us afterwards. One of the waitresses was really nice and accommodating, checking up on us and making sure we were taken care of. The other waitress, however, had a smug look on her face the whole time. She seemed really unhappy to be working there and never once did she smile. That was a bit of a buzzkill to my dinner, it's like you can't even pretend to be happy even if you're having a bad day? Other than that, me and my man were full but we did get stomach pains couple hours later. We actually expect that when we are eating Cajun food but this happened way sooner than expected. The costs are on the pricey side but it is delicious that I would return back. The owners are really nice and I wouldn't not come back just because of the unfriendly waitress.
author: Brenda K.

description:
Good:  Service is good.  Food is also good (though not as good as boiling crab).  Place is new. 

Not so good:  A little bit expensive. We had similar meal at boiling crab and paid around $50.  At here, we paid about $70.  (Though I think it might be because they have to compensate for the high rent in SF)

The suggestion:  I think as a new business, the restaurant should consider to put in more gimmes, promotions and lower price tag.  Attract more people to come first to get your name out.  Throw in some free stuff (like appetizer, ice cream desserts, etc...)  These promotions and free stuff should not cost a lot, and it can be made up by margin from returned customers.  Look at shabuway as a prime example.  They try to match up everything with their competitor, and then on top they throw in free refill on vegetables, and free green tea cream brulee.  It won many competitor customers over and returned.  I am throwing in these suggestions because I really like their services and like to help on new business.
author: Alex D.

description:
We ordered the fried fish, wings, one pound of shrimp, corn, potatoes ,and sausage..

The fried fish had more batter than fish

The wings were so so, it was six wings for six dollars so a dollar a wing not worth it, they were average to small size. I have had wings at other places that were much larger.  

The shrimp was good size , two prices of potatoes for $1.00. 6 pieces of sausage for 2.50 and a half of corn for .75cents.   So $17 for the shrimp, potatoes, sausage and corn. The hurricane sauce was good.

I would not order the fried fish or wings again sine is was ok.
author: Frances L.

description: My New favorite Crawfish spot in SF. No wait on a friday night, and they actually serve the dishes in bowls and plates, not buckets, bags and baskets like the other crawfish spots.
author: Andrey P.

description: Fresh seafood! A little pricey for their small portions.  I prefer this establishment more than red crawfish.
author: Koalie W.

description: Not sure what happened but my first time was great, however when I revisit Swamp, the taste was lacking.  My hurricane sauce was watered down and was not as tasty as the first visit.  Maybe they had a different cook or something but the place was definitely not busy.  What I can say is that their sweet potato fries are much tastier than the cajun fries.  I would not recommend ordering the garlic butter sauce, it does not have much flavor.  I hope my next visit would not be the same as the last because I thought, I might've just found a great seafood establishment like boiling crab.
author: Ann L.

description: Finally a good spot in SF. No need to drive to Boiling Crab anymore.
author: Michele L.

description: Prices were higher than online menu. Shrimp was undercooked where blood splattered when removing heads. Never seen that before. King crab good but again priced higher than online menu. Lastly,  my guests and I did individual Yelp check-ins for free beignets but gave one per table. Check in says one per person.
author: Jillian R.

description: I like that you get free fries for checking in. The chinese in me loves free anything. LOL. With that said, the real reason I come back is because the food is good. Their sauce is thicker and has a hint of lemon grass. I only really like to repeat spots that are consistently good. Just a plus that they 1. in the neighborhood and 2. a family owned business which I fully support
author: Elisa M.

description: I see what they're going for here - something a little nicer than shrimp/clams/corn served in a plastic bag on wax paper - and I definitely appreciate the step up from a down home backyard boil; however, the taste left something to be desired.  I did not like their flavoring, as it seemed overly sinus clearing from their habanero flavoring.  I guess since I'm critiquing the flavor, it really depends on each person's palette.  The service was attentive, the decor was nice and not as cluttered as others  who share their business model, and the seafood for the most part seemed fresh, save a few shrimp (but those could have been fresh but overcooked in the bowl - maybe).  Not a fan, but no real complaint other than I didn't like the taste of their sauce.
author: Kim N.

description: I had the garlic boiled crayfish.  Definitely flavorful but the critters were on the small size.  Lots of work for little reward.  As for the alligator sausage, it was alright.  Tasted more pork than reptile.  I think aside from being different, it's not something I would seek out for a dinner option.  It might be better suited for a night out with guys...
author: MTBer I.

description: This place is amazing! I love coming here, the food is always great (go garlic butter!), and the staff is friendly. Always ordered the King Crab Legs. Do it!
author: G K.

description: Ok - not great - concept worth a try - had the everything broth with shrimp and andouille sausage - was one step below super spicy and it was "medium" - just lacked that complexity you expect in New Orleans' inspried food.  The slaw was rather soggy and disappointing as well as the corn tasted like it had been sitting for a day or so - so that was not good.  If they can dig down and work on the basics, could be a fun restaurant, however, they did fail at the basics and were ok on the main dish.
author: Richard D.

description: Do NOT get the gumbo! While it has a few - very few - lumps of tasty seafood and sausage, 95% is thick, worthless gunk.  The fried calamari was good, also the seafood bengets.  Good Cajun fries too.  Those around us seemed to enjoy the boils but I'm too lazy to want to do my own shucking.  I should have gotten oysters too.
author: Roger H.

description: So I feel bad for the low rating but not really after the circumstances. So I wanted seafood and decided to come in wit the BF. He's a professional cook and has been for over 8 years now. And I have been a chef and cook in high end Michelin star kitchens. Saying that, I want everyone to know that we know what we're taking about. It's basic shit, Anyways, ordered the shrimp n mussel combo. Shrimp we're good, but the mussels were in the older side. Not "bad" yet, but close to. Shrimp were good though. Got the free check in fries. Spicy, but nothing to complain about. And then our king crab legs came. I took a bit and already had garlic noodles in my mouth so when I swallowed I had this odd taste in my mouth. I took another small bite of just crab alone and spit it out. Grabbed another from our bowl, opened the shell, and put my nose in it. To my disgust, it smelled like straight bleach. Burned the freak at of my nose. I let my bf smell it and the pure look of "wtf omg" on his face made my stomach sink knowing that I already swallowed a bit of rotten ammonia crab. I mean like this wasn't even SLIGHTY off. This crab was bad days ago!!!!! How the shit do you do that!????? No idea. So I told the waitress. She apologized and took it back to get me a fresh one. Then came back with some stupid bullshit answer of her saying that the cooks said it smelled like that cause it probably wasn't cooked all the way. I just sat silent thinking, if this girl knew who we were she wouldn't dare give some excuse so stupid that would try to OK rotten seafood. Moving on, they comped the garlic noodles. Big whoop. The whole damn meal should have been comped. Right after we ate, I ran across the street to walgreens to get pepto bismol and other stomach relaxers in case I would fall ill from my bite, but luckily all I experienced was some odd stomach cramps that kept me from sleeping that night. But I'll take that over being flat out glued to the toilet and having to go to the hospital!!! I would never go back. And I'll never let any friends or family try this place. That's just scary. Hope this review helps everyone out there.
author: mel l.

description: Just ate here. And the food is pretty great. I ordered the crawfish, shrimps, and calms. I know sounds like a lot but I came with friends too so it was actually a good amount. We also got free Cajun fries for checking in. Lastly a side of garlic fries. We got the seafood hurricane style and medium spicy. We thought that would be pretty spicy already since the next level would be spicy habanero. It was pretty mild to me but I'm thai so I guess my spicy tolerance is just too high. Even though it was spicy every tasted awesome. The owner at least I'm assuming was the owner came over a few times and checked on us. He was very nice and helped make the experience even better. Will definitely be back. Maybe I'll try spicy habanero next time.
author: Sara S.

description: My bf and I ordered crawfish in  hurriane sauce,  shrimp in garlic butter,  garlic noodles,  and cajun fries.  The hurricane sauce has a sweet and sour taste and not the cajun taste.  The garlic butter sauce tasted very rich.  The garlic noodle was good with a hint of garlic taste. Canjun fries was ok. Howevee,  service was great.  The server cones by our table a few times to make sure evwrything was okay.  It was worth a try to dine here but I would definately pick Rockin Crawfish over Swamp.
author: Yen M.

description: Great food, but be aware: if you order the plain crawfish boil, and ask for it to be not spicy, it will still be spicy! They first boil it in their original cajun boil, and then rinse in plain water. I am allergic to peppers so this almost closed my breathing passages... But lemon garlic shrimp is delicious!
author: Svetlana D.

description: Shrimp (Garlic butter, medium spicy) + Garlic Noodles + Bread... YUM
author: Sofia R.

description:
GF and I stopped in here for an early dinner.  We live close by so had been curious about this new place.

Food's pretty decent.  We ordered a pound of crayfish with sausage, cajun fries, hushpuppies.

The crayfish were pretty good though I had forgotten how much of a pain it is to eat them.  Too much work for too little meat, IMO.  If we would go there again I think we would get the shrimp.

We got the hurricane, habanero boil.  Good flavor and nice broth to dip the hushpuppies in.

The fries, as mentioned in another review, were uninspiring. Pretty mediocre actually.

Hushpuppies were OK.  They came with this honey butter stuff that was pretty solidified in the ramekin.  I just dipped them in the ketchup and boil/broth and they were pretty good that way.

If I go there again I will order shrimp or mussels, some french bread to dip in the broth, and maybe try the alligator sausage.  

Service was friendly and prompt.  Decent place to get some shellfish.
author: David M.

description: Been here a number of times. The crawfish beignets are bomb and melt in your mouth.  The hurricane sauce is nice and spicy and the fried oyster po'boy is fantastic. Service has always been great and there is usually some type of game on at the bar.  Can't wait to go back soon.
author: Andrew C.

description: Swamp is amazingggggggg! Got the hurricane sauce and it was so delightful! Perfectly garlicky just how I like it. The fries were also really good and great service to top it all off. Way better than boiling crab or any other crawfish joint in the city.
author: Trang N.

description: Good place to go in the city for crawfish boil. I have yet to find better in the city.  Attentive and friendly service, decent shrimp boil, good value for money, and you sit comfortably. Nothing to complain about. Good place to know exist if you crave cajun crawfish boil.
author: George L.

description:
I came here with my husband.
The food is nothing special. We got the craw-fish and the mussels. The mussels were not so good.
Even the service was not great. It took half an hour to receive the food. It looked like they forgot us.
There are better restaurants that serve the same things in the same neighborhood.
author: LAURA D.

description: My boyfriend and I came here for Cajun boil and we weren't disappointed! The Hurricane boil flavor is just spicy enough ... The crab legs were pre-cracked making it really easy to remove the juicy meat soaked in great spicy sauce." Can't wait to come back and try the clams."
author: Janelle M.

description: just as tasty as Boiling crab but a closer commute! definately reccomend!!
author: Kalana W.

description: I has the pound of shrimps with the garlic butter sauce and it was very good ... Service need to be faster though
author: Ahmed E.

description: The food was delicious and fresh. The service was excellent. Waitress were very friendly. Will come back
author: jane l.

description: Had to wait soooooo long for my food and they barely give u any dammmm oyster skimped me like wahhhhh!!!!!
author: Donavan D.

description:
first I have to say I went to five cajun resturants, and The Kickin Crab is the best. and this one is the worst. we ordered two pound of crawfishes, one pound of shrimp and one pound of clams. they only gave us so little garlic sauce that we almost just ate the seafoods without sauce. They should have done the same as many other cajun resturants, use a plastice bag to serve and put more sauce. and the sauce wasn't that good neither. the sauce was too thick....overall, I personally wont' recommend my friends to go there. 
I wonder if they did not gave us full amount of seafoods that we ordered. we ordered total four pounds of seafoods, but we felt like there was only three pounds food.
THUMB DOWN.
author: Xing C.

description: Authentic NOLA fare. We had a crawfish and shrimp boil with potatoes and corn and an order of garlic noodles. Delicious, the sauce with the boil was combo and we went for Medium spicy, glad we did! Plenty spicy and lots of flavor. Super service, nice and clean. Will definitely come again.
author: Macrooster M.

description: We saw this place in the neighborhood and thought we'd give it a try since we've never tried cajun food before. The place was pretty fast, reasonable, and the boil was pretty good (we got crayfish and shrimp). The gumbo we ordered was kind of grossly thick and overly flowered, but generally this place was good. Also got free cajun fries with our yelp check in!
author: Valerie A.

description: Went to Swamp today. Decor is kind of worn. But the food is excellent. My friend had the chowder and I had the spicy sausage po'boy. We really, really loved the watermelon ice tea (but no free refills!).
author: Susan P.

description: Great place if your craving for seafood but the ambience is just okay that's why I gave them 4 stars instead of 5.Staff are very friendly and would like to come back again.
author: Aries G.

description: Excellent lobster in lemon butter sauce. Great customer service
author: Colleen Y.

description: LOVED THIER FOOD. Its crab season yowww ... in 653326633533 different flavors yow.. naming a few like ..Cajun .. garlic butter.. volcano spices. The manager is great. He was very friendly and the service was on top of things.
author: Sulaiman B.

description: Came here for a birthday dinner on an early Sunday evening. It was not crowded at all. My family and I ordered gumbo, cajun fries, garlic noodles, and shrimp with the hurricane sauce. Everything came out relatively quick. Cajun fries were good, wasn't too salty. Gumbo was alright, it seemed to lack more flavor. Shrimp and hurricane sauce was okay. The sauce has a water like consistency but the shrimp were huge! The sauce I believe is a mixtures of garlic butter and lemon pepper, did not really wow me. My favorite dish was the garlic noodles. I felt that the noodles had the right amount of garlic flavor and more importantly, not oily. Customer service was good, they kept refilling our waters, asked how our food was, and asked if we needed anything else. They do not have dessert here so they can't sing happy birthday unless you bring your own cake. Well our server said he would sing if we had brought our own cake haha.
author: Brigitte M.

description: Solid 4 stars. Yummy crab yummy crawfish. Friendly service.
author: Amber M.

description: Place is solid!  The service is a little iffy, but the food makes up for it!  great deal on Blue Moon on tap!!!
author: John K.

description: seafood was fresh and meaty.. they have they're own little twist on the cajun flavor.. slightly sweeter and a slightly asiany and curry-like aftertaste but still packed full of cajun punch.. fried oysters were perfect! will be back!
author: M C.

description: Their garlic butter sauce is definitely the best. I've tried Boiling Crab and Cajun House also and Swamp is definitely up there. I've tried the raw oysters, raw clams, calamari, crawfish, lobster, crab, mussels, gumbo, and garlic noodles (that's pretty much everything). Definitely coming back. My go-to: raw oyster shooters and garlic butter lobster with garlic noodles. This place will not disappoint!
author: Allen D.

description: Thank god there is something new in the hood!!! Can you say sick of Chinese and sushi!!! Came here with the fam and loved it everything from oysters to alligator sausage! For people who complained about beer selection and spice maybe try a bar or not eating CAJUN food. Owner and servers were friendly and welcoming. Absolutely going back!!!
author: Misty W.

description: This place was beyond bad. Every thing from crawfish to crab and the Garlic noodles was terrible and had no taste. Stay away from this place. The orange juice was acceptable because you cannot ruin it, after all its OJ.  It seems as though they got the seasoning from walgeens and even screwed that one up. The shrimp was OK but you had to be a tap dancing retard to fuck it up. I don't know who's bright idea it was to put 4 TVs in one corner. The only bright side was a nice looking Romanian waitress that alone deserves the one star that I'm giving to this poor tasting establishment. The questionable alligator sausage was OK and tasted like pork. The cook recommended us to try the French bread which felt like it was bought from Safeway and well it was definitely toasted. The beer selection was non existent, you get a choice of 4. Stay away from it, it was disappointing, stick to crawdaddy in San Jose or rocking  crawfish in oakland.
author: Leon S.

description: Wow!  This place was great!  First the food... we had oysters, crawfish and shrimp and cajun fries.  Everything was very good! We also tried the fried oysters,,but that was not a winner- but leave that more up to personal preference on taste or raw vs. cooked oysters. We also had some bread which was standard French bed :)  Ok now for the service...As many people noted before, some of the servers were a little much...but- I think thats just the nerves of recently opening.  We chatted with them since we casually sat at the bar for dinner and after a bit- they relaxed and thats when it really got good.  Charlie- the manager I thing- was AWESOME!!!!  He and the BF chatted about  oysters and what not and it was nice that he actually knew about the cuisine they were serving.  He was supper friendly and we were hooked.  We live across town but will make the trip over for sure!  Lastly...the pricing!  All I can say is that $10 for a half dozen GOOD QUALITY oysters..man that is worth the drive alone.  Very cool spot and I think as more people hear about it and the staff see that people like their food and restaurant- it will only  get better.
author: Claudia V.

description:
coming from someone who eats at boiling crab at sacramento once every few months, this place wasn't very impressive

the fries and shrimp were not as tasty as boiling crab's. it left me wanting some more flavor.....even though i got the "hurricane" boil, which included everything. 

the service was very good though. one of the employees (i believe his name is bill) told us how checking in to swamp via yelp would give us free fries.
author: Alvin L.

description: The owner was really nice to us. Very friendly and always coming to our table joking around with us. The garlic noodle is the absolute best at this place but aside from that, the seafood is nothing special that is worth dying for.
author: Kevin C.

description: Had a great dinner here last night. The staff was very friendly & attentive & everything was Delish! I had the Alaskan King Crab in garlic/butter w/corn on the cob & my friends had the shrimp. We shared the cole slaw, french bread, garlic noodles & hush puppies. My favorite was the hush puppies--so good! I highly recommend.
author: Jane W.

description:
great tasting food! great customer service!

been to similar places and this one by far taste the best.

their staff is very attentive.

hurricane sauce is the best! but be warned, even the "mild" sauce has a pretty good kick in it. can't imagine how hot the Spicy Habanero would be...

definitely will go there again and again.

will recommend this place to friends and family!
author: Mike L.

description: Came here for dinner on a Saturday night and  the service was great. The place was huge and the food  here is pretty decent. It's not your traditional Boiling Crab but there was definitely favor. We had the clams, shrimp and crawfish with the hurricane sauce and it wasn't as spicy as we thought but still good. I really like how they give you mounts of sauce that you can eat it with rice and garlic noodles and not have that butterly oil taste like other places do. Overall, great service and I will come back for more.
author: Nikki L.

description: We went to Swamp last night for dinner and I was highly impressed. The food was awesome and the service was even better! We had the crab and oyster appitizers($6 a piece, cheap)  which were amazing. We also had the crawfish boil ($12, cheap) with the Hurricane sauce and french bread. The crawfish were yummy and the sauce...the sauce was devine. We used our french bread to dip in the remaining sauce. They were so friendly and completely exceeded my expectations. I am going back this weekend and taking my son, I know he will love it! Thank you to my amazing server and all the staff!
author: Kathy F.

description: Just returned from eating a fresh crab dinner here, and it was absolutely delicious!  We live in the neighborhood and have been walking by this place for over a year, but thought it looked like a chain, so we didn't try it until tonight.  Clearly a wrong impression--food was exceptionally good and not like anything we've had elsewhere in the city.  We had half a dozen delicious oysters and the fixed price crab dinner.  Each course showed a lot of effort, and could have stood on its own.  The crab was perfectly cooked, very fresh and not overdone, and the sauce was amazing, very French.  It was perfect over the garlic noodles.  Cole slaw was creamy, crisp, really good, and the clam chowder had lots of clams, and potatoes that were tender but still in chunks.  All of this for a 15% discount because we got there during Happy Hour!  Service was excellent, not rushed, but you didn't have to wait a long time for the next course.  This would be a very fun place to come with a group or family.
author: Nancy K.
